attenuation = 1/(a0 + d*a1 + d^2*a2) where d = distance to light.
member.param: The distance to evaluate.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Light.SpotAngleRadians
member.summary:
Gets or sets the spot angle in radians.
Ignored for non-spot lights.
angle = 0 to pi/2 (0 to 90 degrees).

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Light.SpotExponent
member.summary: The spot exponent varies from 0.0 to 128.0 and provides an exponential interface for controling the focus or concentration of a spotlight (like the OpenGL GL_SPOT_EXPONENT parameter). The spot exponent and hot spot parameters are linked; changing one will change the other. A hot spot setting of 0.0 corresponds to a spot exponent of 128. A hot spot setting of 1.0 corresponds to a spot exponent of 0.0.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Light.HotSpot
member.summary: The hot spot setting runs from 0.0 to 1.0 and is used to provides a linear interface for controling the focus or concentration of a spotlight. A hot spot setting of 0.0 corresponds to a spot exponent of 128. A hot spot setting of 1.0 corresponds to a spot exponent of 0.0.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.AreaMassProperties.WorldCoordinatesMomentsOfInertia
member.summary: The moments of inertia about the world coordinate axes. X = integral of (y^2 + z^2) dm Y = integral of (z^2 + x^2) dm Z = integral of (z^2 + y^2) dm.
member.remarks: What is meant by "moments of intertia" varies widely in textbooks and papers. The values returned here are the integrals listed in the Summary section. Some applications may want the values from WorldCoordinatesSecondMoments instead of the values returned here.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.AreaMassProperties.WorldCoordinatesMomentsOfInertiaError
member.summary: Uncertainty in world coordinates moments of inertia calculation.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.AreaMassProperties.WorldCoordinatesRadiiOfGyration
member.summary: Radii of gyration with respect to world coordinate system. X = sqrt(integral of (y^2 + z^2) dm/M) Y = sqrt(integral of (z^2 + x^2) dm/M) Z = sqrt(integral of (z^2 + y^2) dm/M)
member.remarks: What is meant by "radii of gyration" varies widely in textbooks and papers. The values returned here are the integrals listed in the Returns section.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.AreaMassProperties.CentroidCoordinatesSecondMoments
member.summary: Second moments with respect to centroid coordinate system. X = integral of (x-x0)^2 dm Y = integral of (y-y0)^2 dm Z = integral of (z-z0)^2 dm where (x0,y0,z0) = centroid.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.AreaMassProperties.CentroidCoordinatesSecondMomentsError
member.summary: Uncertainty in centroid coordinates second moments calculation.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.AreaMassProperties.CentroidCoordinatesMomentsOfInertia
member.summary: Moments of inertia with respect to centroid coordinate system. X = integral of ((y-y0)^2 + (z-z0)^2) dm Y = integral of ((z-z0)^2 + (x-x0)^2) dm Z = integral of ((z-z0)^2 + (y-y0)^2) dm where (x0,y0,z0) = centroid.
member.remarks: What is meant by "moments of intertia" varies widely in textbooks and papers. The values returned here are the integrals listed in the Summary section. Some applications may want the values from WorldCoordinatesSecondMoments instead of the values returned here.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.AreaMassProperties.CentroidCoordinatesMomentsOfInertiaError
member.summary: Uncertainty in centroid coordinates moments of inertia calculation.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Matrix.RowReduce(System.Double,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Row reduces a matrix to calculate rank and determinant.
member.param: (>=0.0) zero tolerance for pivot test. If a the absolute value of a pivot is <= zeroTolerance, then the pivot is assumed to be zero.
value of determinant is returned here.
value of the smallest pivot is returned here.
member.returns: Rank of the matrix.
member.remarks: The matrix itself is row reduced so that the result is an upper triangular matrix with 1's on the diagonal.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Matrix.RowReduce(System.Double,System.Double[],System.Double@)
member.summary: Row reduces a matrix as the first step in solving M*X=b where b is a column of values.
member.param: (>=0.0) zero tolerance for pivot test. If the absolute value of a pivot is <= zero_tolerance, then the pivot is assumed to be zero.
an array of RowCount values that is row reduced with the matrix.
the value of the smallest pivot is returned here.
member.returns: Rank of the matrix.
member.remarks: The matrix itself is row reduced so that the result is an upper triangular matrix with 1's on the diagonal.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Matrix.RowReduce(System.Double,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d[],System.Double@)
member.summary: Row reduces a matrix as the first step in solving M*X=b where b is a column of 3d points.
member.param: (>=0.0) zero tolerance for pivot test. If the absolute value of a pivot is <= zero_tolerance, then the pivot is assumed to be zero.
An array of RowCount 3d points that is row reduced with the matrix.
The value of the smallest pivot is returned here.
member.returns: Rank of the matrix.
member.remarks: The matrix itself is row reduced so that the result is an upper triangular matrix with 1's on the diagonal.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Matrix.BackSolve(System.Double,System.Double[])
member.summary: Solves M*x=b where M is upper triangular with a unit diagonal and b is a column of values.
member.param: (>=0.0) used to test for "zero" values in b in underdetermined systems of equations.
The values in B[RowCount],...,B[B.Length-1] are tested to make sure they are within "zeroTolerance".
member.returns: Array of length ColumnCount on success. null on error.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Matrix.BackSolvePoints(System.Double,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d[])
member.summary: Solves M*x=b where M is upper triangular with a unit diagonal and b is a column of 3d points.
member.param: (>=0.0) used to test for "zero" values in b in underdetermined systems of equations.
The values in B[RowCount],...,B[B.Length-1] are tested to make sure they are "zero".
member.returns: Array of length ColumnCount on success. null on error.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.MeshingParameterTextureRange
member.summary: Defines how to pack render/meshes textures.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.MeshingParameterTextureRange.Unset
member.summary: This value is not set.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.MeshingParameterTextureRange.UnpackedUnscaledNormalized
member.summary: Rach face has a normalized texture range [0,1]x[0,1]. The normalized coordinate is calculated using the entire surface domain. For meshes of trimmed surfaces when the active area is a small subset of the entire surface, there will be large regions of unused texture space in [0,1]x[0,1]. When the 3d region being meshed is far from being square-ish, there will be a substantual amount of distortion mapping [0,1]x[0,1] texture space to the 3d mesh.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.MeshingParameterTextureRange.PackedScaledNormalized
member.summary: Each face is assigned a texture range that is a subrectangle of [0,1]x[0,1]. The subrectangles are mutually disjoint and packed into into [0,1]x[0,1] in a way that minimizes distortion and maximizes the coverage of [0,1]x[0,1]. When the surface or surfaces being meshed are trimmed, this option takes into account only the region of the base surface the mesh covers and uses as much of [0,1]x[0,1] as possible. (default)

This method is called with argument true when class user calls Dispose(), while with argument false when the Garbage Collector invokes the finalizer, or Finalize() method.
You must reclaim all used unmanaged resources in both cases, and can use this chance to call Dispose on disposable fields if the argument is true.
Also, you must call the base virtual method within your overriding method.
member.param: true if the call comes from the Dispose() method; false if it comes from the Garbage Collector finalizer.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshingParameters.ClosedObjectPostProcess
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not to post process non-closed meshes that should be closed. If the Brep being meshed is closed, JaggedSeams = false, and ClosedObjectPostProcess = true, and the resulting mesh is not closed, then a post meshing process is applied to find and close gaps in the mesh. Typically the resulting mesh is not closed because the input Brep has a geometric flaw, like loops in trimming curve.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.CreateIcoSphere(Rhino.Geometry.Sphere,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructs a icospherical mesh. A mesh icosphere differs from a standard UV mesh sphere in that it's vertices are evenly distributed. A mesh icosphere starts from an icosahedron (a regular polyhedron with 20 equilateral triangles). It is then refined by splitting each triangle into 4 smaller triangles. This splitting can be done several times.
member.param: The input sphere provides the orienting plane and radius.
The number of times you want the faces split, where 0 <= subdivisions <= 7. Note, the total number of mesh faces produces is: 20 * (4 ^ subdivisions)
member.returns: A welded mesh icosphere if successful, or null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.CreateQuadSphere(Rhino.Geometry.Sphere,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructs a quad mesh sphere. A quad mesh sphere differs from a standard UV mesh sphere in that it's vertices are evenly distributed. A quad mesh sphere starts from a cube (a regular polyhedron with 6 square sides). It is then refined by splitting each quad into 4 smaller quads. This splitting can be done several times.
member.param: The input sphere provides the orienting plane and radius.
The number of times you want the faces split, where 0 <= subdivisions <= 8. Note, the total number of mesh faces produces is: 6 * (4 ^ subdivisions)
member.returns: A welded quad mesh sphere if successful, or null on failure.

member.summary: Constructs a mesh from a surface

settings used to create the mesh

member.summary: Construct a mesh patch from a variety of input geometry.
member.param: (optional: can be null) Outer boundary polyline, if provided this will become the outer boundary of the resulting mesh. Any of the input that is completely outside the outer boundary will be ignored and have no impact on the result. If any of the input intersects the outer boundary the result will be unpredictable and is likely to not include the entire outer boundary.
Maximum angle between unit tangents and adjacent verticies. Used to divide curve inputs that cannot otherwise be represented as a polyline.

(optional: can be null) Polylines to create holes in the output mesh. If innerBoundaryCurves are the only input then the result may be null if trimback is set to false (see comments for trimback) because the resulting mesh could be invalid (all faces created contained vertexes from the perimeter boundary).

(optional: can be null) Initial surface where 3d input will be pulled to make a 2d representation used by the function that generates the mesh. Providing a pullbackSurface can be helpful when it is similar in shape to the pattern of the input, the pulled 2d points will be a better representation of the 3d points. If all of the input is more or less coplanar to start with, providing pullbackSurface has no real benefit.

(optional: can be null) These polylines will create faces on both sides of the edge. If there are only input points(innerPoints) there is no way to guarantee a triangulation that will create an edge between two particular points. Adding a line, or polyline, to innerBothsideCurves that includes points from innerPoints will help guide the triangulation.

(optional: can be null) Points to be used to generate the mesh. If outerBoundary is not null, points outside of that boundary after it has been pulled to pullbackSurface (or the best plane through the input if pullbackSurface is null) will be ignored.

Only used when a outerBoundary has not been provided. When that is the case, the function uses the perimeter of the surface as the outer boundary instead. If true, any face of the resulting triangulated mesh that contains a vertex of the perimeter boundary will be removed.

Only used when a outerBoundary has not been provided. When that is the case, division becomes the number of divisions each side of the surface's perimeter will be divided into to create an outer boundary to work with.
member.returns: mesh on success; null on failure

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.Ngons
member.summary:
Gets access to the mesh ngon list.
Ngons represent groups of Faces (triangles + quads).
Faces are used to tessellate an Ngon internally.
When a triangle or quad is referenced in the Ngon list, it is no longer visualized and conceived as a single entity, but takes part of the Ngon.
If you need to get access to both Ngons and the faces that are not referenced by Ngons, that is, all polygons that are visible in the mesh, then use the helper method.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.IsPointInside(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Determines if a point is inside a solid mesh.
member.param: 3d point to test.
(>=0) 3d distance tolerance used for ray-mesh intersection and determining strict inclusion.

If strictlyIn is true, then point must be inside mesh by at least tolerance in order for this function to return true. If strictlyIn is false, then this function will return true if point is inside or the distance from point to a mesh face is <= tolerance.
member.returns: true if point is inside the solid mesh, false if not.
member.remarks: The caller is responsible for making certing the mesh is solid before calling this function. If the mesh is not solid, the behavior is unpredictable.

member.returns: True if successful, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.Smooth(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Int32},System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,Rhino.Geometry.SmoothingCoordinateSystem,Rhino.Geometry.Plane)
member.summary: Smooths part of a mesh by averaging the positions of mesh vertices in a specified region.
member.param: The mesh vertex indices that specify the part of the mesh to smooth.
The smoothing factor, which controls how much vertices move towards the average of the neighboring vertices.
When true vertices move in X axis direction.
When true vertices move in Y axis direction.
When true vertices move in Z axis direction.
When true vertices along naked edges will not be modified.
The coordinates to determine the direction of the smoothing.
If SmoothingCoordinateSystem.CPlane specified, then the construction plane.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.Unweld(System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Makes sure that faces sharing an edge and having a difference of normal greater than or equal to angleToleranceRadians have unique vertexes along that edge, adding vertices if necessary.
member.param: Angle at which to make unique vertices.
Determines whether new vertex normals will have the same vertex normal as the original (false) or vertex normals made from the corrsponding face normals (true)

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.UnweldEdge(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Int32},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds creases to a smooth mesh by creating coincident vertices along selected edges.
member.param: An array of mesh topology edge indices.

If true, the vertex normals on each side of the edge take the same value as the face to which they belong, giving the mesh a hard edge look. If false, each of the vertex normals on either side of the edge is assigned the same value as the original normal that the pair is replacing, keeping a smooth look.
member.returns: true if successful, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.Weld(System.Double)
member.summary: Makes sure that faces sharing an edge and having a difference of normal greater than or equal to angleToleranceRadians share vertexes along that edge, vertex normals are averaged.
member.param: Angle at which to weld vertices.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.RebuildNormals
member.summary: Removes mesh normals and reconstructs the face and vertex normals based on the orientation of the faces.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.ExtractNonManifoldEdges(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Extracts, or removes, non-manifold mesh edges.
member.param: If true, then extract hanging faces only.
member.returns: A mesh containing the extracted non-manifold parts if successful, null otherwise.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.HealNakedEdges(System.Double)
member.summary: Attempts to "heal" naked edges in a mesh based on a given distance. First attempts to move vertexes to neighboring vertexes that are within that distance away. Then it finds edges that have a closest point to the vertex within the distance and splits the edge. When it finds one it splits the edge and makes two new edges using that point.
member.param: Distance to not exceed when modifying the mesh.
member.returns: true if successful, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.FillHoles
member.summary: Attempts to determine "holes" in the mesh by chaining naked edges together. Then it triangulates the closed polygons adds the faces to the mesh.
member.returns: true if successful, false otherwise.
member.remarks: This function does not differentiate between inner and outer naked edges. If you need that, it would be better to use Mesh.FillHole.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.FileHole(System.Int32)
member.summary: Given a starting "naked" edge index, this function attempts to determine a "hole" by chaining additional naked edges together until if returns to the start index. Then it triangulates the closed polygon and either adds the faces to the mesh.
member.param: Starting naked edge index.
member.returns: true if successful, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.UnifyNormals
member.summary: Attempts to fix inconsistencies in the directions of mesh faces in a mesh. This function does not modify mesh vertex normals, it rearranges the mesh face winding and face normals to make them all consistent. Note, you may want to call Mesh.Normals.ComputeNormals() to recompute vertex normals after calling this functions.
member.returns: number of faces that were modified.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.UnifyNormals(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Attempts to fix inconsistencies in the directions of mesh faces in a mesh. This function does not modify mesh vertex normals, it rearranges the mesh face winding and face normals to make them all consistent. Note, you may want to call Mesh.Normals.ComputeNormals() to recompute vertex normals after calling this functions.
member.param: If true, then only the number of faces that would be modified is determined.
member.returns: If countOnly=false, the number of faces that were modified. If countOnly=true, the number of faces that would be modified.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.SplitDisjointPieces
member.summary: Splits up the mesh into its unconnected pieces.
member.returns: An array containing all the disjoint pieces that make up this Mesh.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.ExplodeAtUnweldedEdges
member.summary: Explode the mesh into submeshes where a submesh is a collection of faces that are contained within a closed loop of "unwelded" edges. Unwelded edges are edges where the faces that share the edge have unique mesh vertexes (not mesh topology vertexes) at both ends of the edge.
member.returns: Array of submeshes on success; null on error. If the count in the returned array is 1, then nothing happened and the ouput is essentially a copy of the input.

member.summary: Append a list of meshes. This function is much more efficient than making repeated calls to Mesh.Append(Mesh) when lots of meshes are being joined into a single large mesh.

true if the mesh should be solidified.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.Offset(System.Double,System.Boolean,Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d)

true if the mesh should be solidified.
Direction of offset for all vertices.
member.returns: A new mesh on success, or null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.Offset(System.Double,System.Boolean,Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32}@)
member.summary: Makes a new mesh with vertices offset a distance along the direction parameter. Optionally, based on the value of solidify, adds the input mesh and a ribbon of faces along any naked edges. If solidify is false it acts exactly as the Offset(distance) function. Returns list of wall faces, i.e. the faces that connect original and offset mesh when solidified.
member.param: A distance value.
true if the mesh should be solidified.
Direction of offset for all vertices.
Returns list of wall faces.
member.returns: A new mesh on success, or null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.CollapseFacesByEdgeLength(System.Boolean,System.Double)
member.summary: Collapses multiple mesh faces, with greater/less than edge length, based on the principles found in Stan Melax's mesh reduction PDF, see http://pomax.nihongoresources.com/downloads/PolygonReduction.pdf
member.param: Determines whether edge with lengths greater than or less than edgeLength are collapsed.
Length with which to compare to edge lengths.
member.returns: Number of edges (faces) that were collapsed.
member.remarks: This number may differ from the initial number of edges that meet the input criteria because the lengths of some initial edges may be altered as other edges are collapsed.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.CollapseFacesByArea(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Collapses multiple mesh faces, with areas less than LessThanArea and greater than GreaterThanArea, based on the principles found in Stan Melax's mesh reduction PDF, see http://pomax.nihongoresources.com/downloads/PolygonReduction.pdf
member.param: Area in which faces are selected if their area is less than or equal to.
Area in which faces are selected if their area is greater than or equal to.
member.returns: Number of faces that were collapsed in the process.
member.remarks: This number may differ from the initial number of faces that meet the input criteria because the areas of some initial faces may be altered as other faces are collapsed. The face area must be both less than LessThanArea AND greater than GreaterThanArea in order to be considered. Use large numbers for lessThanArea or zero for greaterThanArea to simulate an OR.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Mesh.CollapseFacesByByAspectRatio(System.Double)
member.summary: Collapses a multiple mesh faces, determined by face aspect ratio, based on criteria found in Stan Melax's polygon reduction, see http://pomax.nihongoresources.com/downloads/PolygonReduction.pdf
member.param: Faces with an aspect ratio less than aspectRatio are considered as candidates.
member.returns: Number of faces that were collapsed in the process.
member.remarks: This number may differ from the initial number of faces that meet the input criteria because the aspect ratios of some initial faces may be altered as other faces are collapsed.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.MeshUnsafeLock
member.summary: Permits access to the underlying mesh raw data structures in an unsafe way.
member.remarks: This lock object needs to be disposed before using the Mesh in other calculations and this can be achieved with the using keyword (Using in VB.Net).

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.MeshUnsafeLock.VertexPoint3fArray(System.Int32@)
member.summary: Retrieves a pointer to the raw mesh vertex array, which uses coordinates defined with single precision floating point numbers.
member.param: The length of the array. This value is returned by reference (out in C#).
member.returns: The beginning of the vertex array. Item 0 is the first vertex, and item length-1 is the last valid one.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.MeshUnsafeLock.Release
member.summary: Releases the lock and updates the underlying unmanaged data structures.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.A

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.IsValid
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not this mesh face is considered to be valid. Note that even valid mesh faces could potentially be invalid in the context of a specific Mesh, if one or more of the corner indices exceeds the number of vertices on the mesh. If you want to perform a complete validity check, use IsValid(int) instead.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.IsValid(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not this mesh face is considered to be valid. Unlike the simple IsValid function, this function takes upper bound indices into account.
member.param: Number of vertices in the mesh that this face is a part of.
member.returns: true if the face is considered valid, false if not.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.IsValid(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d[])
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not this mesh face is considered to be valid. Unlike the simple IsValid function, this function takes actual point locations into account.
member.param: Array of vertices with which to validate the face.
member.returns: true if the face is considered valid, false if not.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.Repair(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d[])
member.summary: Attempts to repair this mesh face by taking both face indexes and actual vertex locations into account.
member.param: Array of vertices with which to consider when repairing the face.
member.returns: true if the face was repaired, false if not.
member.remarks: This function assumes the face is invalid and attempts to repair unconditionally. It is only worthwhile to call Repair on faces where IsValid returns false.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.IsValidEx(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d[]@)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not this mesh face is considered to be valid. Unlike the simple IsValid function, this function takes actual point locations into account.
member.param: Array of vertices with which to validate the face.
member.returns: true if the face is considered valid, false if not.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.RepairEx(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d[]@)
member.summary: Attempts to repair this mesh face by taking both face indexes and actual vertex locations into account.
member.param: Array of vertices with which to consider when repairing the face.
member.returns: true if the face was repaired, false if not.
member.remarks:
This function assumes the face is invalid and attempts to repair unconditionally. It is only worthwhile to call Repair on faces where IsValid returns false.
This function is the analog of UnsafeNativeMethods.ON_MeshFace_Repair done completely here to avoid copying the point array.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.IsTriangle
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not this mesh face is a triangle. A mesh face is considered to be a triangle when C equals D, thus it is possible for an Invalid mesh face to also be a triangle.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.IsQuad
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not this mesh face is a quad. A mesh face is considered to be a triangle when C does not equal D, thus it is possible for an Invalid mesh face to also be a quad.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace.CompareTo(Rhino.Geometry.MeshFace)
member.summary:
Compares this with another and returns a value of 1, 0, or -1, referring to dictionary order.
Index evaluation priority is first A, then B, then C, then D.
member.param: The other to use in comparison.

returns.para: 0: if this is identical to other
-1: if this < other. Priority is for index of corner A first, then B, then C, then D.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.MeshNgon

When retrieving Ngons from , this might contain also triangles and quads.

members.member:

Get the outer boundary mesh vertex list of the ngon.
Vertices are sorted counterclockwise with respect to the direction of the face, although the degree by which vertex normals will respect this might vary.

member.summary: Specifies the maximum angle between face normals of adjacent faces that will get welded together.

summary.para: Specifies how sensitive the divider for contrasts is on the displacement texture.
Specify 1 to split all mesh edges on each refine step.
Specify 0.99 to make even slight contrasts on the displacement texture cause edges to be split.
Specifying 0.01 only splits edges where heavy contrast exists.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshDisplacementInfo.SweepPitch
member.summary: Specifies how densely the object is initially subdivided. The lower the value, the higher the resolution of the displaced mesh.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshDisplacementInfo.WhiteMove
member.summary: The amount of displacement for the white color in the texture.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshDisplacementInfo.ChannelNumber
member.summary: Mapping channel number for the displacement mapping.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshDisplacementInfo.FaceLimit
member.summary: Runs a mesh reduction as a post process o simplify the result of displacement to meet the specified number of faces.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshDisplacementInfo.FairingAmount
member.summary: Straightens rough feature edges. The value specifies the number of passes.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshDisplacementInfo.RefineStepCount
member.summary: Specifies the number of refinement passes.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshDisplacementInfo.MemoryLimit
member.summary: Specifies how much memory can be allocated for use by the displacement mesh. Value in megabytes.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.NurbsSurface.CreateCurveOnSurfacePoints(Rhino.Geometry.Surface,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Rhino.Geometry.Point2d},System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Computes a discrete spline curve on the surface. In other words, computes a sequence of points on the surface, each with a corresponding parameter value.
member.param: The surface on which the curve is constructed. The surface should be G1 continuous. If the surface is closed in the u or v direction and is G1 at the seam, the function will construct point sequences that cross over the seam.
Surface points to interpolate given by parameters. These must be distinct.
Relative tolerance used by the solver. When in doubt, use a tolerance of 0.0.
When true constructs a smoothly closed curve.
Maximum number of points to insert beteween fixed points on the first level.
The number of levels (between 1 and 3) to be used in multi-level solver. Use 1 for single level solve.
member.returns: A sequence of surface points, given by surface parameters, if successful. The number of output points is approximatelely: 2 ^ (level-1) * initCount * fixedPoints.Count.
member.remarks: To create a curve from the output points, use Surface.CreateCurveOnSurface.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.NurbsSurface.CreateCurveOnSurface(Rhino.Geometry.Surface,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Rhino.Geometry.Point2d},System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Fit a sequence of 2d points on a surface to make a curve on the surface.
member.param: Surface on which to construct curve.
Parameter space coodinates of the points to interpolate.
Curve should be within tolerance of surface and points.
When true make a periodic curve.
member.returns: A curve interpolating the points if successful, null on error.
member.remarks: To produce the input points, use Surface.CreateCurveOnSurfacePoints.

Serialization stream.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MorphControl.SpaceMorphTolerance
member.summary: The 3d fitting tolerance used when morphing surfaces and breps. The default is 0.0 and any value <= 0.0 is ignored by morphing functions. The value returned by Tolerance does not affect the way meshes and points are morphed.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MorphControl.QuickPreview
member.summary: true if the morph should be done as quickly as possible because the result is being used for some type of dynamic preview. If QuickPreview is true, the tolerance may be ignored. The QuickPreview value does not affect the way meshes and points are morphed. The default is false.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MorphControl.PreserveStructure
member.summary: true if the morph should be done in a way that preserves the structure of the geometry. In particular, for NURBS objects, true eans that only the control points are moved. The PreserveStructure value does not affect the way meshes and points are morphed. The default is false.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MorphControl.Curve
member.summary: Returns the morph control's curve. While this should never be null, the calling function should check.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MorphControl.Surface
member.summary: Returns the morph control's surface. While this should never be null, the calling function should check.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.MorphControl.Morph(Rhino.Geometry.GeometryBase)
member.summary: Applies the space morph to geometry.
member.param: The geometry to be morphed.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure.

member.summary: Edge parameter when found.

member.summary: Gets the component index of the intersecting element in the mesh.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshPoint.EdgeIndex
member.summary: When set, EdgeIndex is an index of an edge in the mesh's edge list.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshPoint.FaceIndex
member.summary: FaceIndex is an index of a face in mesh.Faces. When ComponentIndex refers to a vertex, any face that uses the vertex may appear as FaceIndex. When ComponenctIndex refers to an Edge or EdgeIndex is set, then any face that uses that edge may appear as FaceIndex.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.MeshPoint.GetTriangle(System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Gets the mesh face indices of the triangle where the intersection is on the face takes into consideration the way the quad was split during the intersection.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshPoint.Triangle
member.summary:
Face triangle where the intersection takes place:
0 is unset
A is 0,1,2
B is 0,2,3
C is 0,1,3
D is 1,2,3

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshPoint.T
member.summary: Barycentric quad coordinates for the point on the mesh face mesh.Faces[FaceIndex]. If the face is a triangle disregard T[3] (it should be set to 0.0). If the face is a quad and is split between vertexes 0 and 2, then T[3] will be 0.0 when point is on the triangle defined by vi[0], vi[1], vi[2], and T[1] will be 0.0 when point is on the triangle defined by vi[0], vi[2], vi[3]. If the face is a quad and is split between vertexes 1 and 3, then T[2] will be 0.0 when point is on the triangle defined by vi[0], vi[1], vi[3], and m_t[0] will be 0.0 when point is on the triangle defined by vi[1], vi[2], vi[3].

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.MeshPoint.Point
member.summary: Gets the location (position) of this point.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SilhouetteType.None
member.summary: None.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SilhouetteType.Projecting
member.summary: Boundary of a region that projects to a curve. The view direction is tangent to the surface over the entire region.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SilhouetteType.TangentProjects
member.summary: Tangent silhouette curve where the curve projects to a point (within tolerance). In this case side_fill[i] is meaningless so it's left unset.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SilhouetteType.Tangent
member.summary: Tangent silhouette curve. The view direction is tangent to the surface along the curve.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SilhouetteType.Crease
member.summary: Crease on geometry that is a silhouette.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SilhouetteType.Boundary
member.summary: Boundary of geometry is always a silhouette.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SilhouetteType.NonSilhouetteCrease
member.summary: A non-silhouette crease, meaning both sides are visible.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SilhouetteType.NonSilhouetteTangent
member.summary: A non-silhouette tangent edge that is not a crease.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SilhouetteType.NonSilhouetteSeam
member.summary: A non-silhouette surface seam.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SilhouetteType.SectionCut
member.summary: Intersection with a clipping plane.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.SilhouetteType.DraftCurve

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.Silhouette
member.summary: Information about silhouette curves that are generated from geometry (surfaces, brep faces, meshes)

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Silhouette.Compute(Rhino.Geometry.GeometryBase,Rhino.Geometry.SilhouetteType,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Compute silhouettes of a shape for a perspective projection.
member.param: Geometry whose silhouettes need to be computed. Can be Brep, BrepFace, Mesh, or Extrusion.
Types of silhouette to compute.
Location of perspective camera.
Tolerance to use for determining projecting relationships. Surfaces and curves that are closer than tolerance, may be treated as projecting. When in doubt use RhinoDoc.ModelAbsoluteTolerance.

Angular tolerance to use for determining projecting relationships. A surface normal N that satisfies N o cameraDirection < Sin(angleToleranceRadians) may be considered projecting. When in doubt use RhinoDoc.ModelAngleToleranceRadians.
member.returns: Array of silhouette curves.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Silhouette.Compute(Rhino.Geometry.GeometryBase,Rhino.Geometry.SilhouetteType,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,System.Double,System.Double,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Rhino.Geometry.Plane},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Compute silhouettes of a shape for a perspective projection.
member.param: Geometry whose silhouettes need to be computed. Can be Brep, BrepFace, Mesh, or Extrusion.
Types of silhouette to compute.
Location of perspective camera.
Tolerance to use for determining projecting relationships. Surfaces and curves that are closer than tolerance, may be treated as projecting. When in doubt use RhinoDoc.ModelAbsoluteTolerance.

Angular tolerance to use for determining projecting relationships. A surface normal N that satisfies N o cameraDirection < Sin(angleToleranceRadians) may be considered projecting. When in doubt use RhinoDoc.ModelAngleToleranceRadians.
Optional collection of clipping planes.
Computation cancellation token.
member.returns: Array of silhouette curves.

member.summary: This is a quick way to see if the curve has gaps between the sub curve segments.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.PolyCurve.RemoveNesting
member.summary: Explodes nested polycurve segments and reconstructs this curve from the shattered remains. The result will have not have any PolyCurves as segments but it will have identical locus and parameterization.
member.returns: true if any nested PolyCurve was found and absorbed, false if no PolyCurve segments could be found.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.PolyCurve.Explode
member.summary: Explodes this PolyCurve into a list of Curve segments. This will not explode nested polycurves. Call first if you need all individual segments.
member.returns: An array of polycurve segments.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.PolyCurve.Append(Rhino.Geometry.Line)
member.summary: Appends and matches the start of the line to the end of polycurve. This function will fail if the polycurve is closed.
member.param: Line segment to append.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.PolyCurve.Append(Rhino.Geometry.Arc)
member.summary: Appends and matches the start of the arc to the end of polycurve. This function will fail if the polycurve is closed or if SegmentCount > 0 and the arc is closed.
member.param: Arc segment to append.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.PolyCurve.Append(Rhino.Geometry.Curve)
member.summary: Appends and matches the start of the curve to the end of polycurve. This function will fail if the PolyCurve is closed or if SegmentCount > 0 and the new segment is closed.
member.param: Segment to append.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.PolyCurve.AppendSegment(Rhino.Geometry.Curve)
member.summary: Appends the curve to the polycurve without changing the new segment's geometry. This function will fail if the PolyCurve is closed or if SegmentCount > 0 and the new segment is closed.
member.param: Segment to append.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.PolyCurve.SegmentCurveParameter(System.Double)
member.summary: Converts a polycurve parameter to a segment curve parameter.

member.returns: Segment curve evaluation parameter or UnsetValue if the segment curve parameter could not be computed.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.PolyCurve.PolyCurveParameter(System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Converts a segment curve parameter to a polycurve parameter.

Parameter on segment.
member.returns: Polycurve evaluation parameter or UnsetValue if the polycurve curve parameter could not be computed.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.PolyCurve.SegmentDomain(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the polycurve subdomain assigned to a segment curve.
member.param: Index of segment.
member.returns: The polycurve subdomain assigned to a segment curve. Returns Interval.Unset if segment_index < 0 or segment_index >= Count().

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.PolyCurve.SegmentIndex(System.Double)
member.summary: Finds the segment used for evaluation at polycurve_parameter.
member.param: Parameter on polycurve for segment lookup.
member.returns: Index of the segment used for evaluation at polycurve_parameter. If polycurve_parameter < Domain.Min(), then 0 is returned. If polycurve_parameter > Domain.Max(), then Count()-1 is returned.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.PolyCurve.SegmentIndexes(Rhino.Geometry.Interval,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Finds the segments that overlap the Polycurve sub domain.

Index of first segment that overlaps the subdomain.
Index of last segment that overlaps the subdomain. Note that segmentIndex0 <= i < segmentIndex1.
member.returns: Number of segments that overlap the subdomain.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.Polyline
member.summary:
Represents an ordered set of points connected by linear segments.
Polylines are closed if start and end points coincide.

member.summary: Initializes a new empty polyline.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Polyline.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new empty polyline with an initial capacity.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Polyline.IsValid
member.summary:
Gets a value that indicates whether this polyline is valid.
Valid polylines have at least one segment, no Invalid points and no zero length segments.
Closed polylines with only two segments are also not considered valid.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Polyline.SegmentCount
member.summary: Gets the number of segments for this polyline.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Polyline.IsClosed
member.summary:
Gets a value that indicates whether this polyline is closed.
The polyline is considered to be closed if its start is identical to its endpoint.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Polyline.IsClosedWithinTolerance(System.Double)
member.summary: Determines whether the polyline is closed, provided a tolerance value.
member.param: If the distance between the start and end point of the polyline is less than tolerance, the polyline is considered to be closed.
member.returns: true if the polyline is closed to within tolerance, false otherwise.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Polyline.Length

member.summary: Constructs a nurbs curve representation of this polyline.

member.summary: Constructs a polyline curve representation of this polyline.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Polyline.DeleteShortSegments(System.Double)
member.summary:
Removes all points that are closer than tolerance to the previous point.
Start and end points are left intact.
member.param: Vertices closer together than tolerance will be removed.
member.returns: Number of points (and segments) removed.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Polyline.CollapseShortSegments(System.Double)
member.summary: Collapses all segments until none are shorter than tolerance. This function is significantly slower than DeleteShortSegments, since it recursively operates on the shortest segment. When a segment is collapsed the end-points are placed in the center of the segment.
member.param: Tolerance to use during collapsing.
member.returns: The number of segments that were collapsed.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Polyline.ReduceSegments(System.Double)
member.summary: Constructs a reduction of this polyline by recursively removing the least significant segments.
member.param: Tolerance for reduction. Whenever a vertex of the polyline is more significant than tolerance, it will be included in the reduction.
member.returns: The number of vertices that disappeared due to reduction.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Polyline.MergeColinearSegments(System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Merge co-linear consecutive segments in a polyline. This method will automatically remove any zero-length segments as well.
member.param: The angle tolerance between adjacent segments for co-linearlity test.
If true, the seam point of a closed polyline will be moved forwards if it is colinear too.
member.returns: Number of segments removed from the entire polyline.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Polyline.Smooth(System.Double)
member.summary: Smoothens the polyline segments by averaging adjacent vertices. Smoothing requires a polyline with exclusively valid vertices.
member.param: Amount to smooth. Zero equals no smoothing, one equals complete smoothing.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Polyline.BreakAtAngles(System.Double)
member.summary: Breaks this polyline into sections at sharp kinks. Closed polylines will also be broken at the first and last vertex.
member.param: Angle (in radians) between adjacent segments for a break to occur.
member.returns: An array of polyline segments, or null on error.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Polyline.CenterPoint
member.summary: Compute the center point of the polyline as the weighted average of all segments.
member.returns: The weighted average of all segments.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Polyline.CreateInscribedPolygon(Rhino.Geometry.Circle,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a regular polygon inscribed in a circle. The vertices of the polygon will be on the circle.

The number of sides
member.returns: A closed polyline if successful, null otherwise.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Polyline.CreateCircumscribedPolygon(Rhino.Geometry.Circle,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a regular polygon circumscribe about a circle. The midpoints of the polygon's edges will be tanget to the circle.
member.param: The circle.
The number of sides
member.returns: A closed polyline if successful, null otherwise.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Polyline.CreateStarPolygon(Rhino.Geometry.Circle,System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a regular star polygon. The star begins at circle.PointAt(0) and the vertices alternate between being on circle and begin on a concentric circle of other_radius.
member.param: The circle.
The radius of other circle.
The number of corners on the circle. There will be 2*cornerCount sides and 2*cornerCount vertices.
member.returns: A closed polyline if successful, null otherwise.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.Rectangle3d
member.summary: Represents the values of a plane and two intervals that form an oriented rectangle in three dimensions.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Rectangle3d.CreateFromPolyline(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Rhino.Geometry.Point3d})
member.summary: Attempts to create a rectangle from a polyline. This method only works well for polylines that already closely resemble rectangles. If the polyline contains more than four vertices, the least significant ones will be ignored. If the polylines is non-orthogonal, the discrepancies will be averaged away. This method should not be used as a Rectangle fitter.
member.param: Polyline to parse.
member.returns: A rectangle that is shaped similarly to the polyline or Rectangle3d.Unset if the polyline does not represent a rectangle.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Rectangle3d.CreateFromPolyline(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Rhino.Geometry.Point3d},System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Attempts to create a rectangle from a polyline. This method only works well for polylines that already closely resemble rectangles. If the polyline contains more than four vertices, the least significant ones will be ignored. If the polylines is non-orthogonal, the discrepancies will be averaged away. This method should not be used as a Rectangle fitter.
member.param: Polyline to parse.
On success, the deviation will contain the largest deviation between the polyline and the rectangle.
On success, the angleDeviation will contain the largest deviation (in radians) between the polyline edges and the rectangle edges.
member.returns: A rectangle that is shaped similarly to the polyline or Rectangle3d.Unset if the polyline does not represent a rectangle.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.RTree.Finalize
member.summary: Passively reclaims unmanaged resources when the class user did not explicitly call Dispose().

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.RTree.Dispose
member.summary: Actively reclaims unmanaged resources that this instance uses.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.RTree.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
For derived class implementers.
This method is called with argument true when class user calls Dispose(), while with argument false when the Garbage Collector invokes the finalizer, or Finalize() method.
You must reclaim all used unmanaged resources in both cases, and can use this chance to call Dispose on disposable fields if the argument is true.
Also, you must call the base virtual method within your overriding method.
member.param: true if the call comes from the Dispose() method; false if it comes from the Garbage Collector finalizer.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.IsoStatus
member.summary:
Defines enumerated values for isoparametric curve direction on a surface, such as X or Y, and curve sides, such as North or West boundary.
Note: odd values are all x-constant; even values > 0 are all y-constant.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.IsoStatus.None
member.summary: curve is not an isoparameteric curve.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.IsoStatus.X
member.summary: curve is a "x" = constant (vertical) isoparametric curve in the interior of the surface's domain.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.IsoStatus.Y
member.summary: curve is a "y" = constant (horizontal) isoparametric curve in the interior of the surface's domain.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.IsoStatus.West
member.summary: curve is a "x" = constant isoparametric curve along the west side of the surface's domain.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.IsoStatus.South
member.summary: curve is a "y" = constant isoparametric curve along the south side of the surface's domain.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.IsoStatus.East
member.summary: curve is a "x" = constant isoparametric curve along the east side of the surface's domain.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.IsoStatus.North
member.summary: curve is a "y" = constant isoparametric curve along the north side of the surface's domain.

member.summary: Tests if a surface parameter value is at a singularity.

Surface v parameter to test.
If true, test if (u,v) is exactly at a singularity. If false, test if close enough to cause numerical problems.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.IsAtSeam(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Tests if a surface parameter value is at a seam.
member.param: Surface u parameter to test.
Surface v parameter to test.
member.returns: 0 if not a seam, 1 if u == Domain(0)[i] and srf(u, v) == srf(Domain(0)[1-i], v) 2 if v == Domain(1)[i] and srf(u, v) == srf(u, Domain(1)[1-i]) 3 if 1 and 2 are true.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.IsContinuous(Rhino.Geometry.Continuity,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Tests continuity at a surface parameter value.
member.param: The continuity type to sample.
Surface u parameter to test.
Surface v parameter to test.
member.returns: true if the surface has at least the specified continuity at the (u,v) parameter.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.GetNextDiscontinuity(System.Int32,Rhino.Geometry.Continuity,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double@)
member.summary: Searches for a derivative, tangent, or curvature discontinuity.
member.param: If 0, then "u" parameter is checked. If 1, then the "v" parameter is checked.
The desired continuity.
Search begins at t0. If there is a discontinuity at t0, it will be ignored. This makes it possible to repeatedly call GetNextDiscontinuity and step through the discontinuities.
(t0 != t1) If there is a discontinuity at t1 is will be ingored unless c is a locus discontinuity type and t1 is at the start or end of the curve.
if a discontinuity is found, then t reports the parameter at the discontinuity.
member.returns:
Parametric continuity tests c = (C0_continuous, ..., G2_continuous): TRUE if a parametric discontinuity was found strictly between t0 and t1. Note well that all curves are parametrically continuous at the ends of their domains.
Locus continuity tests c = (C0_locus_continuous, ...,G2_locus_continuous): TRUE if a locus discontinuity was found strictly between t0 and t1 or at t1 is the at the end of a curve. Note well that all open curves (IsClosed()=false) are locus discontinuous at the ends of their domains. All closed curves (IsClosed()=true) are at least C0_locus_continuous at the ends of their domains.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.Trim(Rhino.Geometry.Interval,Rhino.Geometry.Interval)
member.summary: Constructs a sub-surface that covers the specified UV trimming domain.
member.param: Domain of surface along U direction to include in the subsurface.
Domain of surface along V direction to include in the subsurface.
member.returns: SubSurface on success, null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.Evaluate(System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d@,Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d[]@)
member.summary: Evaluates a surface mathematically.
member.param: A U parameter.
A V parameter.
The number of derivatives.
A point. This out parameter will be assigned during this call.
A vector array. This out parameter will be assigned during this call. This can be null.
member.returns: true if the operation succeeded; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.IsoCurve(System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Gets isoparametric curve.
member.param:
0 first parameter varies and second parameter is constant e.g., point on IsoCurve(0,c) at t is srf(t,c) This is a horizontal line from left to right
1 first parameter is constant and second parameter varies e.g., point on IsoCurve(1,c) at t is srf(c,t This is a vertical line from bottom to top.
The parameter that was constant on the original surface.
member.returns: An isoparametric curve or null on error.
member.remarks: In this function "direction" indicates which direction the resulting curve runs. 0: horizontal, 1: vertical In the other Surface functions that take a "direction" argument, "direction" indicates if "constantParameter" is a "u" or "v" parameter.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.Split(System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Splits (divides) the surface into two parts at the specified parameter
member.param: 0 = The surface is split vertically. The "west" side is returned as the first surface in the array and the "east" side is returned as the second surface in the array. 1 = The surface is split horizontally. The "south" side is returned as the first surface in the array and the "north" side is returned as the second surfae in the array
value of constant parameter in interval returned by Domain(direction)
member.returns: Array of two surfaces on success

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.ToBrep
member.summary: Converts the surface into a Brep.
member.returns: A Brep with a similar shape like this surface or null.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.HasNurbsForm
member.summary: Is there a NURBS surface representation of this surface.
member.returns: 0 unable to create NURBS representation with desired accuracy. 1 success - NURBS parameterization matches the surface's 2 success - NURBS point locus matches the surface's and the domain of the NURBS surface is correct. However, This surface's parameterization and the NURBS surface parameterization may not match. This situation happens when getting NURBS representations of surfaces that have a transendental parameterization like spheres, cylinders, and cones.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.ToNurbsSurface
member.summary: Gets a NURBS surface representation of this surface. Default tolerance of 0.0 is used.
member.returns: NurbsSurface on success, null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.ToNurbsSurface(System.Double,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Gets a NURBS surface representation of this surface.
member.param: tolerance to use when creating NURBS representation.

param.name: accuracy
param.para: 0 = unable to create NURBS representation with desired accuracy.
1 = success - returned NURBS parameterization matches the surface's to the desired accuracy.

2 = success - returned NURBS point locus matches the surface's to the desired accuracy and the domain of the NURBS surface is correct. However, this surface's parameterization and the NURBS surface parameterization may not match to the desired accuracy. This situation happens when getting NURBS representations of surfaces that have a transendental parameterization like spheres, cylinders, and cones.

member.returns: NurbsSurface on success, null on failure.

member.returns: true if the surface is planar (flat) to within RhinoMath.ZeroTolerance units (1e-12).

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Surface.IsPlanar(System.Double)

member.summary: Constructs a periodic surface from a base surface and a direction.
member.param: The surface to make periodic.
The direction to make periodic, either 0 = U, or 1 = V.

Controls kink removal. If true, smooths any kinks in the surface and moves control points to make a smooth surface. If false, control point locations are not changed or changed minimally (only one point may move) and only the knot vector is altered.
member.returns: A periodic surface if successful, null on failure.

member.summary: Creates a soft edited surface from an exising surface using a smooth field of influence.
member.param: The surface to soft edit.
A point in the parameter space to move from. This location on the surface is moved, and the move is smoothly tapered off with increasing distance along the surface from this parameter.
The direction and magitude, or maximum distance, of the move.
The distance along the surface's u-direction from the editing point over which the strength of the editing falls off smoothly.
The distance along the surface's v-direction from the editing point over which the strength of the editing falls off smoothly.
The active document's model absolute tolerance.
Keeps edge locations fixed.
member.returns: The soft edited surface if successful. null on failure.

Splits an edge by inserting a vertex at a given location.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.SubDOperations.RestoreBackwardConnections(Rhino.Geometry.SubD)
member.summary:
Searches and reassigns all backward-connections that are needed in a SubD.
If we imagine the SubD data structure as a connection known at creation time as V < E < F, then all connections that are backwards are "decorations" we can recreate when we are done modifying the SubD.
This means V > F, V > E and E > F will be recomputed by this method.
member.param: The SubD to recompute.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.Particle
member.summary:
Represents a simple particle.
This base class only defines position and display properties (size, color, bitmap id). You will most likely create a class that derives from this particle class to perform some sort of physical simulation (movement over time or frames).

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.Arc
member.summary:
Represents the value of a plane, two angles and a radius in a subcurve of a three-dimensional circle.
The curve is parameterized by an angle expressed in radians. For an IsValid arc the total subtended angle AngleRadians() = Domain()(1) - Domain()(0) must satisfy 0 < AngleRadians() < 2*Pi
The parameterization of the Arc is inherited from the Circle it is derived from. In particular
t -> center + cos(t)*radius*xaxis + sin(t)*radius*yaxis
where xaxis and yaxis, (part of Circle.Plane) form an othonormal frame of the plane containing the circle.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.Circle
member.summary:
Represents a circle in 3D.
The values used are a radius and an orthonormal frame of the plane containing the circle, with origin at the center.
The circle is parameterized by radians from 0 to 2 Pi given by
t -> center + cos(t)*radius*xaxis + sin(t)*radius*yaxis
where center, xaxis and yaxis define the orthonormal frame of the circle plane.
member.remarks: >An IsValid circle has positive radius and an IsValid plane defining the frame.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Circle.TryFitCircleTT(Rhino.Geometry.Curve,Rhino.Geometry.Curve,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Try to fit a circle to two curves using tangent relationships.
member.param: First curve to touch.
Second curve to touch.
Parameter on first curve close to desired solution.
Parameter on second curve closet to desired solution.
member.returns: Valid circle on success, Circle.Unset on failure.

member.summary: Relation is meaningless.

member.summary: Point is on the interior of the region implied by the closed curve.

member.summary: Point is on the exterior of the region implied by the closed curve.

member.summary: Point is coincident with the curve and therefor neither inside not outside.

member.summary: There is no common area between the two regions.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.RegionContainment.MutualIntersection
member.summary: The two curves intersect. There is therefore no full containment relationship either way.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.RegionContainment.AInsideB
member.summary: Region bounded by curveA (first curve) is inside of curveB (second curve).

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.RegionContainment.BInsideA
member.summary: Region bounded by curveB (second curve) is inside of curveA (first curve).

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.CreateTweenCurvesWithMatching(Rhino.Geometry.Curve,Rhino.Geometry.Curve,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates curves between two open or closed input curves. Make the structure of input curves compatible if needed. Refits the input curves to have the same structure. The resulting curves are usually more complex than input unless input curves are compatible and no refit is needed. There is no matching of curves direction. Caller must match input curves direction before calling the function.
member.param: The first, or starting, curve.
The second, or ending, curve.
Number of tween curves to create.
member.returns: An array of joint curves. This array can be empty.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.CreateTweenCurvesWithMatching(Rhino.Geometry.Curve,Rhino.Geometry.Curve,System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates curves between two open or closed input curves. Make the structure of input curves compatible if needed. Refits the input curves to have the same structure. The resulting curves are usually more complex than input unless input curves are compatible and no refit is needed. There is no matching of curves direction. Caller must match input curves direction before calling the function.
member.param: The first, or starting, curve.
The second, or ending, curve.
Number of tween curves to create.
member.returns: An array of joint curves. This array can be empty.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.CreateTweenCurvesWithSampling(Rhino.Geometry.Curve,Rhino.Geometry.Curve,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates curves between two open or closed input curves. Use sample points method to make curves compatible. This is how the algorithm workd: Divides the two curves into an equal number of points, finds the midpoint between the corresponding points on the curves and interpolates the tween curve through those points. There is no matching of curves direction. Caller must match input curves direction before calling the function.
member.param: The first, or starting, curve.
The second, or ending, curve.
Number of tween curves to create.
Number of sample points along input curves.
member.returns: >An array of joint curves. This array can be empty.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.CreateTweenCurvesWithSampling(Rhino.Geometry.Curve,Rhino.Geometry.Curve,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double)

This is how the algorithm workd: Divides the two curves into an equal number of points, finds the midpoint between the corresponding points on the curves and interpolates the tween curve through those points. There is no matching of curves direction. Caller must match input curves direction before calling the function.
member.param: The first, or starting, curve.
The second, or ending, curve.
Number of tween curves to create.
Number of sample points along input curves.
member.returns: >An array of joint curves. This array can be empty.

member.summary: Makes adjustments to the ends of one or both input curves so that they meet at a point.
member.param: 1st curve to adjust.
Which end of the 1st curve to adjust: true is start, false is end.

which end of the 2nd curve to adjust true==start, false==end.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.GetFilletPoints(Rhino.Geometry.Curve,Rhino.Geometry.Curve,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double@,System.Double@,Rhino.Geometry.Plane@)
member.summary: Finds points at which to cut a pair of curves so that a fillet of given radius can be inserted.
member.param: First curve to fillet.
Second curve to fillet.
Fillet radius.
Parameter value for base point on curve0.
Parameter value for base point on curve1.
Parameter value of fillet point on curve 0.
Parameter value of fillet point on curve 1.
The fillet is contained in this plane with the fillet center at the plane origin.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure.
member.remarks: A fillet point is a pair of curve parameters (t0,t1) such that there is a circle of radius point3 tangent to curve c0 at t0 and tangent to curve c1 at t1. Of all possible fillet points this function returns the one which is the closest to the base point t0Base, t1Base. Distance from the base point is measured by the sum of arc lengths along the two curves.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.CreateFillet(Rhino.Geometry.Curve,Rhino.Geometry.Curve,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Computes the fillet arc for a curve filleting operation.
member.param: First curve to fillet.
Second curve to fillet.
Fillet radius.
Parameter on curve0 where the fillet ought to start (approximately).
Parameter on curve1 where the fillet ought to end (approximately).
member.returns: The fillet arc on success, or Arc.Unset on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.CreateFilletCurves(Rhino.Geometry.Curve,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,Rhino.Geometry.Curve,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a tangent arc between two curves and trims or extends the curves to the arc.
member.param: The first curve to fillet.
A point on the first curve that is near the end where the fillet will be created.
The second curve to fillet.
A point on the second curve that is near the end where the fillet will be created.
The radius of the fillet.
Join the output curves.
Trim copies of the input curves to the output fillet curve.

Applies when arcs are filleted but need to be extended to meet the fillet curve or chamfer line. If true, then the arc is extended maintaining its validity. If false, then the arc is extended with a line segment, which is joined to the arc converting it to a polycurve.
The tolerance, generally the document's absolute tolerance.
member.returns: The results of the fillet operation. The number of output curves depends on the input curves and the values of the parameters that were used during the fillet operation. In most cases, the output array will contain either one or three curves, although two curves can be returned if the radius is zero and join = false. For example, if both join and trim = true, then the output curve will be a polycurve containing the fillet curve joined with trimmed copies of the input curves. If join = false and trim = true, then three curves, the fillet curve and trimmed copies of the input curves, will be returned. If both join and trim = false, then just the fillet curve is returned.

The font style. The font style can be any number of the following: 0 - Normal, 1 - Bold, 2 - Italic

The tolerance for the operation.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
For derived class implementers.
This method is called with argument true when class user calls Dispose(), while with argument false when the Garbage Collector invokes the finalizer, or Finalize() method.
You must reclaim all used unmanaged resources in both cases, and can use this chance to call Dispose on disposable fields if the argument is true.
Also, you must call the base virtual method within your overriding method.
member.param: true if the call comes from the Dispose() method; false if it comes from the Garbage Collector finalizer.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.IsClosable(System.Double)
member.summary: Decide if it makes sense to close off this curve by moving the endpoint to the start based on start-end gap size and length of curve as approximated by chord defined by 6 points.
member.param: Maximum allowable distance between start and end. If start - end gap is greater than tolerance, this function will return false.
member.returns: true if start and end points are close enough based on above conditions.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.IsClosable(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Decide if it makes sense to close off this curve by moving the endpoint to the start based on start-end gap size and length of curve as approximated by chord defined by 6 points.
member.param: Maximum allowable distance between start and end. If start - end gap is greater than tolerance, this function will return false.
If greater than 0.0 and none of the interior sampled points are at least minimumAbsoluteSize from start, this function will return false.
If greater than 1.0 and chord length is less than minimumRelativeSize*gap, this function will return false.
member.returns: true if start and end points are close enough based on above conditions.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.MakeClosed(System.Double)
member.summary: If IsClosed, just return true. Otherwise, decide if curve can be closed as follows: Linear curves polylinear curves with 2 segments, Nurbs with 3 or less control points cannot be made closed. Also, if tolerance > 0 and the gap between start and end is larger than tolerance, curve cannot be made closed. Adjust the curve's endpoint to match its start point.
member.param: If nonzero, and the gap is more than tolerance, curve cannot be made closed.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure.

parameter of local closest point returned here.

Past this distance, the search is given up and false is returned.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.CreatePeriodicCurve(Rhino.Geometry.Curve)
member.summary: Removes kinks from a curve. Periodic curves deform smoothly without kinks.
member.param: The curve to make periodic. Curve must have degree >= 2.
member.returns: The resulting curve if successful, null otherwise.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.CreatePeriodicCurve(Rhino.Geometry.Curve,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Removes kinks from a curve. Periodic curves deform smoothly without kinks.
member.param: The curve to make periodic. Curve must have degree >= 2.

If true, smooths any kinks in the curve and moves control points to make a smooth curve. If false, control point locations are not changed or changed minimally (only one point may move) and only the knot vector is altered.
member.returns: The resulting curve if successful, null otherwise.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.IsContinuous(Rhino.Geometry.Continuity,System.Double)
member.summary: Test continuity at a curve parameter value.
member.param: Type of continuity to test for.
Parameter to test.
member.returns: true if the curve has at least the c type continuity at the parameter t.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.GetNextDiscontinuity(Rhino.Geometry.Continuity,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double@)
member.summary: Searches for a derivative, tangent, or curvature discontinuity.
member.param: Type of continuity to search for.
Search begins at t0. If there is a discontinuity at t0, it will be ignored. This makes it possible to repeatedly call GetNextDiscontinuity() and step through the discontinuities.
(t0 != t1) If there is a discontinuity at t1 it will be ignored unless continuityType is a locus discontinuity type and t1 is at the start or end of the curve.
If a discontinuity is found, then t reports the parameter at the discontinuity.
member.returns:
Parametric continuity tests c = (C0_continuous, ..., G2_continuous): true if a parametric discontinuity was found strictly between t0 and t1. Note well that all curves are parametrically continuous at the ends of their domains.
Locus continuity tests c = (C0_locus_continuous, ...,G2_locus_continuous): true if a locus discontinuity was found strictly between t0 and t1 or at t1 is the at the end of a curve. Note well that all open curves (IsClosed()=false) are locus discontinuous at the ends of their domains. All closed curves (IsClosed()=true) are at least C0_locus_continuous at the ends of their domains.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.NormalizedLengthParameters(System.Double[],System.Double)
member.summary: Input the parameter of the point on the curve that is a prescribed arc length from the start of the curve. A fractional tolerance of 1e-8 is used in this version of the function.
member.param: Array of normalized arc length parameters. E.g., 0 = start of curve, 1/2 = midpoint of curve, 1 = end of curve.
If absoluteTolerance > 0, then the difference between (s[i+1]-s[i])*curve_length and the length of the curve segment from t[i] to t[i+1] will be <= absoluteTolerance.
member.returns: If successful, array of curve parameters such that the length of the curve from its start to t[i] is s[i]*curve_length. Null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.NormalizedLengthParameters(System.Double[],System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Input the parameter of the point on the curve that is a prescribed arc length from the start of the curve.
member.param: Array of normalized arc length parameters. E.g., 0 = start of curve, 1/2 = midpoint of curve, 1 = end of curve.
If absoluteTolerance > 0, then the difference between (s[i+1]-s[i])*curve_length and the length of the curve segment from t[i] to t[i+1] will be <= absoluteTolerance.
Desired fractional precision for each segment. fabs("true" length - actual length)/(actual length) <= fractionalTolerance.
member.returns: If successful, array of curve parameters such that the length of the curve from its start to t[i] is s[i]*curve_length. Null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.NormalizedLengthParameters(System.Double[],System.Double,Rhino.Geometry.Interval)
member.summary: Input the parameter of the point on the curve that is a prescribed arc length from the start of the curve. A fractional tolerance of 1e-8 is used in this version of the function.
member.param: Array of normalized arc length parameters. E.g., 0 = start of curve, 1/2 = midpoint of curve, 1 = end of curve.
If absoluteTolerance > 0, then the difference between (s[i+1]-s[i])*curve_length and the length of the curve segment from t[i] to t[i+1] will be <= absoluteTolerance.
The calculation is performed on the specified sub-domain of the curve. A 0.0 s value corresponds to subdomain->Min() and a 1.0 s value corresponds to subdomain->Max().
member.returns: If successful, array of curve parameters such that the length of the curve from its start to t[i] is s[i]*curve_length. Null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.Simplify(Rhino.Geometry.CurveSimplifyOptions,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary:
Returns a geometrically equivalent PolyCurve.
The PolyCurve has the following properties
1. All the PolyCurve segments are LineCurve, PolylineCurve, ArcCurve, or NurbsCurve.
2. The Nurbs Curves segments do not have fully multiple interior knots.
3. Rational Nurbs curves do not have constant weights.
4. Any segment for which IsLinear() or IsArc() is true is a Line, Polyline segment, or an Arc.
5. Adjacent Colinear or Cocircular segments are combined.
6. Segments that meet with G1-continuity have there ends tuned up so that they meet with G1-continuity to within machine precision.
member.param: Simplification options.
A distance tolerance for the simplification.
An angle tolerance for the simplification.
member.returns: New simplified curve on success, null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.SimplifyEnd(Rhino.Geometry.CurveEnd,Rhino.Geometry.CurveSimplifyOptions,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Same as SimplifyCurve, but simplifies only the last two segments at "side" end.
member.param: If CurveEnd.Start the function simplifies the last two start side segments, otherwise if CurveEnd.End the last two end side segments are simplified.
Simplification options.
A distance tolerance for the simplification.
An angle tolerance for the simplification.
member.returns: New simplified curve on success, null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.Fair(System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Fairs a curve object. Fair works best on degree 3 (cubic) curves. Attempts to remove large curvature variations while limiting the geometry changes to be no more than the specified tolerance.
member.param: Maximum allowed distance the faired curve is allowed to deviate from the input.
(in radians) kinks with angles <= angleTolerance are smoothed out 0.05 is a good default.

The number of (control vertices-1) to preserve at start.
0 = preserve start point
1 = preserve start point and 1st derivative
2 = preserve start point, 1st and 2nd derivative
Same as clampStart.
The number of iteratoins to use in adjusting the curve.
member.returns: Returns new faired Curve on success, null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.Fit(System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Fits a new curve through an existing curve.
member.param: The degree of the returned Curve. Must be bigger than 1.
The fitting tolerance. If fitTolerance is RhinoMath.UnsetValue or <=0.0, the document absolute tolerance is used.

The kink smoothing tolerance in radians.
If angleTolerance is 0.0, all kinks are smoothed
If angleTolerance is >0.0, kinks smaller than angleTolerance are smoothed
If angleTolerance is RhinoMath.UnsetValue or <0.0, the document angle tolerance is used for the kink smoothing
member.returns: Returns a new fitted Curve if successful, null on failure.

member.summary: Rebuild a curve with a specific point count.
