member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.HasNurbsForm
member.summary: Does a NURBS curve representation of this curve exist?
member.returns: 0 unable to create NURBS representation with desired accuracy. 1 success - NURBS parameterization matches the curve's to the desired accuracy 2 success - NURBS point locus matches the curve's and the domain of the NURBS curve is correct. However, This curve's parameterization and the NURBS curve parameterization may not match. This situation happens when getting NURBS representations of curves that have a transendental parameterization like circles.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.ToPolyline(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets a polyline approximation of a curve.
member.param: If mainSegmentCount <= 0, then both subSegmentCount and mainSegmentCount are ignored. If mainSegmentCount > 0, then subSegmentCount must be >= 1. In this case the nurb will be broken into mainSegmentCount equally spaced chords. If needed, each of these chords can be split into as many subSegmentCount sub-parts if the subdivision is necessary for the mesh to meet the other meshing constraints. In particular, if subSegmentCount = 0, then the curve is broken into mainSegmentCount pieces and no further testing is performed.
An amount of subsegments.
( 0 to pi ) Maximum angle (in radians) between unit tangents at adjacent vertices.
Maximum permitted value of (distance chord midpoint to curve) / (length of chord).

If maxAspectRatio < 1.0, the parameter is ignored. If 1 <= maxAspectRatio < sqrt(2), it is treated as if maxAspectRatio = sqrt(2). This parameter controls the maximum permitted value of (length of longest chord) / (length of shortest chord).
If tolerance = 0, the parameter is ignored. This parameter controls the maximum permitted value of the distance from the curve to the polyline.
The minimum permitted edge length.
If maxEdgeLength = 0, the parameter is ignored. This parameter controls the maximum permitted edge length.
If true the starting point of the curve is added to the polyline. If false the starting point of the curve is not added to the polyline.
member.returns: PolylineCurve on success, null on error.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Curve.ToPolyline(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean,Rhino.Geometry.Interval)
member.summary: Gets a polyline approximation of a curve.
member.param: If mainSegmentCount <= 0, then both subSegmentCount and mainSegmentCount are ignored. If mainSegmentCount > 0, then subSegmentCount must be >= 1. In this case the nurb will be broken into mainSegmentCount equally spaced chords. If needed, each of these chords can be split into as many subSegmentCount sub-parts if the subdivision is necessary for the mesh to meet the other meshing constraints. In particular, if subSegmentCount = 0, then the curve is broken into mainSegmentCount pieces and no further testing is performed.
An amount of subsegments.
( 0 to pi ) Maximum angle (in radians) between unit tangents at adjacent vertices.
Maximum permitted value of (distance chord midpoint to curve) / (length of chord).

If maxAspectRatio < 1.0, the parameter is ignored. If 1 <= maxAspectRatio < sqrt(2), it is treated as if maxAspectRatio = sqrt(2). This parameter controls the maximum permitted value of (length of longest chord) / (length of shortest chord).
If tolerance = 0, the parameter is ignored. This parameter controls the maximum permitted value of the distance from the curve to the polyline.
The minimum permitted edge length.
If maxEdgeLength = 0, the parameter is ignored. This parameter controls the maximum permitted edge length.
If true the starting point of the curve is added to the polyline. If false the starting point of the curve is not added to the polyline.
This subdomain of the NURBS curve is approximated.
member.returns: PolylineCurve on success, null on error.

A valid cylinder is represented by a valid circle and two valid heights.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Cylinder.IsFinite
member.summary: true if the cylinder is finite (Height0 != Height1) false if the cylinder is infinite.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Cylinder.Center

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Cylinder.Axis
member.summary: Gets the axis direction of the cylinder.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Cylinder.TotalHeight
member.summary: Gets the height of the cylinder. Infinite cylinders have a height of zero, not Double.PositiveInfinity.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Cylinder.Height1
member.summary: Gets or sets the start height of the cylinder. The center of bottom cap is: BasePlane.Origin + Height1 * BasePlane.ZAxis.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Cylinder.Height2
member.summary: Gets or sets the end height of the cylinder. If the end height equals the start height, the cylinder is presumed to be infinite. The center of top cap is: BasePlane.Origin + Height2 * BasePlane.ZAxis.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Cylinder.Radius
member.summary: Gets or sets the radius of the cylinder.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Cylinder.BasePlane

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Cylinder.LineAt(System.Double)
member.summary: Compute the line at the given angle parameter. This line will be degenerate if the cylinder is infite.
member.param: Angle parameter for line section.

Serialization stream.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.GeometryBase.OnSwitchToNonConst
member.summary: Is called when a non-const operation occurs.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.GeometryBase.IsDocumentControlled
member.summary: If true this object may not be modified. Any properties or functions that attempt to modify this object when it is set to "IsReadOnly" will throw a NotSupportedException.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.GeometryBase.DuplicateShallow
member.summary: Constructs a light copy of this object. By "light", it is meant that the same underlying data is used until something is done to attempt to change it. For example, you could have a shallow copy of a very heavy mesh object and the same underlying data will be used when doing things like inspecting the number of faces on the mesh. If you modify the location of one of the mesh vertices, the shallow copy will create a full duplicate of the underlying mesh data and the shallow copy will become a deep copy.
member.returns:
An object of the same type as this object.
This behavior is overridden by implementing classes.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.GeometryBase.Duplicate
member.summary: Constructs a deep (full) copy of this object.
member.returns: An object of the same type as this, with the same properties and behavior.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.GeometryBase.GetBoundingBox(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Boundingbox solver. Gets the world axis aligned boundingbox for the geometry.
member.param: If true, a physically accurate boundingbox will be computed. If not, a boundingbox estimate will be computed. For some geometry types there is no difference between the estimate and the accurate boundingbox. Estimated boundingboxes can be computed much (much) faster than accurate (or "tight") bounding boxes. Estimated bounding boxes are always similar to or larger than accurate bounding boxes.
member.returns: The boundingbox of the geometry in world coordinates or BoundingBox.Empty if not bounding box could be found.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.GeometryBase.GetBoundingBox(Rhino.Geometry.Transform)
member.summary: Aligned Boundingbox solver. Gets the world axis aligned boundingbox for the transformed geometry.
member.param: Transformation to apply to object prior to the BoundingBox computation. The geometry itself is not modified.
member.returns: The accurate boundingbox of the transformed geometry in world coordinates or BoundingBox.Empty if not bounding box could be found.

member.returns: A BoundingBox in plane coordinates.

member.summary: Returns true if the NURBS curve has bezier spans (all distinct knots have multiplitity = degree)

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.NurbsCurve.MakePiecewiseBezier(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Clamps ends and adds knots so the NURBS curve has bezier spans (all distinct knots have multiplitity = degree).
member.param: If true and the first or last weight is not one, then the first and last spans are reparameterized so that the end weights are one.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.NurbsCurve.Reparameterize(System.Double)
member.summary: Use a linear fractional transformation to reparameterize the NURBS curve. This does not change the curve's domain.
member.param: reparameterization constant (generally speaking, c should be > 0). The control points and knots are adjusted so that output_nurbs(t) = input_nurbs(lambda(t)), where lambda(t) = c*t/( (c-1)*t + 1 ). Note that lambda(0) = 0, lambda(1) = 1, lambda'(t) > 0, lambda'(0) = c and lambda'(1) = 1/c.
member.returns: true if successful.
member.remarks: The cv and knot values are values are changed so that output_nurbs(t) = input_nurbs(lambda(t)).

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.NurbsCurve.CreateSpiral(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a C1 cubic NURBS approximation of a helix or spiral. For a helix, you may have radius0 == radius1. For a spiral radius0 == radius0 produces a circle. Zero and negative radii are permissible.
member.param: Helix's axis starting point or center of spiral.
Helix's axis vector or normal to spiral's plane.
Point used only to get a vector that is perpedicular to the axis. In particular, this vector must not be (anti)parallel to the axis vector.
The pitch, where a spiral has a pitch = 0, and pitch > 0 is the distance between the helix's "threads".

The number of turns in spiral or helix. Positive values produce counter-clockwise orientation, negitive values produce clockwise orientation. Note, for a helix, turnCount * pitch = length of the helix's axis.
The starting radius.
The ending radius.
member.returns: NurbsCurve on success, null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.NurbsCurve.CreateSpiral(Rhino.Geometry.Curve,System.Double,System.Double,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a C2 non-rational uniform cubic NURBS approximation of a swept helix or spiral.
member.param: The rail curve.
Starting portion of rail curve's domain to sweep along.
Ending portion of rail curve's domain to sweep along.
Point used only to get a vector that is perpedicular to the axis. In particular, this vector must not be (anti)parallel to the axis vector.
The pitch. Positive values produce counter-clockwise orientation, negative values produce clockwise orientation.

The turn count. If != 0, then the resulting helix will have this many turns. If = 0, then pitch must be != 0 and the approximate distance between turns will be set to pitch. Positive values produce counter-clockwise orientation, negitive values produce clockwise orientation.
The starting radius. At least one radii must benonzero. Negative values are allowed.
The ending radius. At least ont radii must be nonzero. Negative values are allowed.
Number of points to intepolate per turn. Must be greater than 4. When in doubt, use 12.
member.returns: NurbsCurve on success, null on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.ControlPoint.#ctor(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Constructs a new homogeneous control point, where the 4-D representation is (x, y, z, w). The world 3-D, or Euclidean, representation is (x/w, y/w, z/w).
member.param: X coordinate of the control point.
Y coordinate of the control point.
Z coordinate of the control point.
Weight factor of the control point. You should not use weights less than or equal to zero.
member.remarks: For expert use only. If you do not understand homogeneous coordinates, then use an override that accepts world 3-D, or Euclidean, coordinates as input.

member.returns: A new quaternion.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.IsValid
member.summary:
Determines if the four coefficients are valid numbers within RhinoCommon.
See .

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.Conjugate
member.summary:
Gets a new quaternion that is the conjugate of this quaternion.
This is (a,-b,-c,-d)

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.Invert
member.summary:
Modifies this quaternion to become
(a/L2, -b/L2, -c/L2, -d/L2),
where L2 = length squared = (a*a + b*b + c*c + d*d).
This is the multiplicative inverse, i.e., (a,b,c,d)*(a/L2, -b/L2, -c/L2, -d/L2) = (1,0,0,0).
member.returns: true if successful. false if the quaternion is zero and cannot be inverted.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.Inverse
member.summary:
Computes a new inverted quaternion,
(a/L2, -b/L2, -c/L2, -d/L2),
where L2 = length squared = (a*a + b*b + c*c + d*d). This is the multiplicative inverse, i.e., (a,b,c,d)*(a/L2, -b/L2, -c/L2, -d/L2) = (1,0,0,0). If this is the zero quaternion, then the zero quaternion is returned.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.Length
member.summary: Returns the length or norm of the quaternion.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.LengthSquared
member.summary: Gets the result of (a^2 + b^2 + c^2 + d^2).

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.DistanceTo(Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion)
member.summary: Computes the distance or norm of the difference between this and another quaternion.
member.param: Another quaternion.
member.returns: (this - q).Length.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.Distance(Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion,Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion)
member.summary: Returns the distance or norm of the difference between two quaternions.
member.param: A quaternion.
Another quaternion.
member.returns: (p - q).Length()

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.MatrixForm
member.summary: Returns 4x4 real valued matrix form of the quaternion a b c d -b a -d c -c d a -b -d -c b a which has the same arithmetic properties as the quaternion.
member.returns: A transform value.
member.remarks: Do not confuse this with the rotation defined by the quaternion. This function will only be interesting to math nerds and is not useful in rendering or animation applications.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.Unitize
member.summary: Scales the quaternion's coordinates so that a*a + b*b + c*c + d*d = 1.
member.returns: true if successful. false if the quaternion is zero and cannot be unitized.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.SetRotation(System.Double,Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d)
member.summary: Sets the quaternion to cos(angle/2), sin(angle/2)*x, sin(angle/2)*y, sin(angle/2)*z where (x,y,z) is the unit vector parallel to axis. This is the unit quaternion that represents the rotation of angle about axis.

The direction of the axis of rotation.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.Rotation(System.Double,Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d)
member.summary: Returns the unit quaternion cos(angle/2), sin(angle/2)*x, sin(angle/2)*y, sin(angle/2)*z where (x,y,z) is the unit vector parallel to axis. This is the unit quaternion that represents the rotation of angle about axis.
member.param: An angle in radians.
The axis of rotation.
member.returns: A new quaternion.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.SetRotation(Rhino.Geometry.Plane,Rhino.Geometry.Plane)
member.summary: Sets the quaternion to the unit quaternion which rotates plane0.xaxis to plane1.xaxis, plane0.yaxis to plane1.yaxis, and plane0.zaxis to plane1.zaxis.
member.param: The "from" rotation plane. Origin point is ignored.
The "to" rotation plane. Origin point is ignored.
member.remarks: The plane origins are ignored

member.summary: Returns the unit quaternion that represents the the rotation that maps plane0.xaxis to plane1.xaxis, plane0.yaxis to plane1.yaxis, and plane0.zaxis to plane1.zaxis.

unit axis of rotation of 0 if (b,c,d) is the zero vector.
member.returns: True if the operation succeeded; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.GetRotation(Rhino.Geometry.Plane@)
member.summary: Returns the frame created by applying the quaternion's rotation to the canonical world frame (1,0,0),(0,1,0),(0,0,1).
member.param: A plane. This out value will be assigned during this call.
member.returns: true if the operation succeeded; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Quaternion.Rotate(Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d)
member.summary: Rotates a 3d vector. This operation is also called conjugation, because the result is the same as (q.Conjugate()*(0,x,y,x)*q/q.LengthSquared).Vector.
member.param: The vector to be rotated.
member.returns: R*v, where R is the rotation defined by the unit quaternion. This is mathematically the same as the values (Inverse(q)*(0,x,y,z)*q).Vector and (q.Conjugate()*(0,x,y,x)*q/q.LengthSquared).Vector.
member.remarks: If you need to rotate more than a dozen or so vectors, it will be more efficient to calculate the rotation matrix once and use it repeatedly.

member.summary: Create rotation transformation From Tait-Byran angles (also loosely known as Euler angles).
member.param: Angle, in radians, to rotate about the Z axis.
Angle, in radians, to rotate about the Y axis.
Angle, in radians, to rotate about the X axis.
member.returns: A transform matrix from Tait-Byran angles.
member.remarks: RotationZYX(yaw, pitch, roll) = R_z(yaw) * R_y(pitch) * R_x(roll) where R_*(angle) is rotation of angle radians about the corresponding world coordinate axis.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Transform.RotationZYZ(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Create rotation transformation From Euler angles.
member.param: Angle, in radians, to rotate about the Z axis.
Angle, in radians, to rotate about the Y axis.
Angle, in radians, to rotate about the X axis.
member.returns: A transform matrix from Euler angles.
member.remarks: RotationZYZ(alpha, beta, gamma) = R_z(alpha) * R_y(beta) * R_z(gamma) where R_*(angle) is rotation of angle radians about the corresponding *-world coordinate axis. Note, alpha and gamma are in the range (-pi, pi] while beta in in the range [0, pi]

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Transform.SimilarityType
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not the Transform maintains similarity. The easiest way to think of Similarity is that any circle, when transformed, remains a circle. Whereas a non-similarity Transform deforms circles into ellipses.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Transform.IsSimilarity(System.Double)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not the Transform maintains similarity. A similarity transformation can be broken into a sequence of a dialation, translation, rotation, and a reflection.
member.param: The evaluation tolerance.
member.returns: The similarity type.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Transform.DecomposeSimilarity(Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d@,System.Double@,Rhino.Geometry.Transform@,System.Double)
member.summary: Decomposes a similarity transformation. The transformation must be affine. A similarity transformation can be broken into a sequence of a dialation, translation, rotation, and a reflection.
member.param: Translation vector.
Dialation, where dilation lt; 0 if this is an orientation reversing similarity.
A proper rotation transformation, where R*Transpose(R)=I and Determinant(R)=1.
The evaluation tolerance.
member.returns: The similarity type.
member.remarks: If X.DecomposeSimilarity(T, d, R, tol) !=0 then X ~ Translation(T)*Diagonal(d)*R note when d gt;0 the transformation is orientation preserving. If dilation lt; 0 then Diagonal(dilation) is actually a reflection combined with a true dialation, or Diagonal(dilation) = Diagonal(-1) * Diagonal(|diagonal|).

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Transform.RigidType
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not the Transform is rigid. A rigid transformation can be broken into a proper rotation and a translation, while an isometry transformation could also include a reflection.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Transform.IsRigid(System.Double)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not the Transform is rigid. A rigid transformation can be broken into a proper rotation and a translation, while an isometry transformation could also include a reflection.
member.param: The evaluation tolerance.
member.returns: The rigid type.

members.member:
Decomposes a rigid transformation. The transfomration must be affine.
A rigid transformation can be broken into a proper rotation and a translation, while an isometry transformation could also include a reflection. Translation vector. Proper rotation transformation, where R*Transpose(R)=I and det(R)=1. The evaluation tolerance. The rigid type.
If X.DecomposeRigid(T, R) is 1, then X ~ Translation(T)*R. If X.DecomposeRigid(T, R) is -1, then X ~ Transform(-1) * Translation(T)*R. DecomposeRigid will find the closest rotation to the linear part of this transformation.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Transform.IsAffine
member.summary: Tests for an affine transformation. An affine transformation can be broken into a linear transformation and a translation.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Transform.IsLinear
member.summary: Tests for a linear transformation. An affine transformation can be broken into a linear transformation and a translation.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Transform.DecomposeAffine(Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d@,Rhino.Geometry.Transform@)
member.summary: Decomposes an affine transformation. An affine transformation can be broken into a linear transformation and a translation. Note, a perspective transformation is not affine.
member.param: Translation vector.
Linear transformation.
member.returns: True if successful decomposition.
member.remarks: If X.DecomposeAffine(T, L) is true then X == Translation(T)*L. DecomposeAffine(T,L) succeeds for all affine transformations and is a simple copying of values.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Transform.DecomposeAffine(Rhino.Geometry.Transform@,Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d@)
member.summary: Decomposes an affine transformation. An affine transformation can be broken into a linear transformation and a translation. Note, a perspective transformation is not affine.
member.param: Linear transformation.
Translation vector.
member.returns: True if successful decomposition.
member.remarks: If X.DecomposeAffine(L, T) is true then X == L* Translation(T). DecomposeAffine(L, T) may fail for affine transformations if L is not invertible, and is more computationally expensive then X.DecomposeAffine(T, L).

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Transform.DecomposeAffine(Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d@,Rhino.Geometry.Transform@,Rhino.Geometry.Transform@,Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d@)
member.summary: An affine transformation can be decomposed into a Symmetric, Rotation and Translation. Then the Symmetric component may be further decomposed as non-uniform scale in an orthonormal coordinate system.
member.param: Translation vector.
Proper rotation transformation.
Orthogonal basis.
Diagonal elements of a Diagonal transformation.
member.returns: True if successful decomposition.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Transform.IsRotation
member.summary: Returns true if this is a proper rotation.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Transform.Affineize
member.summary: Replaces the last row with (0 0 0 1), discarding any perspecive part of this transform

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Transform.Linearize
member.summary: Affineize() and replaces the last column with (0 0 0 1)^T, discarding any translation part of this transform.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Transform.Orthogonalize(System.Double)
member.summary: Force the linear part of this transformation to be a rotation (or a rotation with reflection). Use DecomposeRigid(T,R) to find the nearest rotation.
member.param: The evaluation tolerance
member.returns: true if successful, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Transform.DecomposeSymmetric(Rhino.Geometry.Transform@,Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d@)
member.summary: A Symmetric linear transformation can be decomposed A = Q * Diag * Q ^ T, where Diag is a diagonal transformation. Diag[i][i] is an eigenvalue of A and the i-th coulmn of Q is a corresponding unit length eigenvector. Note, this transformation must be Linear and Symmetric.
member.param: An orthonormal matrix of eigenvectors (Q).
A vector of eigenvalues.
member.returns: true if successful, false otherwise.
member.remarks: If success, this== Q*Diagonal(diagonal) * QT, where QT == Q.Transpose(). If L.IsLinear and LT==L.Transpose then LT*L is symmetric and is a common source of symmetric transformations.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Transform.Determinant
member.summary: The determinant of this 4x4 matrix.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Transform.GetYawPitchRoll(System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Find the Tait-Byran angles (also loosely called Euler angles) for a rotation transformation.
member.param: Angle of rotation, in radians, about the Z axis.
Angle of rotation, in radians, about the Y axis.
Angle of rotation, in radians, about the Z axis.
member.returns: If true, then RotationZYX(yaw, pitch, roll) = R_z(yaw) * R_y(pitch) * R_x(roll) where R_*(angle) is rotation of angle radians about the corresponding world coordinate axis. If false, then this is not a rotation.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Transform.GetEulerZYZ(System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Find the Euler angles for a rotation transformation.
member.param: Angle of rotation, in radians, about the Z axis.
Angle of rotation, in radians, about the Y axis.
Angle of rotation, in radians, about the Z axis.
member.returns: If true, then RotationZYZ(alpha, beta, gamma) = R_z(alpha) * R_y(beta) * R_z(gamma) where R_*(angle) is rotation of angle radians about the corresponding *-world coordinate axis. If false, then this is not a rotation.
member.remarks: Note, alpha and gamma are in the range (-pi, pi] while beta in in the range [0, pi]

member.summary:
Morphs an Euclidean point.
This method is abstract.
member.param: A point that will be morphed by this function.
member.returns: Resulting morphed point.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.SpaceMorph.Tolerance
member.summary: The desired accuracy of the morph. This value is primarily used for deforming surfaces and breps. The default is 0.0 and any value <= 0.0 is ignored by morphing functions. The Tolerance value does not affect the way meshes and points are morphed.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.SpaceMorph.QuickPreview
member.summary: true if the morph should be done as quickly as possible because the result is being used for some type of dynamic preview. If QuickPreview is true, the tolerance may be ignored. The QuickPreview value does not affect the way meshes and points are morphed. The default is false.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.SpaceMorph.PreserveStructure
member.summary: true if the morph should be done in a way that preserves the structure of the geometry. In particular, for NURBS objects, true means that only the control points are moved. The PreserveStructure value does not affect the way meshes and points are morphed. The default is false.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Morphs.TwistSpaceMorph.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary:

member.summary: Deforms objects by bending along a spine arc.

member.summary: Constructs a bend space morph.
member.param: Start of spine that represents the original orientation of the object.
End of spine.
Point to bend through.
If false, then point determines the region to bend. If true, only the spine region is bent.
If false, then only one end of the object bends. If true, then the object will bend symmetrically around the center if you start the spine in the middle of the object.

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.Morphs.MaelstromSpaceMorph
member.summary: Deforms objects in a spiral as if they were caught in a whirlpool.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Morphs.MaelstromSpaceMorph.#ctor(Rhino.Geometry.Plane,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Constructs a maelstrom space morph.
member.param: Plane on which the base circle will lie. Origin of the plane will be the center point of the circle.
First radius.
Second radius.
Coil angle in radians.

remarks.para:
If radius0 = radius1 > 0, then the morph is a rotation where the angle of rotation is proportional to the radius.
If radius0 < radius1, then everything inside of the circle of radius radius0 if fixed, the rotation angle increases smoothly from 0 at radius0 to m_a at radius1, and everything outside of the circle of radius radius1 is rotated by angle.
If radius0 > radius1, then everything outside of the circle of radius radius0 if fixed, the rotation angle increases smoothly from 0 at radius0 to m_a at radius1, and everything inside of the circle of radius radius1 is rotated by angle.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Interval.FromIntersection(Rhino.Geometry.Interval,Rhino.Geometry.Interval)
member.summary: Returns a new Interval that is the Intersection of the two input Intervals.
member.param: The first input interval.
The second input interval.
member.returns: If the intersection is not empty, then intersection = [max(a.Min(),b.Min()), min(a.Max(),b.Max())] The interval [ON.UnsetValue,ON.UnsetValue] is considered to be the empty set interval. The result of any intersection involving an empty set interval or disjoint intervals is the empty set interval.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Interval.FromUnion(Rhino.Geometry.Interval,Rhino.Geometry.Interval)
member.summary: Returns a new Interval which contains both inputs.
member.param: The first input interval.
The second input interval.
member.returns:
The union of an empty set and an increasing interval is the increasing interval.
The union of two empty sets is empty.
The union of an empty set an a non-empty interval is the non-empty interval.
The union of two non-empty intervals is [min(a.Min(),b.Min()), max(a.Max(),b.Max())]

member.summary:
Orders a set of points so they will be connected in a "reasonable polyline" order.
Also, removes points from the list if their common distance exceeds a specified threshold.

Minimum allowed distance among a pair of points. If points are closer than this, only one of them will be kept.

Components have decreasing evaluation priority: first X, then Y.

Second vector.

member.summary:
Computes the cross product (or vector product, or exterior product) of two vectors.
This operation is not commutative.
member.param: First vector.
Second vector.

has Length == a.Length * b.Length * sin(theta) where theta is the angle between a and b.
The resulting vector is oriented according to the right hand rule.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d.op_LessThan(Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d,Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d)
member.summary:
Determines whether the first specified vector comes before (has inferior sorting value than) the second vector.
Components evaluation priority is first X, then Y, then Z.
member.param: The first vector.
The second vector.
member.returns: true if a.X is smaller than b.X, or a.X == b.X and a.Y is smaller than b.Y, or a.X == b.X and a.Y == b.Y and a.Z is smaller than b.Z; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d.op_LessThanOrEqual(Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d,Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d)
member.summary:
Determines whether the first specified vector comes before (has inferior sorting value than) the second vector, or it is equal to it.
Components evaluation priority is first X, then Y, then Z.
member.param: The first vector.
The second vector.
member.returns: true if a.X is smaller than b.X, or a.X == b.X and a.Y is smaller than b.Y, or a.X == b.X and a.Y == b.Y and a.Z <= b.Z; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d.op_GreaterThan(Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d,Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d)
member.summary:
Determines whether the first specified vector comes after (has superior sorting value than) the second vector.
Components evaluation priority is first X, then Y, then Z.
member.param: The first vector.
The second vector.
member.returns: true if a.X is larger than b.X, or a.X == b.X and a.Y is larger than b.Y, or a.X == b.X and a.Y == b.Y and a.Z is larger than b.Z; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d.op_GreaterThanOrEqual(Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d,Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d)
member.summary:
Determines whether the first specified vector comes after (has superior sorting value than) the second vector, or it is equal to it.
Components evaluation priority is first X, then Y, then Z.
member.param: The first vector.
The second vector.
member.returns: true if a.X is larger than b.X, or a.X == b.X and a.Y is larger than b.Y, or a.X == b.X and a.Y == b.Y and a.Z >= b.Z; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d.AreOrthonormal(Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d,Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d,Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d)

member.name: M:Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d.AreRighthanded(Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d,Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d,Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d)

member.name: T:Rhino.Geometry.Continuity
member.summary: Provides enumerated values for continuity along geometry, such as continuous first derivative or continuous unit tangent and curvature.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.Continuity.None
member.summary: There is no continuity.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.Continuity.C0_continuous
member.summary: Continuous Function : Test for parametric continuity. In particular, all types of curves are considered infinitely continuous at the start/end of the evaluation domain.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.Continuity.C1_continuous
member.summary: Continuous first derivative : Test for parametric continuity. In particular, all types of curves are considered infinitely continuous at the start/end of the evaluation domain.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.Continuity.C2_continuous
member.summary: Continuous first derivative and second derivative : Test for parametric continuity. In particular, all types of curves are considered infinitely continuous at the start/end of the evaluation domain.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.Continuity.G1_continuous
member.summary: Continuous unit tangent : Test for parametric continuity. In particular, all types of curves are considered infinitely continuous at the start/end of the evaluation domain.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.Continuity.G2_continuous
member.summary: Continuous unit tangent and curvature : Test for parametric continuity. In particular, all types of curves are considered infinitely continuous at the start/end of the evaluation domain.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.Continuity.C0_locus_continuous
member.summary: Locus continuous function : Continuity tests using the following enum values are identical to tests using the preceding enum values on the INTERIOR of a curve's domain. At the END of a curve a "locus" test is performed in place of a parametric test. In particular, at the END of a domain, all open curves are locus discontinuous. At the END of a domain, all closed curves are at least C0_locus_continuous. By convention all Curves are considered locus continuous at the START of the evaluation domain. This convention is not strictly correct, but it was adopted to make iterative kink finding tools easier to use and so that locus discontinuities are reported once at the end parameter of a curve rather than twice.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.Continuity.C1_locus_continuous
member.summary: Locus continuous first derivative : Continuity tests using the following enum values are identical to tests using the preceding enum values on the INTERIOR of a curve's domain. At the END of a curve a "locus" test is performed in place of a parametric test. In particular, at the END of a domain, all open curves are locus discontinuous. At the END of a domain, all closed curves are at least C0_locus_continuous. By convention all Curves are considered locus continuous at the START of the evaluation domain. This convention is not strictly correct, but it was adopted to make iterative kink finding tools easier to use and so that locus discontinuities are reported once at the end parameter of a curve rather than twice.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.Continuity.C2_locus_continuous
member.summary: Locus continuous first and second derivative : Continuity tests using the following enum values are identical to tests using the preceding enum values on the INTERIOR of a curve's domain. At the END of a curve a "locus" test is performed in place of a parametric test. In particular, at the END of a domain, all open curves are locus discontinuous. At the END of a domain, all closed curves are at least C0_locus_continuous. By convention all Curves are considered locus continuous at the START of the evaluation domain. This convention is not strictly correct, but it was adopted to make iterative kink finding tools easier to use and so that locus discontinuities are reported once at the end parameter of a curve rather than twice.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.Continuity.G1_locus_continuous
member.summary: Locus continuous unit tangent : Continuity tests using the following enum values are identical to tests using the preceding enum values on the INTERIOR of a curve's domain. At the END of a curve a "locus" test is performed in place of a parametric test. In particular, at the END of a domain, all open curves are locus discontinuous. At the END of a domain, all closed curves are at least C0_locus_continuous. By convention all Curves are considered locus continuous at the START of the evaluation domain. This convention is not strictly correct, but it was adopted to make iterative kink finding tools easier to use and so that locus discontinuities are reported once at the end parameter of a curve rather than twice.

member.name: F:Rhino.Geometry.Continuity.G2_locus_continuous
member.summary: Locus continuous unit tangent and curvature : Continuity tests using the following enum values are identical to tests using the preceding enum values on the INTERIOR of a curve's domain. At the END of a curve a "locus" test is performed in place of a parametric test. In particular, at the END of a domain, all open curves are locus discontinuous. At the END of a domain, all closed curves are at least C0_locus_continuous. By convention all Curves are considered locus continuous at the START of the evaluation domain. This convention is not strictly correct, but it was adopted to make iterative kink finding tools easier to use and so that locus discontinuities are reported once at the end parameter of a curve rather than twice.

member.summary: 0: don't miter, 1: intersect surfaces and trim sweeps, 2: rotate shapes at kinks and don't trim.

member.summary: If the input rail is closed, ClosedSweep determines if the swept breps will also be closed.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.SweepOneRail.GlobalShapeBlending
member.summary: If true, the sweep is linearly blended from one end to the other, creating sweeps that taper from one cross-section curve to the other. If false, the sweep stays constant at the ends and changes more rapidly in the middle.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Unroller.AbsoluteTolerance
member.summary:
Gets or sets the absolute tolerance for the unrolling operation.
Absolute tolerance is used in the evaluation of new entities, such as intersections, reprojections and splits.
In the current implementation, absolute tolerance is used in tessellating rails, fitting curves and pulling back trims.

member.name: P:Rhino.Geometry.Unroller.RelativeTolerance
member.summary:
Gets or sets the relative tolerance for the unrolling operation.
Relative tolerance is used in the evaluation of intrinsic properties, such as computations "along" the surface or brep.
In the current implementation, relative tolerance is used to decide if a surface is flat enough to try to unroll. That helps ease the scale dependency. The surface has to be linear in one direction within (length * RelativeTolerance) to be considered linear for that purpose. Otherwise smash will ignore that tolerance and unroll anything.

member.returns: An array of breps. This array can be empty.

member.name: T:Rhino.RuntimeEnvironment
member.summary: ON::RuntimeEnvironment identifies a runtime environment (operating system). This value is saved in binary archives so appropriate adjustments to resources provided by runtime environments, like fonts, can be made when an archive created in one runtime environment is used in another.

member.name: F:Rhino.UnitSystem.LightYears
member.summary: 1 light year = 9.4607304725808e+15 meters A light year is the distance light travels in one Julian year. The speed of light is exactly 299792458 meters/second. A Julian year is exactly 365.25 * 86400 seconds and is approximately the time it takes for one earth orbit. References: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Light_year (9.4607304725808e+15 meters) http://units.nist.gov/Pubs/SP811/appenB9.htm (9.46073e+15 meters)

member.name: F:Rhino.DocObjects.DimensionStyle.Field.LengthFactor
member.summary: LengthFactor is a rarely used. It applies when a model is being drawn to a scale and the dimension length values should be reverse scaled. For example, if a model is drawn at 1/4 scale, a line 5 units long indicates the real world line is 20 units long. In this case setting LengthFactor to 4 would cause a linear dimension applied to that line to display a value of 20.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.DimensionStyle.ComponentType
member.summary: Returns .

members.member:
Normally, a DimensionStyle is neither a Child nor a Parent. Setting the value of DimensionStyle.ParentId to the Id of another DimensionStyle makes that style the Parent of this style. Fields in a DimensionStyle can get their values from the Child style or the Parent style. If a field is marked overridden in the Child style, the value of that field comes from the Parent. Typically, when an individual field is overridden for a specific annotation object, a Child DimensionStyle is made with that field marked as an overridden field (SetFieldOverride()) and that DimensionStyle is made the Child of the annotation object's DimensionStyle. Then the DimensionStyleId of the annotation object is set to the Id of the Child style
True if the field corresponding to field_id is overridden in this AnnotationStyle False if the field is not overridden

member.summary: Set a field as overridden

member.summary:
Gets or sets the recurrence of a wider line on the grid.
0: No lines are thick, all are drawn thin.
1: All lines are thick.
2: Every other line is thick.
3: One line in three lines is thick (and two are thin).
4: ...

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ConstructionPlane.DepthBuffered
member.summary:
Gets or sets whether the grid is drawn on top of geometry.
false=grid is always drawn behind 3d geometry
true=grid is drawn at its depth as a 3d plane and grid lines obscure things behind the grid.

member.summary:
For derived class implementers.
This method is called with argument true when class user calls Dispose(), while with argument false when the Garbage Collector invokes the finalizer, or Finalize() method.
You must reclaim all used unmanaged resources in both cases, and can use this chance to call Dispose on disposable fields if the argument is true.
Also, you must call the base virtual method within your overriding method.
member.param: true if the call comes from the Dispose() method; false if it comes from the Garbage Collector finalizer.

member.summary: Checks if the earth location is set or not.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.EarthAnchorPoint.GetModelCompass
member.summary: Returns a plane in model coordinates whose X axis points East, Y axis points North and Z axis points Up. The origin is set to ModelBasepoint.
member.returns: A plane value. This might be invalid on error.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.EarthAnchorPoint.GetModelToEarthTransform(Rhino.UnitSystem)
member.summary: Gets a transformation from model coordinates to earth coordinates. This transformation assumes the model is small enough that the curvature of the earth can be ignored.
member.param: The model unit system.
member.returns: Transform on success. Inalid Transform on error.
member.remarks:
If M is a point in model coordinates and E = model_to_earth*M, then E.x = latitude in decimal degrees E.y = longitude in decimal degrees E.z = elevation in meters above mean sea level Because the earth is not flat, there is a small amount of error when using a linear transformation to calculate oblate spherical coordinates. This error is small. If the distance from P to M is d meters, then the approximation error is latitude error <= longitude error <= elevation error <= 6379000*((1 + (d/6356000)^2)-1) meters
In particular, if every point in the model is within 1000 meters of the m_model_basepoint, then the maximum approximation errors are latitude error <= longitude error <= elevation error <= 8 centimeters.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.EarthAnchorPoint.GetEarthAnchorPlane(Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d@)
member.summary: Returns the earth anchor plane
member.returns: A plane value.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ModelComponent.ModelSerialNumber
member.summary: A value identifing the model that manages this component.
member.remarks: If the component is being managed by a model, this value identifies the model. In Rhino, this value is the document runtime serial number. Typically this value is set and locked by the code that adds a component to a model. This value is not saved in .3dm archives.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ModelComponent.ReferenceModelSerialNumber
member.summary: When a component is in a model for reference, this value identifies the reference model.
member.remarks: Reference components are not saved in .3dm archives. Typically this value is set and locked by the code that adds a component to a model. This value is not saved in .3dm archives.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ModelComponent.InstanceDefinitionModelSerialNumber
member.summary: When a component is in a model as part of the information required for a linked instance definition, this value identifies the the linked instance definition reference model.
member.remarks: Reference components are not saved in .3dm archives. Typically this value is set and locked by the code that adds a component to a model. This value is not saved in .3dm archives.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.Texture.FileName
member.summary:
Gets or sets a file name that is used by this texture.
NOTE: We are moving away from string-based FileName, and suggest the usage of the new FileReference class.
Also, this filename may well not be a path that makes sense on a user's computer because it was a path initially set on a different user's computer. If you want to get a workable path for this user, use the BitmapTable.Find function using this property.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.Texture.FileReference

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Texture.GetAlphaBlendValues(System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary:
If the TextureCombineMode is Blend, then the blending function for alpha is determined by
new alpha = constant + a0*(current alpha) + a1*(texture alpha) + a2*min(current alpha,texture alpha) + a3*max(current alpha,texture alpha)

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Texture.SetAlphaBlendValues(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary:
If the TextureCombineMode is Blend, then the blending function for alpha is determined by
new alpha = constant + a0*(current alpha) + a1*(texture alpha) + a2*min(current alpha,texture alpha) + a3*max(current alpha,texture alpha)

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Texture.SetRGBBlendValues(System.Drawing.Color,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary:
If the TextureCombineMode is Blend, then the blending function for RGB is determined by
new rgb = colorcolor + a0[0]*(current RGB) + a1[1]*(texture RGB) + a2[2]*min(current RGB,texture RGB) + a3[3]*max(current RGB,texture RGB)

member.name: T:Rhino.DocObjects.Custom.UserData
member.summary: Provides a base class for custom classes of information which may be attached to geometry or attribute classes.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Custom.UserData.Finalize
member.summary: Passively reclaims unmanaged resources when the class user did not explicitly call Dispose().

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Custom.UserData.Dispose
member.summary: Actively reclaims unmanaged resources that this instance uses.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Custom.UserData.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
For derived class implementers.
This method is called with argument true when class user calls Dispose(), while with argument false when the Garbage Collector invokes the finalizer, or Finalize() method.
You must reclaim all used unmanaged resources in both cases, and can use this chance to call Dispose on disposable fields if the argument is true.
Also, you must call the base virtual method within your overriding method.
member.param: true if the call comes from the Dispose() method; false if it comes from the Garbage Collector finalizer.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.Custom.UserData.Description
member.summary: Descriptive name of the user data.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.Custom.UserData.ShouldWrite
member.summary: If you want to save this user data in a 3dm file, override ShouldWrite and return true. If you do support serialization, you must also override the Read and Write functions.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Custom.UserData.Write(Rhino.FileIO.BinaryArchiveWriter)
member.summary: Writes the content of this data to a stream archive.
member.param: An archive.
member.returns: true if the data was successfully written. The default implementation always returns false.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Custom.UserData.Read(Rhino.FileIO.BinaryArchiveReader)
member.summary: Reads the content of this data from a stream archive.
member.param: An archive.
member.returns: true if the data was successfully written. The default implementation always returns false.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Custom.UserData.OnTransform(Rhino.Geometry.Transform)

member.param: The transform being applied.

member.summary: Is called when the object is being duplicated.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Custom.UserData.Copy(Rhino.Runtime.CommonObject,Rhino.Runtime.CommonObject)
member.summary: Expert user tool that copies user data that has a positive CopyCount from the source object to a destination object. Generally speaking you don't need to use Copy(). Simply rely on things like the copy constructors to do the right thing.
member.param: A source object for the data.
A destination object for the data.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Custom.UserData.MoveUserDataFrom(Rhino.Runtime.CommonObject)
member.summary: Moves the user data from objectWithUserData to a temporary data storage identifierd by the return Guid. When MoveUserDataFrom returns, the objectWithUserData will not have any user data.
member.param: Object with user data attached.
member.returns: Guid identifier for storage of UserData that is held in a temporary list by this class. This function should be used in conjunction with MoveUserDataTo to transfer the user data to a different object. Returns Guid.Empty if there was no user data to transfer.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Custom.UserData.MoveUserDataTo(Rhino.Runtime.CommonObject,System.Guid,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Moves the user data.
See for more information.
member.param: Object data source.
Target.
If the data should be appended or replaced.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.Custom.UserData.Transform
member.summary: Updated if user data is attached to a piece of geometry that is transformed and the virtual OnTransform() is not overridden. If you override OnTransform() and want Transform to be updated, then call the base class OnTransform() in your override. The default constructor sets Transform to the identity.

param.para: 1 = next grip in the first parameter direction.

-1 = prev grip in the second parameter direction.

-1 = prev grip in the third parameter direction.

member.summary: Get or set whether this projection is perspective.

member.summary: Get or set whether this projection is parallel.

member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether this projection is a two-point perspective.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.ChangeToParallelProjection(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Use this function to change projections of valid viewports from parallel to perspective. It will make common additional adjustments to the frustum and camera location so the resulting views are similar. The camera direction and target point are not be changed. If the current projection is parallel and symmetricFrustum, FrustumIsLeftRightSymmetric() and FrustumIsTopBottomSymmetric() are all equal, then no changes are made and true is returned.
member.param: true if you want the resulting frustum to be symmetric.
member.returns: true if the operation succeeded; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.ChangeToPerspectiveProjection(System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Double)
member.summary: Use this function to change projections of valid viewports from parallel to perspective. It will make common additional adjustments to the frustum and camera location so the resulting views are similar. The camera direction and target point are not changed. If the current projection is perspective and symmetricFrustum, IsFrustumIsLeftRightSymmetric, and IsFrustumIsTopBottomSymmetric are all equal, then no changes are made and true is returned.
member.param: If RhinoMath.UnsetValue this parameter is ignored. Otherwise it must be > 0 and indicates which plane in the current view frustum should be perserved.
true if you want the resulting frustum to be symmetric.

(pass 50.0 when in doubt) 35 mm lens length to use when changing from parallel to perspective projections. If the current projection is perspective or lens_length is <= 0.0, then this parameter is ignored.
member.returns: true if the operation succeeded; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.ChangeToTwoPointPerspectiveProjection(System.Double,Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d,System.Double)
member.summary: Changes projections of valid viewports to a two point perspective. It will make common additional adjustments to the frustum and camera location and direction so the resulting views are similar. If the current projection is perspective and IsFrustumIsLeftRightSymmetric is true and IsFrustumIsTopBottomSymmetric is false, then no changes are made and true is returned.
member.param: If RhinoMath.UnsetValue this parameter is ignored. Otherwise it must be > 0 and indicates which plane in the current view frustum should be perserved.
The locked up direction. Pass Vector3d.Zero if you want to use the world axis direction that is closest to the current up direction. Pass CameraY() if you want to preserve the current up direction.

(pass 50.0 when in doubt) 35 mm lens length to use when changing from parallel to perspective projections. If the current projection is perspective or lens_length is <= 0.0, then this parameter is ignored.
member.returns: true if the operation succeeded; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Setting FrustumAspect changes the larger of the frustum's width/height so that the resulting value of width/height matches the requested aspect. The camera angle is not changed. member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.ChangeToSymmetricFrustum(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Double)
member.summary: If needed, adjusts the current frustum so it has the specified symmetries and adjust the camera location so the target plane remains visible.
member.param: If true, the frustum will be adjusted so left = -right.
If true, the frustum will be adjusted so top = -bottom.

If projection is not perspective or target_distance is RhinoMath.UnsetValue, then this parameter is ignored. If the projection is perspective and targetDistance is not RhinoMath.UnsetValue, then it must be > 0.0 and it is used to determine which plane in the old frustum will appear unchanged in the new frustum.
member.returns: Returns true if the viewport has now a frustum with the specified symmetries.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.GetPointDepth(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,System.Double@)
member.summary: Gets the clipping distance of a point. This function ignores the current value of the viewport's near and far settings. If the viewport is a perspective projection, then it intersects the semi infinite frustum volume with the bounding box and returns the near and far distances of the intersection. If the viewport is a parallel projection, it instersects the infinte view region with the bounding box and returns the near and far distances of the projection.
member.param: A point to measure.
distance of the point (can be < 0)
member.returns: true if the bounding box intersects the view frustum and near_dist/far_dist were set. false if the bounding box does not intesect the view frustum.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.GetBoundingBoxDepth(Rhino.Geometry.BoundingBox,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Gets near and far clipping distances of a bounding box. This function ignores the current value of the viewport's near and far settings. If the viewport is a perspective projection, the it intersects the semi infinite frustum volume with the bounding box and returns the near and far distances of the intersection. If the viewport is a parallel projection, it instersects the infinte view region with the bounding box and returns the near and far distances of the projection.
member.param: The bounding box to sample.
Near distance of the box. This value can be zero or negative when the camera location is inside bbox.
Far distance of the box. This value can be equal to near_dist, zero or negative when the camera location is in front of the bounding box.
member.returns: true if the bounding box intersects the view frustum and near_dist/far_dist were set. false if the bounding box does not intesect the view frustum.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.GetSphereDepth(Rhino.Geometry.Sphere,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Gets near and far clipping distances of a bounding sphere.
member.param: The sphere to sample.
Near distance of the sphere (can be < 0)
Far distance of the sphere (can be equal to near_dist)
member.returns: true if the sphere intersects the view frustum and near_dist/far_dist were set. false if the sphere does not intesect the view frustum.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.SetFrustumNearFar(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets near and far clipping distance subject to constraints.
member.param: (>0) desired near clipping distance.
(>near_dist) desired near clipping distance.
If min_near_dist <= 0.0, it is ignored. If min_near_dist > 0 and near_dist < min_near_dist, then the frustum's near_dist will be increased to min_near_dist.

If min_near_over_far <= 0.0, it is ignored. If near_dist < far_dist*min_near_over_far, then near_dist is increased and/or far_dist is decreased so that near_dist = far_dist*min_near_over_far. If near_dist < target_dist < far_dist, then near_dist near_dist is increased and far_dist is decreased so that projection precision will be good at target_dist. Otherwise, near_dist is simply set to far_dist*min_near_over_far.
If target_dist <= 0.0, it is ignored. If target_dist > 0, it is used as described in the description of the min_near_over_far parameter.
member.returns: true if operation succeeded; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.FrustumNearPlane
member.summary: Gets near clipping plane if camera and frustum are valid. The plane's frame is the same as the camera's frame. The origin is located at the intersection of the camera direction ray and the near clipping plane. The plane's normal points out of the frustum towards the camera location.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.FrustumFarPlane
member.summary: Gets far clipping plane if camera and frustum are valid. The plane's frame is the same as the camera's frame. The origin is located at the intersection of the camera direction ray and the far clipping plane. The plane's normal points into the frustum towards the camera location.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.GetFarPlaneCorners
member.summary: Gets the corners of far clipping plane rectangle. 4 points are returned in the order of bottom left, bottom right, top left, top right.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.DollyCamera(Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d)
member.summary: DollyCamera() does not update the frustum's clipping planes. To update the frustum's clipping planes call DollyFrustum(d) with d = dollyVector o cameraFrameZ. To convert screen locations into a dolly vector, use GetDollyCameraVector(). Does not update frustum. To update frustum use DollyFrustum(d) with d = dollyVector o cameraFrameZ.
member.param: dolly vector in world coordinates.
member.returns: true if the operation succeeded; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.GetDollyCameraVector(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Gets a world coordinate dolly vector that can be passed to DollyCamera().
member.param: Screen coords of start point.
Screen coords of start point.
Screen coords of end point.
Screen coords of end point.
Distance of projection plane from camera. When in doubt, use 0.5*(frus_near+frus_far).
member.returns: The world coordinate dolly vector.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.GetDollyCameraVector(System.Drawing.Point,System.Drawing.Point,System.Double)
member.summary: Gets a world coordinate dolly vector that can be passed to DollyCamera().
member.param: Start point.
End point.
Distance of projection plane from camera. When in doubt, use 0.5*(frus_near+frus_far).
member.returns: The world coordinate dolly vector.

member.summary: Moves the frustum clipping planes.
member.param: Distance to move in camera direction.
member.returns: true if the operation succeeded; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.DollyExtents(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Rhino.Geometry.GeometryBase},System.Double)
member.summary: Dolly the camera location and so that the view frustum contains all of the document objects that can be seen in view. If the projection is perspective, the camera angle is not changed.
member.param: If border > 1.0, then the fustum in enlarged by this factor to provide a border around the view. 1.1 works well for parallel projections; 0.0 is suggested for perspective projections.
member.returns: True if successful.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.DollyExtents(Rhino.Geometry.BoundingBox,System.Double)
member.summary: Dolly the camera location and so that the view frustum contains all of the document objects that can be seen in view. If the projection is perspective, the camera angle is not changed.
member.param: If border > 1.0, then the fustum in enlarged by this factor to provide a border around the view. 1.1 works well for parallel projections; 0.0 is suggested for perspective projections.
member.returns: True if successful.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.ViewScale
member.summary: Applies scaling factors to parallel projection clipping coordinates by setting the m_clip_mod transformation. If you want to compress the view projection across the viewing plane, then set x = 0.5, y = 1.0, and z = 1.0.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.FrustumCenterPoint(System.Double)
member.summary: Return a point on the central axis of the view frustum. This point is a good choice for a general purpose target point.
member.param: If targetDistance > 0.0, then the distance from the returned point to the camera plane will be targetDistance. Note that if the frustum is not symmetric, the distance from the returned point to the camera location will be larger than targetDistance. If targetDistance == ON_UNSET_VALUE and the frustum is valid with near > 0.0, then 0.5*(near + far) will be used as the targetDistance.
member.returns: A point on the frustum's central axis. If the viewport or input is not valid, then ON_3dPoint::UnsetPoint is returned.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.TargetPoint
member.summary: The current value of the target point. This point does not play a role in the view projection calculations. It can be used as a fixed point when changing the camera so the visible regions of the before and after frustums both contain the region of interest. The default constructor sets this point on ON_3dPoint::UnsetPoint. You must explicitly call one SetTargetPoint() functions to set the target point.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.TargetDistance(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the distance from the target point to the camera plane. Note that if the frustum is not symmetric, then this distance is shorter than the distance from the target to the camera location.
member.param: If bUseFrustumCenterFallback is false and the target point is not valid, then ON_UNSET_VALUE is returned. If bUseFrustumCenterFallback is true and the frustum is valid and current target point is not valid or is behind the camera, then 0.5*(near + far) is returned.
member.returns: Shortest signed distance from camera plane to target point. If the target point is on the visible side of the camera, a positive value is returned. ON_UNSET_VALUE is returned when the input of view is not valid.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ViewportInfo.Id
member.summary: Sets the viewport's id to the value used to uniquely identify this viewport. There is no approved way to change the viewport id once it is set in order to maintain consistency across multiple viewports and those routines that manage them.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.BitmapTable.Find(System.String,System.Boolean,System.String@)
member.summary: This function first attempts to find the file with "name" on the disk. If it does find it, "fileName" is set to the full path of the file and the BitmapEntry returned will be null, even if there was a BitmapEntry with "name" in the bitmap table. If the function cannot find the file on the disk, it searches the bitmap table. If it finds it, the returned BitmapEntry entry will be the entry in the table with that name. Additionally, if "createFile" is true, and an entry is found, the file will be written to the disk and it's full path will be contained in "fileName".
member.param: Name of the file to search for including file extension.

If this is true, and the file is not found on the disk but is found in the BitmapTable, then the BitmapEntry will get saved to the Rhino bitmap file cache and fileName will contain the full path to the cached file.
The full path to the current location of this file or an empty string if the file was not found and/or not extracted successfully.
member.returns: Returns null if "name" was found on the disk. If name was not found on the disk, returns the BitmapEntry with the specified name if it is found in the bitmap table and null if it was not found in the bitmap table.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.BitmapTable.AddBitmap(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a new bitmap with specified name to the bitmap table.
member.param: If NULL or empty, then a unique name of the form "Bitmap 01" will be automatically created.
If true and the there is alread a bitmap using the specified name, then that bitmap is replaced. If false and there is already a bitmap using the specified name, then -1 is returned.
member.returns: index of new bitmap in table on success. -1 on error.

member.summary: Redraws all views.
member.remarks:
If you change something in the document -- like adding objects, deleting objects, modifying layer or object display attributes, etc., then you need to call Redraw to redraw all the views.
If you change something in a particular view like the projection, construction plane, background bitmap, etc., then you need to call CRhinoView::Redraw to redraw that particular view.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.ObjectTable.FindId(System.Guid)
member.summary: Uses the object guid to find a rhino object. Deleted objects cannot be found by id. The guid is the value that is stored on RhinoObject.Id In a single document, no two active objects have the same guid. If an object is replaced with a new object, then the guid persists. For example, if the _Move command moves an object, then the moved object inherits it's guid from the starting object. If the Copy command copies an object, then the copy gets a new guid. This guid persists through file saving/openning operations. This function will not find grip objects.
member.param: ID of object to search for.
member.returns: Reference to the rhino object with the objectId or null if no such object could be found.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.ObjectTable.TryFindPoint(System.Guid,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d@)
member.summary: Finds the location of a point, if a point exists in the document.
member.param: ID of point object to search for.
The point will be passed here.
member.returns: true on success; false if point was not found, id represented another geometry type, or on error.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.ObjectTable.FindGeometry(System.Guid)
member.summary: Same as FindId, but returns the Geometry property directly, if it exists.
member.param: ID of object to search for.
member.returns: Reference to the geometry in the rhino object with the objectId or null if no such object could be found.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.ObjectTable.Find(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Use the object runtime serial number to find a rhino object in the document. This is the value stored on RhinoObject.RuntimeObjectSerialNumber. The RhinoObject constructor sets the runtime serial number and every instance of a RhinoObject class will have a unique serial number for the duration of the Rhino application. If an object is replaced with a new object, then the new object will have a different runtime serial number. Deleted objects stored in the undo list maintain their runtime serial numbers and this funtion will return pointers to these objects. Call RhinoObject.IsDeleted if you need to determine if the returned object is active or deleted. The runtime serial number is not saved in files.
member.param: Runtime serial number to search for.
member.returns: Reference to the rhino object with the objectId or null if no such object could be found.

member.summary: Finds all RhinoObjects that are in a given group.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.ObjectTable.FindByUserString(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Finds all objects whose UserString matches the search patterns.
member.param: Search pattern for UserString keys (supported wildcards are: ? = any single character, * = any sequence of characters).
Search pattern for UserString values (supported wildcards are: ? = any single character, * = any sequence of characters).
If true, string comparison will be case sensitive.
member.returns: An array of all objects whose UserString matches with the search patterns or null when no such objects could be found.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.ObjectTable.FindByUserString(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectType)
member.summary: Finds all objects whose UserString matches the search patterns.
member.param: Search pattern for UserString keys (supported wildcards are: ? = any single character, * = any sequence of characters).
Search pattern for UserString values (supported wildcards are: ? = any single character, * = any sequence of characters).
If true, string comparison will be case sensitive.
If true, UserStrings attached to the geometry of an object will be searched.
If true, UserStrings attached to the attributes of an object will be searched.
Object type filter.
member.returns: An array of all objects whose UserString matches with the search patterns or null when no such objects could be found.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.ObjectTable.FindByUserString(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectEnumeratorSettings)

Search pattern for UserString values (supported wildcards are: ? = any single character, * = any sequence of characters).

If true, UserStrings attached to the geometry of an object will be searched.
If true, UserStrings attached to the attributes of an object will be searched.
Filter used to restrict the number of objects searched.
member.returns: An array of all objects whose UserString matches with the search patterns or null when no such objects could be found.

member.returns: The new object ID on success.
member.exception: If geometry is null.

member.returns: The new object ID on success.
member.exception: If geometry is null.

member.summary:
Adds geometry that is not further specified.
This is meant, for example, to handle addition of sets of different geometrical entities.
member.param: The base geometry. This cannot be null.
The object attributes. This can be null.

If reference is true, object will not be saved in the 3dm file.
member.returns: The new object ID on success.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.ObjectTable.AddPictureFrame(Rhino.Geometry.Plane,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a PictureFrame object from a plane and a path to an image file, Note, a PictureFrame object is just a Plane surface or mesh that has a material with a texture assigned to it that displays in all display modes.
member.param: Plane in which the PictureFrame will be created. Bottom left corner of picture will be at plane's origin, width will be in the plane's x axis direction, height will be in the plane's y axis direction.
path to an image file
If true, the function will make a MeshObject rather than a surface

Width of the resulting PictureFrame. If 0.0, the width of the pictureframe is the width of the image if height is also 0.0 or calculated from the height and aspect ratio of the image if height is not 0.0.

Height of the resulting PictureFrame. If 0.0, the height of the pictureframe is the height of the image if width is also 0.0 or calculated from the width and aspect ratio of the image if width is not 0.0.
If true, the image mapped to the picture frame plane always displays at full intensity and is not affected by light or shadow.
If true, the funtion adds the the image to the bitmaptable of the document to which the PictureFrame will be added
member.returns: A unique identifier for the object

Objects that are persistently selected stay selected when a command terminates.

If true, then objects with grips on can be selected. If false, then the value returned by the object's IsSelectableWithGripsOn() function decides if the object can be selected when it has grips turned on.
If true, then objects on locked layers can be selected.
If true, then objects on hidden layers can be selectable.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.InstanceDefinitionTable.MakeSourcePathRelative(Rhino.DocObjects.InstanceDefinition,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Obsolete method that always returns false. Marks the source path for a linked instance definition as relative or absolute.
member.param: The instance definition to be marked.

param.name: relative
param.para: If true, the path should be considered as relative.
If false, the path should be considered as absolute.
