member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.InstanceDefinitionTable.Delete(System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Deletes the instance definition.
member.param: zero based index of instance definition to delete. This must be in the range 0 <= idefIndex < InstanceDefinitionTable.Count.
true to delete all references to this definition. false to delete definition only if there are no references.
If true, no warning message box appears if an instance definition cannot be deleted because it is the current layer or it contains active geometry.
member.returns: true if successful. false if the instance definition has active references and bDeleteReferences is false.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.InstanceDefinitionTable.Delete(Rhino.DocObjects.InstanceDefinition)
member.summary: Deletes the instance definition. This deletes all references too.
member.param: The item to delete.
member.returns: True on success.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.InstanceDefinitionTable.Purge(System.Int32)
member.summary: Purges an instance definition and its definition geometry.
member.param: zero based index of instance definition to delete. This must be in the range 0 <= idefIndex < InstanceDefinitionTable.Count.
member.returns: True if successful. False if the instance definition cannot be purged because it is in use by reference objects or undo information.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.InstanceDefinitionTable.Compact(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Purge deleted instance definition information that is not in use. This function is time consuming and should be used in a thoughtful manner.
member.param: If false, then deleted instance definition information that could possibly be undeleted by the Undo command will not be deleted. If true, then all deleted instance definition information is deleted.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.InstanceDefinitionTable.Undelete(System.Int32)
member.summary: Undeletes an instance definition that has been deleted by Delete()
member.param: zero based index of instance definition to delete. This must be in the range 0 <= idefIndex < InstanceDefinitionTable.Count.
member.returns: true if successful

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.InstanceDefinitionTable.UpdateLinkedInstanceDefinition(System.Int32,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Read the objects from a file and use them as the instance's definition geometry.
member.param: zero based index of instance definition to delete. This must be in the range 0 <= idefIndex < InstanceDefinitionTable.Count.
name of file (can be any type of file that Rhino or a plug-in can read)
If true and the instance definition referes to a linked instance definition, that needs to be updated, then the nested defition is also updated. If false, nested updates are skipped.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.InstanceDefinitionTable.GetList(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets an array of instance definitions.
member.param: If true then deleted idefs are filtered out.
member.returns: An array of instance definitions. This can be empty, but not null.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.InstanceDefinitionTable.GetUnusedInstanceDefinitionName
member.summary: Gets unsed instance definition name used as default when creating new instance definitions.
member.returns: An unused instance definition name string.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.InstanceDefinitionTable.GetUnusedInstanceDefinitionName(System.String)
member.summary: Gets unsed instance definition name used as default when creating new instance definitions.
member.param: The returned name is 'root nn' If root is empty, then 'Block' (localized) is used.
member.returns: An unused instance definition name string.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.InstanceDefinitionTable.GetUnusedInstanceDefinitionName(System.String,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Gets unsed instance definition name used as default when creating new instance definitions.
member.param: The returned name is 'root nn' If root is empty, then 'Block' (localized) is used.

Unique names are created by appending a decimal number to the localized term for "Block" as in "Block 01", "Block 02", and so on. When defaultSuffix is supplied, the search for an unused name begins at "Block suffix".
member.returns: An unused instance definition name string.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.LayerTable.CurrentLayerIndex
member.summary: At all times, there is a "current" layer. Unless otherwise specified, new objects are assigned to the current layer. The current layer is never locked, hidden, or deleted. Resturns: Zero based layer table index of the current layer.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.LayerTable.SetCurrentLayerIndex(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: At all times, there is a "current" layer. Unless otherwise specified, new objects are assigned to the current layer. The current layer is never locked, hidden, or deleted.
member.param: Value for new current layer. 0 <= layerIndex < LayerTable.Count. The layer's mode is automatically set to NormalMode.
if true, then no warning message box pops up if the current layer request can't be satisfied.
member.returns: true if current layer index successfully set.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.LayerTable.CurrentLayer
member.summary:
At all times, there is a "current" layer. Unless otherwise specified, new objects are assigned to the current layer. The current layer is never locked, hidden, or deleted.
Returns reference to the current layer. Note that this reference may become invalid after a call to AddLayer().

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.LayerTable.Find(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Finds the layer with a given name. If multiple layers exist that have the same name, the first match layer index will be returned.
Deleted layers have no name.
member.param: name of layer to search for. The search ignores case.
true means don't search deleted layers.
member.returns: index of the layer with the given name. If no layer is found, the index of the default layer, -1, is returned.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.LayerTable.FindNext(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Use FindName(name, index).
member.param: Do not use.
Do not use.
member.returns: Do not use.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.LayerTable.FindByFullPath(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Searches for a layer using the fully qualified name, that includes ancestors.
Deleted layers have no name.
member.param: The full layer name.
Should be -1 to get the index of the OpenNURBS default layer, or UnsetIntIndex to get an always-out-of-bound value.
member.returns: The index of the found layer, or notFoundReturnValue.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.LayerTable.Find(System.Guid,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Finds a layer with a given name and matching parent ID.
member.param: A valid layer ID.
name of layer to search for. The search ignores case.
If true, deleted layers are not checked. NOT SUPPORTED FOR NAME SEARCH, only for Guids.
member.returns: >=0 index of the layer with the given name -1 no layer has the given name.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.LayerTable.Find(System.Guid,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Finds a layer with a given name and matching parent ID.
member.param: A valid layer ID.
name of layer to search for. The search ignores case.
Should be -1 to get the index of the OpenNURBS default layer, or UnsetIntIndex to get an always-out-of-bound value.
member.returns: The index of the found layer, or notFoundReturnValue.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.LayerTable.Find(System.Guid,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Finds a layer with a matching ID.

If true, deleted layers are not checked.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.LayerTable.Find(System.Guid,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Finds a layer with a matching ID.

If true, deleted layers are not checked.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.LayerTable.FindName(System.String)
member.summary:
Finds the layer with a given name. If multiple layers exist that have the same name, the first match layer index will be returned.
Deleted layers have no name.
The default layer is NOT included in the search. If required, use the overload with startIndex input.
member.param: name of layer to search for. The search ignores case.
member.returns: A layer, or null.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.LayerTable.FindName(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Finds the next layer that has an index equal or higher than the searched value.
Search in case-insensitive.
member.param: If you specify RhinoMath.UnsetIntIndex, then also default layers will be included. This is the first index that will be tested.
The layer to search for.
member.returns: A layer, or null.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.LayerTable.FindNameHash(Rhino.FileIO.NameHash)
member.summary: Finds a Layer given its name hash.
member.param: The name hash of the Layer to be searched.
member.returns: An Layer, or null on error.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.LayerTable.FindIndex(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves a Layer object based on Index. This seach type of search is discouraged. We are moving towards using only IDs for all tables.
member.param: The index to search for.
member.returns: A Layer object, or null if none was found.

member.summary: Returns number of linetypes in the linetypes table, including deleted linetypes.

member.summary: Returns number of linetypes in the linetypes table, excluding deleted linetypes.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.LinetypeTable.CurrentLinetypeIndex
member.summary: At all times, there is a "current" linetype. Unless otherwise specified, new objects are assigned to the current linetype. If the current linetype source is LinetypeFromLayer the object's layer's linetype is used instead.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.LinetypeTable.LinetypeScale
member.summary: For display in Rhino viewports, the linetypes are scaled by a single scale factor for all viewports. This is not used for printing, where all linetype patterns are scaled to print in their defined size 1:1 on the paper.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.LinetypeTable.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Conceptually, the linetype table is an array of linetypes. The operator[] can be used to get individual linetypes. A linetype is either active or deleted and this state is reported by Linetype.IsDeleted.
member.param: zero based array index.
member.returns: Refererence to the linetype. If index is out of range, the current linetype is returned. Note that this reference may become invalid after AddLinetype() is called.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.LinetypeTable.CurrentLinetypeSource
member.summary: Source used by an object to determine its current linetype to be used by new objects.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.LinetypeTable.SetCurrentLinetypeIndex(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: At all times, there is a "current" linetype. Unless otherwise specified, new objects are assigned to the current linetype. The current linetype is never deleted.
member.param: Value for new current linetype. 0 <= linetypeIndex < LinetypeTable.Count.
if true, then no warning message box pops up if the current linetype request can't be satisfied.
member.returns: true if current linetype index successfully set.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.LinetypeTable.LinetypeIndexForObject(Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject)
member.summary: Returns the effective linetype index to be used to find the linetype definition to draw an object. If an object's linetype source is LinetypeFromObject, the linetype index in the object's attributes is used. If an object's linetype source is LinetypeFromLayer the linetype index from the object's layer is used.
member.param: The Rhino object to use in the query.
member.returns: The effective linetype index.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.LinetypeTable.CurrentLinetype
member.summary: Returns reference to the current linetype. Note that this reference may become invalid after a call to AddLinetype().
member.remarks: At all times, there is a "current" linetype. Unless otherwise specified, new objects are assigned to the current linetype. The current linetype is never deleted.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Tables.LinetypeTable.LoadDefaultLinetypes
member.summary: Fills in the linetype table with any default linetypes not already included.
member.remarks: New documents only contain the continuous linetype. Other default linetypes are added, on demand, when the user needs them. Calling this function ensures that the linetype table is populated with the default linetypes.
member.returns: The number of default linetypes added to the linetype table.

member.summary: Passively reclaims unmanaged resources when the class user did not explicitly call Dispose().

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.HistoryRecord.Dispose
member.summary: Actively reclaims unmanaged resources that this instance uses.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.HistoryRecord.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
For derived class implementers.
This method is called with argument true when class user calls Dispose(), while with argument false when the Garbage Collector invokes the finalizer, or Finalize() method.
You must reclaim all used unmanaged resources in both cases, and can use this chance to call Dispose on disposable fields if the argument is true.
Also, you must call the base virtual method within your overriding method.
member.param: true if the call comes from the Dispose() method; false if it comes from the Garbage Collector finalizer.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.HistoryRecord.SetHistoryVersion(System.Int32)
member.summary: Specifies a non-zero integer that identifies the version of this history record. The virtual ReplayHistory() functions can check this version to avoid replaying history using information created by earlier versions of the command.
member.param: Any non-zero integer. It is strongly suggested that something like YYYYMMDD be used.
member.returns: True if successful.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.HistoryRecord.CopyOnReplaceObject
member.summary: When an object is replaced and the old object has a history record with this field set, the history record is copied and attached to the new object. That allows a descendant object to continue the history linkage after it is edited.

member.name: T:Rhino.DocObjects.InstanceDefinitionUpdateType
member.summary: The possible relationships between the instance definition geometry and the archive containing the original defition.

member.name: F:Rhino.DocObjects.InstanceDefinitionUpdateType.Static
member.summary: The Rhino user interface uses the term "Embedded" for Static update types. This instance definition is never updated. If m_source_archive is set, it records the origin of the instance definition geometry, but m_source_archive is never used to update the instance definition.

member.name: F:Rhino.DocObjects.InstanceDefinitionUpdateType.Embedded
member.summary: This instance definition geometry was imported from another archive (m_source_archive) and is embedded. If m_source_archive changes, the user is asked if they want to update the instance definition.

member.name: F:Rhino.DocObjects.InstanceDefinitionUpdateType.LinkedAndEmbedded
member.summary: This instance definition geometry was imported from another archive (m_source_archive) and is embedded. If m_source_archive changes, the instance definition is automatically updated. If m_source_archive is not available, the instance definition is still valid.

member.name: F:Rhino.DocObjects.InstanceDefinitionUpdateType.Linked
member.summary: This instance definition geometry was imported from another archive (m_source_archive) and is not embedded. If m_source_archive changes, the instance definition is automatically updated. If m_source_archive is not available, the instance definition is not valid. This does not save runtime memory. It may save a little disk space, but it is a foolish option requested by people who do not understand all the issues.

member.name: T:Rhino.DocObjects.InstanceDefinitionLayerStyle
member.summary: A InstanceDefinitionUpdateType.Static or InstanceDefinitionUpdateType.LinkedAndEmbedded idef must have LayerStyle = Unset, a InstanceDefinitionUpdateType.Linked InstanceDefnition must have LayerStyle = Active or Reference

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Layer.GetDefaultLayerProperties
member.summary:
Constructs a layer with the current default properties. The default layer properties are:
color = Rhino.ApplicationSettings.AppearanceSettings.DefaultLayerColor
line style = Rhino.ApplicationSettings.AppearanceSettings.DefaultLayerLineStyle
material index = -1
iges level = -1
mode = NormalLayer

layer index = 0 (ignored by AddLayer)

true to make layer visible, false to make layer invisible.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Layer.PerViewportPersistentVisibility(System.Guid)
member.summary: Gets the per layer persistent visibility. The persistent visbility setting is used for layers whose visibilty can be changed by a parent layer. In this case, when a parent layer is turned off, then child layers are also turned off. The persistent visibility setting determines what happens when the parent is turned on again.
member.returns: Return true if this layer's visibility in the specified viewport is controlled by a parent object and the parent is turned on (after being off), then this layer will also be turned on in the specified viewport. Returns false if this layer's visibility in the specified viewport is controlled by a parent object and the parent layer is turned on(after being off), then this layer will continue to be off in the specified viewport.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Layer.SetPerViewportPersistentVisibility(System.Guid,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the per layer persistent visibility. The persistent visbility setting is used for layers whose visibilty can be changed by a parent layer. In this case, when a parent layer is turned off, then child layers are also turned off. The persistent visibility setting determines what happens when the parent is turned on again.
member.param: If not Guid.Empty, then the setting applies only to the viewport with the specified id. If Guid.Empty, then the setting applies to all viewports with per viewport layer settings.

If true, this layer's visibility in the specified viewport is controlled by a parent object and the parent is turned on (after being off), then this layer will also be turned on in the specified viewport. If false, this layer's visibility in the specified viewport is controlled by a parent object and the parent layer is turned on (after being off), then this layer will continue to be off in the specified viewport.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Layer.UnsetPerViewportPersistentVisibility(System.Guid)
member.summary: Remove any per viewport persistent visibility setting so the layer's overall setting will be used for all viewports.
member.param: If not Guid.Empty, then the setting for this viewport will be deleted. If Guid.Empty, the all per viewport visibility settings will be removed.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.Layer.GetPersistentVisibility
member.summary: The persistent visbility setting is used for layers whose visibilty can be changed by a "parent" object. A common case is when a layer is a child layer (ParentId is not nil). In this case, when a parent layer is turned off, then child layers are also turned off. The persistent visibility setting determines what happens when the parent is turned on again.
member.remarks:
Returns true if this layer's visibility is controlled by a parent object and the parent is turned on (after being off), then this layer will also be turned on. Returns false if this layer's visibility is controlled by a parent object and the parent layer is turned on (after being off), then this layer will continue to be off.
When the persistent visbility is not explicitly set, this property returns the current value of IsVisible

member.summary: The persistent locking setting is used for layers that can be locked by a "parent" object. A common case is when a layer is a child layer (Layer.ParentI is not nil). In this case, when a parent layer is locked, then child layers are also locked. The persistent locking setting determines what happens when the parent is unlocked again.

member.summary:
If you are developing a high quality plug-in renderer, and a user is assigning a custom render material to this object, then add rendering material information to the MaterialRefs dictionary.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.Mode
member.summary: An object must be in one of three modes: normal, locked or hidden. If an object is in normal mode, then the object's layer controls visibility and selectability. If an object is locked, then the object's layer controls visibility by the object cannot be selected. If the object is hidden, it is not visible and it cannot be selected.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.LinetypeSource
member.summary: The Linetype used to display an object is specified in one of two ways. If LinetypeSource is ON::linetype_from_layer, then the object's layer ON_Layer::Linetype() is used. If LinetypeSource is ON::linetype_from_object, then value of m_linetype is used.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.ColorSource
member.summary: The color used to display an object is specified in one of three ways. If ColorSource is ON::color_from_layer, then the object's layer ON_Layer::Color() is used. If ColorSource is ON::color_from_object, then value of m_color is used. If ColorSource is ON::color_from_material, then the diffuse color of the object's render material is used. See ON_3dmObjectAttributes::MaterialSource() to determine where to get the definition of the object's render material.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.PlotColorSource
member.summary: The color used to plot an object on paper is specified in one of three ways. If PlotColorSource is ON::plot_color_from_layer, then the object's layer ON_Layer::PlotColor() is used. If PlotColorSource is ON::plot_color_from_object, then value of PlotColor() is used.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.ObjectId
member.summary:
Every object has a Guid (globally unique identifier, also known as UUID, or universally unique identifier). The default value is Guid.Empty.
When an object is added to a model, the value is checked. If the value is Guid.Empty, a new Guid is created. If the value is not null but it is already used by another object in the model, a new Guid is created. If the value is not Guid.Empty and it is not used by another object in the model, then that value persists. When an object is updated, by a move for example, the value of ObjectId persists.
This value is the same as the one returned by object.Id.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.Name
member.summary:
Gets or sets an object optional text name.
More than one object in a model can have the same name and some objects may have no name.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.Url
member.summary: Objects may have an URL. There are no restrictions on what value this URL may have. As an example, if the object came from a commercial part library, the URL might point to the definition of that part.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.LayerIndex
member.summary:
Gets or sets an associated layer index.
Layer definitions in an OpenNURBS model are stored in a layer table. The layer table is conceptually an array of ON_Layer classes. Every OpenNURBS object in a model is on some layer. The object's layer is specified by zero based indicies into the ON_Layer array.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.LinetypeIndex
member.summary:
Gets or sets the linetype index.
Linetype definitions in an OpenNURBS model are stored in a linetype table. The linetype table is conceptually an array of ON_Linetype classes. Every OpenNURBS object in a model references some linetype. The object's linetype is specified by zero based indicies into the ON_Linetype array.
Index 0 is reserved for continuous linetype (no pattern).

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.MaterialIndex
member.summary:
Gets or sets the material index.
If you want something simple and fast, set the index of the rendering material.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.MaterialSource
member.summary: Determines if the simple material should come from the object or from it's layer. High quality rendering plug-ins should use m_rendering_attributes.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.Decals
member.summary: Gets all object decals associated with this object.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.MaterialRefs
member.summary:
If you are developing a high quality plug-in renderer, and a user is assigning a custom render material to this object, then add rendering material information to the MaterialRefs dictionary.
Note to developers: As soon as the MaterialRefs dictionary contains items rendering material queries slow down. Do not populate the MaterialRefs dictionary when setting the MaterialIndex will take care of your needs.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.ObjectColor
member.summary: If ON::color_from_object == ColorSource, then color is the object's display color.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.PlotColor
member.summary: If plot_color_from_object == PlotColorSource, then PlotColor is the object's plotting color.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.HasMapping
member.summary: A mapping from any plugin source is associated with these attributes Need to do this here to respond correctly to ModifyObjectAttributes event

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.DisplayOrder
member.summary:
Display order used to force objects to be drawn on top or behind each other. Larger numbers draw on top of smaller numbers.
0 = draw object in standard depth buffered order
<0 = draw object behind "normal" draw order objects
>0 = draw object on top of "normal" draw order objects

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.PlotWeight
member.summary: Plot weight in millimeters. =0.0 means use the default width <0.0 means don't plot (visible for screen display, but does not show on plot)

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.ObjectDecoration
member.summary: Used to indicate an object has a decoration (like an arrowhead on a curve)

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.WireDensity
member.summary: When a surface object is displayed in wireframe, this controls how many isoparametric wires are used. value number of isoparametric wires -1 boundary wires (off) 0 boundary and knot wires 1 boundary and knot wires and, if there are no interior knots, a single interior wire. N>=2 boundary and knot wires and (N+1) interior wires.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.ViewportId
member.summary: If ViewportId is nil, the object is active in all viewports. If ViewportId is not nil, then this object is only active in a specific view. This field is primarily used to assign page space objects to a specific page, but it can also be used to restrict model space to a specific view.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes.Space
member.summary: Starting with V4, objects can be in either model space or page space. If an object is in page space, then ViewportId is not nil and identifies the page it is on.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject.IsNormal
member.summary: An object must be in one of three modes: normal, locked or hidden. If an object is in normal mode, then the object's layer controls visibility and selectability. If an object is locked, then the object's layer controls visibility by the object cannot be selected. If the object is hidden, it is not visible and it cannot be selected.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject.IsLocked
member.summary: An object must be in one of three modes: normal, locked or hidden. If an object is in normal mode, then the object's layer controls visibility and selectability. If an object is locked, then the object's layer controls visibility by the object cannot be selected. If the object is hidden, it is not visible and it cannot be selected.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject.IsHidden
member.summary: An object must be in one of three modes: normal, locked or hidden. If an object is in normal mode, then the object's layer controls visibility and selectability. If an object is locked, then the object's layer controls visibility by the object cannot be selected. If the object is hidden, it is not visible and it cannot be selected.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject.IsReference
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if an object is a reference object. An object from a work session reference model is a reference object and cannot be modified. An object is a reference object if, and only if, it is on a reference layer.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject.WorksessionReferenceSerialNumber
member.summary: Obsolete - use ReferenceModelSerialNumber

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject.ReferenceModelSerialNumber
member.summary: When a component is in a model for reference, this value identifies the reference model.
member.remarks: Reference components are not saved in .3dm archives. Typically this value is set and locked by the code that adds a component to a model. This value is not saved in .3dm archives.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject.InstanceDefinitionModelSerialNumber
member.summary: When a component is in a model as part of the information required for a linked instance definition, this value identifies the the linked instance definition reference model.
member.remarks: Reference components are not saved in .3dm archives. Typically this value is set and locked by the code that adds a component to a model. This value is not saved in .3dm archives.

member.returns: true if changes were made.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject.MemoryEstimate
member.summary: Computes an estimate of the number of bytes that this object is using in memory. Note that this is a runtime memory estimate and does not directly compare to the amount of space take up by the object when saved to a file.
member.returns: The estimated number of bytes this object occupies in memory.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject.Id
member.summary:
Every object has a Guid (globally unique identifier, also known as UUID, or universally unique identifier). The default value is Guid.Empty.
When an object is added to a model, the value is checked. If the value is Guid.Empty, a new Guid is created. If the value is not null but it is already used by another object in the model, a new Guid is created. If the value is not Guid.Empty and it is not used by another object in the model, then that value persists. When an object is updated, by a move for example, the value of ObjectId persists.
This value is the same as the one returned by this.Attributes.ObjectId.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject.Name
member.summary: Rhino objects have optional text names. More than one object in a model can have the same name and some objects may have no name.

member.returns: An array of group indices, or null if is 0.

member.summary: Check selection state.
member.param: (false is good default) If true and the entire object is not selected, and some subset of the object is selected, like some edges of a surface, then 3 is returned. If false and the entire object is not selected, then zero is returned.
member.returns: 0 = object is not selected. 1 = object is selected. 2 = entire object is selected persistently. 3 = one or more proper sub-objects are selected.

member.summary: Check sub-object selection state.

member.returns: true if the subobject is selected.
member.remarks: A subobject cannot be persistently selected.

member.returns: An array of subobject indices, or null if there are none.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject.IsSelectable(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Reports if an object can be selected.
member.param: If true, then selected objects are selectable. If false, then selected objects are not selectable.
If true, then objects with grips on can be selected. If false, then the value returned by the object's IsSelectableWithGripsOn() function decides if the object can be selected.
If true, then objects on locked layers are selectable. If false, then objects on locked layers are not selectable.
If true, then objects on hidden layers are selectable. If false, then objects on hidden layers are not selectable.
member.returns: true if object is capable of being selected.
member.remarks: Objects that are locked, hidden, or on locked or hidden layers cannot be selected. If IsSelectableWithGripsOn() returns false, then an that object is not selectable if it has grips turned on.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject.IsSelectable
member.summary: Reports if an object can be selected.
member.returns: true if object is capable of being selected.
member.remarks: Objects that are locked, hidden, or on locked or hidden layers cannot be selected. If IsSelectableWithGripsOn() returns false, then an that object is not selectable if it has grips turned on.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject.IsSubObjectSelectable(Rhino.Geometry.ComponentIndex,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Reports if a subobject can be selected.
member.param: index of subobject to check.
If true, then selected objects are selectable. If false, then selected objects are not selectable.
member.returns: true if the specified subobject can be selected.
member.remarks: Objects that are locked, hidden, or on locked or hidden layers cannot be selected. If IsSelectableWithGripsOn() returns false, then that object is not selectable if it has grips turned on.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject.Select(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Selects an object.
member.param: The new selection state; true activates selection.

If true, then the object is highlighted if it is selected and unhighlighted if is is not selected.
Highlighting can be and stay out of sync, as its specification is independent.
Objects that are persistently selected stay selected when a command terminates.

If true, then objects with grips on can be selected. If false, then the value returned by the object's IsSelectableWithGripsOn() function decides if the object can be selected when it has grips turned on.
If true, then objects on locked layers can be selected. If false, then objects on locked layers cannot be selected.
If true, then objects on hidden layers can be selectable. If false, then objects on hidden layers cannot be selected.
member.remarks: Objects that are locked, hidden, or on locked or hidden layers cannot be selected. If IsSelectableWithGripsOn() returns false, then an that object is not selectable if it has grips turned on.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject.Select(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Selects an object.
member.param: The new selection state; true activates selection.
member.remarks: Objects that are locked, hidden, or on locked or hidden layers cannot be selected. If IsSelectableWithGripsOn() returns false, then an that object is not selectable if it has grips turned on.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject.Select(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Selects an object.
member.param: The new selection state; true activates selection.

If true, then the object is hightlighted if it is selected and not hightlighted if is is not selected.
Highlighting can be and stay out of sync, as its specification is independent.
member.remarks: Objects that are locked, hidden, or on locked or hidden layers cannot be selected. If IsSelectableWithGripsOn() returns false, then an that object is not selectable if it has grips turned on.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject.GetRenderMaterial(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the RenderMaterial that this object uses based on it's attributes and the document that the object is associated with. If there is no RenderMaterial associated with this object then null is returned. If null is returned you should call GetMaterial to get the material used to render this object.
member.param: If true, gets the material used to render the object's front side otherwise; gets the material used to render the back side of the object.
member.returns: If there is a RenderMaterial associated with this objects' associated Material then it is returned otherwise; null is returned.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject.GetRenderMaterial(Rhino.Geometry.ComponentIndex,System.Guid,Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectAttributes)
member.summary: Gets the RenderMaterial associated with this object if there is one. If there is no RenderMaterial associated with this object then null is returned. If null is returned you should call GetMaterial to get the material used to render this object.
member.param: Returns the RenderMaterial associated with the specified sub object or the objects top level material if it is set to
The plug-in specific material to look for.
Optional object attributes used to determine the material source, if null the objects attributes are used.
member.returns: Returns the associated with the sub object identified by componentIndex if the component index is set to then the top level RenderMaterail is returned. If this method returns null it means there is no RenderMaterial associated with the object or sub object so you should may GetMaterial get the objects generic material.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjRef.RuntimeSerialNumber
member.summary: If > 0, then this is the value of a Rhino object's serial number field. The serial number is used instead of the pointer to prevent crashes in cases when the RhinoObject is deleted but an ObjRef continues to reference the Rhino object. The value of RuntimeSerialNumber is not saved in archives because it generally changes if you save and reload an archive.

member.name: P:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjRef.GeometryComponentIndex
member.summary: Gets the component index of the referenced (sub) geometry. Some objects have subobjects that are valid pieces of geometry. For example, breps have edges and faces that are valid curves and surfaces. Each subobject has a component index that is > 0. The parent geometry has a component index = -1.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjRef.Finalize
member.summary: Passively reclaims unmanaged resources when the class user did not explicitly call Dispose().

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjRef.Dispose
member.summary: Actively reclaims unmanaged resources that this instance uses.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjRef.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
For derived class implementers.
This method is called with argument true when class user calls Dispose(), while with argument false when the Garbage Collector invokes the finalizer, or Finalize() method.
You must reclaim all used unmanaged resources in both cases, and can use this chance to call Dispose on disposable fields if the argument is true.
Also, you must call the base virtual method within your overriding method.
member.param: true if the call comes from the Dispose() method; false if it comes from the Garbage Collector finalizer.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjRef.Object
member.summary: Returns the referenced Rhino object.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjRef.InstanceDefinitionPart
member.summary: If subobject selection is enabled and a piece of an instance reference is selected, this will return the selected piece.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjRef.SelectionMethod
member.summary: Gets the method used to select this object.
member.returns: The method used to select this object.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjRef.SelectionPoint
member.summary: If the object was selected by picking a point on it, then SelectionPoint() returns the point where the selection occured, otherwise it returns Point3d.Unset.
member.returns: The point where the selection occured or Point3d.Unset on failure.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjRef.SelectionViewDetailSerialNumber
member.summary: If the object was interactively selected in a page space detail view, then SelectionViewDetailSerialNumber() returns the CRhinoObject serial number of the detail view object. Use SelectionView() to get the page view that contains the detail view object. If SelectionViewDetailSerialNumber() returns 0, then the selection did not happen in a detail view.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjRef.SelectionView
member.summary: If the object was interactively selected in a particular viewport, then SelectionView() returns the view where the object was selected.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjRef.CurveParameter(System.Double@)
member.summary: If the reference geometry is a curve or edge with a selection point, then this gets the parameter of the selection point.
member.param: The parameter of the selection point.
member.returns: If the selection point was on a curve or edge, then the curve/edge is returned, otherwise null.
member.remarks: If a curve was selected and CurveParameter is called and the SelectionMethod() is not 1 (point pick on object), the curve will be returned and parameter will be set to the start parameter of the picked curve. This can be misleading so it may be necessary to call SelectionMethod() first, before calling CurveParameter to get the desired information.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjRef.SurfaceParameter(System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: If the reference geometry is a surface, brep with one face, or surface edge with a selection point, then this gets the surface paramters of the selection point.
member.param: The U value is assigned to this out parameter during the call.
The V value is assigned to this out parameter during the call.
member.returns: If the selection point was on a surface, then the surface is returned.

member.name: M:Rhino.DocObjects.ObjRef.SetSelectionComponent(Rhino.Geometry.ComponentIndex)
member.summary: When an object is selected by picking a sub-object, SetSelectionComponent may be used to identify the sub-object.

member.name: P:Rhino.FileIO.FileObjWriteOptions.ActualFilePathOnMac
member.remarks: The path passed to FileExportPlugIn::WriteFile on the Mac is a temporary path. The calling function takes care of moving the temp (.obj) file to it's appropriate location. We can't use that to write that path to construct the .mat file because the calling function doesn't know anything about it. ActualFilePathOnMac is the path of the obj file's ultimate destination. It's only meaningful on the Mac platform.

member.summary: Setting to transform Rhino's Z axis to OBJ's Y axis

member.name: P:Rhino.FileIO.FileObjWriteOptions.SignificantDigits
member.summary: Number of significant digits to write out for floating point numbers

member.name: P:Rhino.FileIO.FileObjWriteOptions.WrapLongLines
member.summary: Setting to enable/disable line wrapping with "\"s

member.name: P:Rhino.FileIO.FileObjWriteOptions.MergeNestedGroupingNames
member.summary: Setting to merge nested layer or group names into a single OBJ group name
member.remarks:
Setting this to true will take a layer setup like this in Rhino
Grandparent Parent Child
and make a group name of Grandparent__Parent__Child in obj.
If false it will be 3 separate group names in obj and will look like this in the file.
g Grandparent Parent Child

member.name: P:Rhino.FileIO.FileObjWriteOptions.SortObjGroups
member.summary: Setting to enable/disable sorting of OBJ groups
member.remarks: This is mainly for the sake of making an obj file more human readable, however, it is important that it happens when a user has opted to write Rhino groups as OBJ "g"s since it is not necessary for every object in Rhino to be part of a group.

member.name: T:Rhino.FileIO.FileObjWriteOptions.VertexWelding
member.summary: Determines how/if vertexes of the mesh in Rhino will be modified in the output
member.remarks: The actual values of any vertex, normal or texture coordinate are not modified, this setting determines whether they are duplicated or merged.

member.name: F:Rhino.FileIO.FileObjWriteOptions.VertexWelding.Normal
member.summary: Mesh is exported in existing state

member.name: F:Rhino.FileIO.FileObjWriteOptions.VertexWelding.Welded
member.summary: Mesh topology vertex indexing is used for the v in the OBJ output file normals and texture coordinates, if they exist, come from the mesh

member.name: F:Rhino.FileIO.FileObjWriteOptions.VertexWelding.Unwelded
member.summary: Each face gets it's own vertex, and normal and tc if they exist, in the output

member.name: P:Rhino.FileIO.FileObjWriteOptions.CreateNgons
member.summary: Setting to enable/diable the creation of ngons for the output

member.name: P:Rhino.FileIO.FileObjWriteOptions.IncludeUnweldedEdgesInNgons
member.summary: Setting to determine whether unwelded edges are ignored in the creation of an ngon.
member.remarks:
Imagine a plane that has been split and then rejoined. This setting determines if you will get one or twon ngons in the output.
TODO This is not hooked up yet, Dale hasn't made this available yet. See RH-30673.

member.name: P:Rhino.FileIO.FileObjWriteOptions.CullUnnecessaryVertexesInNgons
member.summary: Setting to determine whether interior colinear vertexes are part of the ngon.
member.remarks:
Imagine a plane that has been split and then rejoined. If IncludeUnweldedEdgesInNgons is setr to true then you would get an ngon with 6 vertexes, the corners and one on each edge that was split. Setting this to true would remove those 2 vertexes from the interior of the edge.
TODO This is not hooked up yet, Dale hasn't made this available yet. See RH-30673.

member.name: P:Rhino.FileIO.FileObjWriteOptions.UseRelativeIndexing
member.summary:
Determines whether to use relative indexing.
TRUE = use relative (negative) indexing FALSE = use absolute (positive) indexing
member.remarks: This only has an impact on non-mesh output. There is also no interface in the OBJ export plugin so code executed when set to true has not been thoroughly tested. It has been there forever and migrated with each successive revision of OBJ export code.

member.name: T:Rhino.FileIO.File3dm
member.summary:
Represents a 3dm file, which is stored using the OpenNURBS file standard.
The 3dm format is the main Rhinoceros storage format.
Visit http://www.opennurbs.com/ for more details.

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.File3dm.Read(System.String)
member.summary: Reads a 3dm file from a specified location.
member.param: The file to read.
member.returns: new File3dm on success, null on error.
member.exception: If path does not exist.

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.File3dm.Read(System.String,Rhino.FileIO.File3dm.TableTypeFilter,Rhino.FileIO.File3dm.ObjectTypeFilter)
member.summary: Reads a 3dm file from a specified location.
member.param: The file to read.
If tableTypeFilterFilter is None, then everything in the archive is read. Otherwise tableTypeFilterFilter identifies what tables should be read.
If objectTypeFilter is not None, then is a filter made by bitwise oring values to select which types of objects will be read from the model object table.
member.returns: new File3dm on success, null on error.
member.exception: If path does not exist.

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.File3dm.ReadWithLog(System.String,Rhino.FileIO.File3dm.TableTypeFilter,Rhino.FileIO.File3dm.ObjectTypeFilter,System.String@)
member.summary: Reads a 3dm file from a specified location.
member.param: The file to read.
If tableTypeFilterFilter is None, then everything in the archive is read. Otherwise tableTypeFilterFilter identifies what tables should be read.
If objectTypeFilter is not None, then is a filter made by bitwise oring values to select which types of objects will be read from the model object table.
Any archive reading errors are logged here.
member.returns: new File3dm on success, null on error.
member.exception: If path does not exist.

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.File3dm.ReadWithLog(System.String,System.String@)
member.summary: Read a 3dm file from a specified location and log any archive reading errors.
member.param: The file to read.
Any archive reading errors are logged here.
member.returns: New File3dm on success, null on error.
member.exception: If path does not exist.

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.File3dm.Write(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes contents of this model to an openNURBS archive. If the model is not valid, then Write will refuse to write it.
member.param: The file name to use for writing.

Version of the openNURBS archive to write. Must be [2; current version]. Rhino can read its current version, plus earlier file versions except 1. Use latest version when possible.
Alternatively, 0 is a placeholder for the last valid version.
member.returns: true if archive is written with no error. false if errors occur.

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.File3dm.Write(System.String,Rhino.FileIO.File3dmWriteOptions)
member.summary: Writes contents of this model to an openNURBS archive. If the model is not valid, then Write will refuse to write it.
member.param: The file name to use for writing.
An options instance, or null for default.
member.returns: true if archive is written with no error. false if errors occur.

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.File3dm.WriteWithLog(System.String,System.Int32,System.String@)
member.summary: Writes contents of this model to an openNURBS archive. If the model is not valid, then Write will refuse to write it.
member.param: The file name to use for writing.

Version of the openNURBS archive to write. Must be [2; current version]. Rhino can read its current version, plus earlier file versions except 1. Use latest version when possible.
Alternatively, 0 is a placeholder for the last valid version.
This argument will be filled by out reference.
member.returns: true if archive is written with no error. false if errors occur.

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.File3dm.WriteWithLog(System.String,Rhino.FileIO.File3dmWriteOptions,System.String@)

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.File3dm.Finalize
member.summary: Passively reclaims unmanaged resources when the class user did not explicitly call Dispose().

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.File3dm.Dispose
member.summary: Actively reclaims unmanaged resources that this instance uses.

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.File3dm.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
For derived class implementers.
This method is called with argument true when class user calls Dispose(), while with argument false when the Garbage Collector invokes the finalizer, or Finalize() method.
You must reclaim all used unmanaged resources in both cases, and can use this chance to call Dispose on disposable fields if the argument is true.
Also, you must call the base virtual method within your overriding method.
member.param: true if the call comes from the Dispose() method; false if it comes from the Garbage Collector finalizer.

member.name: F:Rhino.FileIO.File3dmWriteOptions.RenderMeshFlags
member.summary: [Giulio, 2016 04 01] Please keep these in sync with ON_BinaryArchive::m_save_3dm_render_mesh_flags in opennurbs_archive.h

summary.para: File version. Default is major version number of this assembly version.
Must be in range [2; current version].
Alternatively, 0 is a placeholder for the last valid version.
Rhino can read its current version, plus earlier file versions except 1.

member.name: P:Rhino.FileIO.File3dmWriteOptions.SaveRenderMeshes
member.summary: Include Render meshes in the file. Default is true

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.File3dmWriteOptions.EnableRenderMeshes(Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectType,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Activates saving of render meshes for specific types of objects. If you do not specify the state for an object type, its default is used. Specifically, currently SubD mesh saving is disabled by default, while Brep and Extrusion is on.
member.param:
The object type. Mostly brep, extrusion and SubD (or their flag combinations) make sense here.
DO NOT specify a 'filter' or subobject type.
If false, disables saving for this object type.

member.name: P:Rhino.FileIO.File3dmWriteOptions.SaveAnalysisMeshes
member.summary: Include analysis meshes in the file. Default is true

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.File3dmWriteOptions.EnableAnalysisMeshes(Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectType,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Activates saving of analysis meshes for specific types of objects. If you do not specify the state for an object type, its default is used. Currently SubD mesh saving is disabled by default, while Brep and Extrusion is enabled.
member.param:
The object type. Mostly mesh, brep, extrusion and SubD (or their flag combinations) make sense here.
DO NOT specify a 'filter' or subobject type.
If false, disables saving for this object type.

member.summary: Include custom user data in the file. Default is true

member.summary: Returns the actual component type of a table.

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.CommonComponentTable`1.FindId(System.Guid)
member.summary: Uses the guid to find a model component. Deleted objects cannot be found by id. The guid is the value that is stored in the .Id property. In a single document, no two active objects have the same guid. If an object is replaced with a new object, then the guid persists. For example, if the _Move command moves an object, then the moved object inherits its guid from the starting object. If the Copy command copies an object, then the copy gets a new guid. This guid persists through file saving/openning operations. This function will not find grip objects.
member.param: ID of model component to search for.
member.returns: Reference to the rhino object with the objectId or null if no such object could be found.

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.CommonComponentTable`1.__FindIndexInternal(System.Int32)
member.summary: This is internal so that we can choose when to deliver the functionality for each table. Object, history and instance tables have no indices.

member.param: NameHash of model component to search for.
member.returns: Reference to the rhino object or null if no such object could be found.

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.ManifestTable.FindId(System.Guid)
member.summary: Uses the guid to find a model component. Deleted objects cannot be found by id. The guid is the value that is stored in the .Id property. In a single document, no two active objects have the same guid. If an object is replaced with a new object, then the guid persists. For example, if the _Move command moves an object, then the moved object inherits its guid from the starting object. If the Copy command copies an object, then the copy gets a new guid. This guid persists through file saving/openning operations. This function will not find grip objects.
member.param: ID of model component to search for.
member.returns: Reference to the rhino object with the objectId or null if no such object could be found.

For example, if the _Move command moves an object, then the moved object inherits its guid from the starting object. If the Copy command copies an object, then the copy gets a new guid. This guid persists through file saving/openning operations. This function will not find grip objects.

member.summary:
Provides the OpenNURBS implementation of SHA1.
This class is provided only with the purpose of hashing. It is not meant to be used for any cryptographic purpose.

member.summary: Constructs a new instance of the SHA1 algorithm.

member.summary: Advances the hash by an input array.

The start of the data to consider in the array.
The used data length on the array.

member.summary: Returns the currently computed hash.
member.returns: The final hash.

member.summary: Reclaims unmanaged resources used by this instance, and invalidates the instance. After calling this method, all other methods will always call ObjectDisposedException.
member.param: true if the class user called Dispose.

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.SHA1OpenNURBS.Finalize
member.summary: Instructs the runtime to reclaim unmanaged resources if the developer forgot to call Dispose().

member.summary: Computes the SHA1 hash of a string, converted to UTF8.
member.returns: A 20-byte long SHA1 hash.
member.exception: When input is null.

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.SHA1OpenNURBS.FileSystemPathHash(System.String,System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary:
Computes the SHA1 hash of a file system path, converted to UTF8.
These file system paths have identical values of FileSystemPathHash():
/x/y/z/name.ext
\x\y\z\name.ext
/x//y//z/name.ext
/x/y/a/b/c/../../../z/name.ext
/X/Y/Z/NAME.EXT (When ignoreCase is true)
member.param: A non-null path string.
If case should be ignored. If this is null or unspecified, the operating system default is used.
member.returns: A 20-byte long SHA1 hash.
member.exception: When input is null.

member.summary: Actively reclaims unmanaged resources that this instance uses.

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.TextLog.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
For derived class implementers.
This method is called with argument true when class user calls Dispose(), while with argument false when the Garbage Collector invokes the finalizer, or Finalize() method.
You must reclaim all used unmanaged resources in both cases, and can use this chance to call Dispose on disposable fields if the argument is true.
Also, you must call the base virtual method within your overriding method.
member.param: true if the call comes from the Dispose() method; false if it comes from the Garbage Collector finalizer.

member.name: T:Rhino.FileIO.File3dmTypeCodes
member.summary:
Typecode format 4 bytes long
x xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx,x xxx xxxx xxxx x x xx | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | +--- "stuff" bit | | | | | | | +-- specific codes | | | | | +-- RESERVED - DO NOT USE (should be 0) (will be used to control CRC on/off) | | | +-- category:_000 0000 0000 0001 Legacy geometry TCODE_LEGACY_GEOMETRY | _000 0000 0000 0010 openNURBS object TCODE_OPENNURBS_OBJECT | _000 0000 0000 0100 -- RESERVED - DO NOT USE (should be 0 in any typecode) -- | _000 0000 0000 1000 -- RESERVED - DO NOT USE (should be 0 in any typecode) -- | _000 0000 0001 0000 Geometry TCODE_GEOMETRY | _000 0000 0010 0000 Annotation | _000 0000 0100 0000 Display Attributes TCODE_DISPLAY | _000 0000 1000 0000 Rendering TCODE_RENDER | _000 0001 0000 0000 | _000 0010 0000 0000 Interface TCODE_INTERFACE | _000 0100 0000 0000 -- RESERVED - DO NOT USE (should be 0 in any typecode) -- | _000 1000 0000 0000 Tolerances TCODE_TOLERANCE | _001 0000 0000 0000 Tables TCODE_TABLE | _010 0000 0000 0000 Table record TCODE_TABLEREC | _100 0000 0000 0000 User information TCODE_USER | +-- format: 0 - data size in header - data block follows TCODE_SHORT 1 - data in header - no data block follows

member.name: F:Rhino.FileIO.File3dmTypeCodes.TCODE_COMMENTBLOCK
member.summary: (0x00000001) The TCODE_COMMENTBLOCK is the first chunk in the file, starts 32 bytes into the file, and contains text information terminated with a ^m_z. This ^m_z and contents of this chunk were expanded in February 2000. Files written with code released earlier than this will not have the ^m_z.

member.name: F:Rhino.FileIO.File3dmTypeCodes.TCODE_ENDOFFILE
member.summary: (0x00007FFF) The TCODE_ENDOFFILE is the last chunk in the file and the first 4 bytes of information in this chunk is an integer that contains the file length. This chunk was added in February 2000 and files written with code released earlier than this will not have this termination block.

member.name: F:Rhino.FileIO.File3dmTypeCodes.TCODE_ENDOFFILE_GOO
member.summary: (0x00007FFE) this typecode is returned when a rogue eof marker is found Some v1 3dm file writers put these markers in a "goo". Simply skip these chunks and continue.

member.name: F:Rhino.FileIO.File3dmTypeCodes.TCODE_ANONYMOUS_CHUNK
member.summary: (TCODE_USER | TCODE_CRC | 0x0000)

member.name: P:Rhino.FileIO.FileReadOptions.ImportMode
member.summary:
true means we are merging whatever is being read into an existing document. This means you need to consider things like:
If the information being read is in a different unit system, it should be scaled if UseScaleGeometry is true.
There can be existing layers, fonts, materials, dimension styles, hatch patterns, and so on with the same name as items being read from the file.

member.name: P:Rhino.FileIO.FileReadOptions.OpenMode
member.summary:
true means we are reading the information into an empty document. This means you need to consider things like:
Setting the unit system (if the file has a unit system)
Creating a default layer if one is not there.
Setting up appropriate views when you're finished reading.

member.name: P:Rhino.FileIO.FileReadOptions.NewMode
member.summary: true means we are reading template information in something like a OnFileNew event.

member.name: P:Rhino.FileIO.FileReadOptions.InsertMode
member.summary: true means we are reading information that will be used to create an instance definition or some other type of "inserting" that is supported by Rhino's "Insert" command.

member.name: P:Rhino.FileIO.FileReadOptions.ImportReferenceMode
member.summary: true means we are reading information for a work session reference model or a linked instance definition.

member.name: P:Rhino.FileIO.FileReadOptions.BatchMode
member.summary: true means you cannot ask questions during reading. (no dialogs, no "getters", etc.)

member.name: P:Rhino.FileIO.FileReadOptions.UseScaleGeometry
member.summary: If this parameter is true, then no questions are asked when unit conversion scaling is optional and the setting specified by ScaleGeometry is used.

summary.para: true: If ImportMode is true and the geometry in the file being read has a unit system different from the model's unit system, then apply the unit conversion scale to the file's geometry before adding it to the model.

false: Do not scale. Once case where this happens is when an instance definition is read from a file and the model space instance references have been scaled. In case the instance definition geometry cannot be scaled or the net result is that the size of the instance reference object is scaled by the square of the scale factor.

member.summary: If a 3dm archive is being read or written, then this is the version of the 3dm archive format (1, 2, 3, 4 or 5). 0 a 3dm archive is not being read/written 1 a version 1 3dm archive is being read/written 2 a version 2 3dm archive is being read/written 3 a version 3 3dm archive is being read/written 4 a version 4 3dm archive is being read/written 5 an old version 5 3dm archive is being read 50 a version 5 3dm archive is being read/written.

member.summary: Expert user function to control CRC calculation while reading and writing. Typically this is used when seeking around and reading/writing information in non-serial order.

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.BinaryArchiveWriter.Write3dmChunkVersion(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: A chunk version is a single byte that encodes a major.minor version number. Useful when creating I/O code for 3dm chunks that may change in the future. Increment the minor version number if new information is added to the end of the chunk. Increment the major version if the format of the chunk changes in some other way.
member.returns: true on successful read.

member.name: T:Rhino.FileIO.BinaryArchiveReader
member.summary: Represents an entity that is capable of reading a binary archive and instantiating strongly-typed objects.

member.name: P:Rhino.FileIO.BinaryArchiveReader.ReadErrorOccured
member.summary: Gets or sets whether en error occurred during reading.

member.name: P:Rhino.FileIO.BinaryArchiveReader.Archive3dmVersion
member.summary: If a 3dm archive is being read or written, then this is the version of the 3dm archive format (1, 2, 3, 4 or 5). 0 a 3dm archive is not being read/written 1 a version 1 3dm archive is being read/written 2 a version 2 3dm archive is being read/written 3 a version 3 3dm archive is being read/written 4 a version 4 3dm archive is being read/written 5 an old version 5 3dm archive is being read 50 a version 5 3dm archive is being read/written.

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.BinaryArchiveReader.EnableCRCCalculation(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Expert user function to control CRC calculation while reading and writing. Typically this is used when seeking around and reading/writing information in non-serial order.
member.returns: Current state of CRC calculation. Use the returned value to restore the CRC calculation setting after you are finished doing your fancy pants expert IO.

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.BinaryArchiveReader.BeginRead3dmChunk(System.UInt32,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Begins reading a chunk that must be in the archive at this location.
member.returns: True if beginning of the chunk was read. In this case you must call EndRead3dmChunk(), even if something goes wrong while you attempt to read the interior of the chunk. False if the chunk did not exist at the current location in the file.

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.BinaryArchiveReader.BeginRead3dmChunk(System.UInt32@,System.Int64@)
member.summary: Begins reading a chunk that must be in the archive at this location.

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.BinaryArchiveReader.EndRead3dmChunk(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Calling this will skip rest of stuff in chunk if it was only partially read.
member.param: Generally, a call to ON_WARNING is made when a chunk is partially read. If suppressPartiallyReadChunkWarning is true, then no warning is issued for partially read chunks.

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.BinaryArchiveReader.Read3dmChunkVersion(System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: A chunk version is a single byte that encodes a major.minor version number. Useful when creating I/O code for 3dm chunks that may change in the future. Increment the minor version number if new information is added to the end of the chunk. Increment the major version if the format of the chunk changes in some other way.
member.returns: true on successful read.

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.BinaryArchiveReader.Read3dmStartSection(System.Int32@,System.String@)
member.param: .3dm file version (2, 3, 4, 5 or 50)

String with application name, et cetera. This information is primarily used when debugging files that contain problems. McNeel and Associates stores application name, application version, compile date, and the OS in use when file was written.
member.returns: true on success

member.name: M:Rhino.FileIO.BinaryArchiveReader.Dump3dmChunk(Rhino.FileIO.TextLog)
member.summary: Fnction for studying contents of a file. The primary use is as an aid to help dig through files that have been damaged (bad disks, transmission errors, etc.) If an error is found, a line that begins with the word "ERROR" is printed.
member.param: log where information is printed to
member.returns: 0 if something went wrong, otherwise the typecode of the chunk that was just studied.

member.returns: 0: serious IO error 1: success read information and then call EndReadDictionaryEntry() 2: at end of dictionary.

member.name: T:Rhino.LengthValue
member.summary: Represents a length with an associated unit system and a string representation of that length. This allows for going back and forth from numerical representation of a length and a string representation without "guessing" at the initial string

member.name: T:Rhino.LengthValue.StringFormat
member.summary: Formatting to apply when creating a length value from a double.

member.name: F:Rhino.LengthValue.StringFormat.ExactDecimal
member.summary: Use exact decimal string.

member.name: F:Rhino.LengthValue.StringFormat.ExactProperFraction
member.summary: If possible, use exact integer-fraction format (1.125 becomes 1-1/8).

member.name: F:Rhino.LengthValue.StringFormat.ExactImproperFraction
member.summary: If possible, use exact fraction format (1.125 becomes 9/8).

member.name: F:Rhino.LengthValue.StringFormat.CleanDecimal
member.summary: The value may be adjusted slightly to improve clarity (1.124999... becomes 1.125).

member.name: F:Rhino.LengthValue.StringFormat.CleanProperFraction
member.summary: The value may be adjusted slightly to improve clarity (1.124999... becomes 1-1/8).

member.name: F:Rhino.LengthValue.StringFormat.CleanImproperFraction
member.summary: The value may be adjusted slightly to improve clarity (1.124999... becomes 9/8).

member.name: M:Rhino.UI.Panels.RegisterPanel(Rhino.PlugIns.PlugIn,System.Type,System.String,System.Drawing.Icon)
member.summary: You typically register your panel class in your plug-in's OnLoad function. This will register your custom call with Rhino, Rhino will create an instance of your class the first time your panel is created and embed this instance of your class in a panel container.
member.param: Plug-in this panel is associated with

Class type to construct when a panel is shown. If your class is derived from Eto.Forms.Control it will work on both the Mac and Windows version of Rhino. In addition Windows Rhino will support any class types that implement the IWin32Window interface or that are derived from System.Windows.FrameworkElement. Mac Rhino will also support classes that are derived from NsView. In addition to the type requirements the class must have a public constructor with no parameters or a constructor with a single uint that represents the document serial number and and have a GuidAttribute applied with a unique Id. n Windows there is only one panel created which gets recycled for each new document. On the Mac a panel will be created for each open document and destroyed when the document closes. In certain situations in Mac Rhino a a panel may get created and destroyed multiple times when opening/closing a panel while editing a document.
Displays in the panel tab on Windows or at the top of the modeless window on Mac.
Currently only used in Windows, use a 32bit depth icon in order to get proper transparency.

member.name: M:Rhino.UI.Panels.IsPanelVisible(System.Guid,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Check to see if a panel is currently visible, if isSelectedTab is true then the tab must be the active tab as well.
member.param: Class Id for the panel to check.

This paramater is ignored on Mac.
If Windows and true the panel must be visible in a container and if it is a tabbed container it must be the active tab to be true.
member.returns: On Windows: The return value is demendant on the isSelectedTab value. If isSelectedTab is true then the panel must be included in a visible tabbed container and must also be the active tab to be true. If isSelectedTab is false then the panel only has to be included in a visible tabbed container to be true. On Mac: isSelected is ignored and true is returned if the panel appears in any inspector panel.

member.name: E:Rhino.UI.Panels.Show
member.summary: This event is called when a panel is shown or hidden. This event will get raised multipThis times when the active document changes in Mac Rhino. It will called with show equal to false for the prevous active document and with show equal to true for the current document. When the event is raised with show equal to false it only means the document instace of the panel is not visible it does not mean the panel host has been closed. If you need to know when the panel host closes then subsribe to the Closed event.

member.name: M:Rhino.UI.MouseCallback.OnMouseMove(Rhino.UI.MouseCallbackEventArgs)
member.summary: Called at the beginning of handling of a mouse move event in Rhino. If you don't want the default Rhino functionality to be run, then set Cancel to true on the passed in event args. Base class implementation of this function does nothing.

member.name: M:Rhino.UI.MouseCallback.OnEndMouseMove(Rhino.UI.MouseCallbackEventArgs)
member.summary: Called at the end of handling of a mouse move event in Rhino. All of the default Rhino mouse move functionality has already been executed unless a MouseCallback has set Cancel to true for the event args. You can tell if this is the case by inpecting the Cancel property in the event args parameter. Base class implementation of this function does nothing.

member.name: M:Rhino.UI.StatusBar.ShowProgressMeter(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Starts, or shows, Rhino's status bar progress meter.
member.param: The lower limit of the progress meter's range.
The upper limit of the progress meter's range.
The short description of the progress (e.g. "Calculating", "Meshing", etc)
If true, then the label will be embeded in the progress meter. If false, then the label will appear to the left of the progress meter.
If true, then the percent complete will appear in the progress meter.
member.returns: 1 - The progress meter was created successfully. 0 - The progress meter was not created. -1 - The progress meter was not created because some other process has already created it.

member.name: M:Rhino.UI.StatusBar.ShowProgressMeter(System.UInt32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Starts, or shows, Rhino's status bar progress meter.
member.param: The document runtime serial number.
The lower limit of the progress meter's range.
The upper limit of the progress meter's range.
The short description of the progress (e.g. "Calculating", "Meshing", etc)
If true, then the label will be embeded in the progress meter. If false, then the label will appear to the left of the progress meter.
If true, then the percent complete will appear in the progress meter.
member.returns: 1 - The progress meter was created successfully. 0 - The progress meter was not created. -1 - The progress meter was not created because some other process has already created it.

member.name: M:Rhino.UI.StatusBar.UpdateProgressMeter(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the current position of Rhino's status bar progress meter.
member.param:
The new value. This can be stated in absolute terms, or relative compared to the current position.
The interval bounds are specified when you first show the bar.
If true, then the progress meter is moved to position. If false, then the progress meter is moved position from the current position (relative).
member.returns: The previous position if successful.

member.name: M:Rhino.UI.StatusBar.UpdateProgressMeter(System.UInt32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)

The interval bounds are specified when you first show the bar.
If true, then the progress meter is moved to position. If false, then the progress meter is moved position from the current position (relative).
member.returns: The previous position if successful.

member.name: M:Rhino.UI.RhinoHelp.Show(System.String)
member.summary: Call this method to display standard Rhino help
member.param: Rhino help links are formatted like this: http://docs.mcneel.com/rhino/6/help/en-us/index.htm#commands/line.htm This parameter would be equal to "#commands/line.htm" in the link above. Rhino will calculate the string up to and including the index.html and append this value to the end.

member.name: P:Rhino.UI.RhinoHelp.ShowHelpCalled
member.summary: Total hack to work around the fact that options and object properties pages OnHelp virtual methods return void instead of bool. This will get set to the result of the last Show call above.
member.value: true if show help called; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Rhino.UI.LOC
member.summary: Used a placeholded which is used by LocalizationProcessor application to create contextId mapped localized strings.

member.name: M:Rhino.UI.LOC.STR(System.String)
member.summary: Strings that need to be localized should call this function. The STR function doesn't actually do anything but return the original string. The LocalizationProcessor application walks through the source code of a project and looks for LOC.STR. The function is then replaced with a call to Localization.LocalizeString using a unique context ID.
member.param: [in] The English string to localize.
