member.summary: radius of mouse pick box in pixels.

member.name: P:Rhino.ApplicationSettings.ModelAidSettings.PointDisplay
member.summary: Gets or sets the point display mode.

member.name: P:Rhino.ApplicationSettings.ModelAidSettings.AutoGumballEnabled
member.summary: When AutoGumball is on, a gumball automatically appears when objects are prepicked.

member.name: P:Rhino.ApplicationSettings.ModelAidSettings.SnappyGumballEnabled
member.summary: When SnappyGumball is on, a dragging a gumball moves the center point. When snappy gumball is off, dragging a gumball moves the mouse down point.

member.name: T:Rhino.ApplicationSettings.ViewSettingsState
member.summary: Represents a snapshot of .

member.name: P:Rhino.ApplicationSettings.ViewSettingsState.PanScreenFraction
member.summary: Gets or sets the faction used as multiplier to pan the screen.

member.name: P:Rhino.ApplicationSettings.ViewSettingsState.PanReverseKeyboardAction
member.summary:
Gets or sets if panning with the keyboard is reversed.
false, then Rhino pans the camera in the direction of the arrow key you press. true, then Rhino pans the scene instead.

member.name: P:Rhino.ApplicationSettings.ViewSettingsState.AlwaysPanParallelViews
member.summary:
Gets or sets the 'always pan parallel views' value.
If the view is not looking straight at the construction plane, then sets parallel viewports so they will not rotate.

member.name: P:Rhino.ApplicationSettings.ViewSettingsState.ZoomScale
member.summary: Gets or sets the step size for zooming with a wheeled mouse or the Page Up and Page Down keys.

member.name: P:Rhino.ApplicationSettings.ViewSettingsState.ZoomExtentsParallelViewBorder
member.summary: Border amount to apply to parallel viewport during zoom extents

member.name: P:Rhino.ApplicationSettings.ViewSettingsState.ZoomExtentsPerspectiveViewBorder
member.summary: Border amount to apply to perspective viewport during zoom extents

member.name: P:Rhino.ApplicationSettings.ViewSettingsState.RotateCircleIncrement
member.summary:
Gets or sets the rotation increment.
When the user rotates a view with the keyboard, Rhino rotates the view in steps. The usual step is 1/60th of a circle, which equals six degrees.

member.name: P:Rhino.ApplicationSettings.ViewSettingsState.RotateReverseKeyboard
member.summary:
Gets or sets the rotation direction.
If true, then Rhino rotates the camera around the scene, otherwise, rotates the scene itself.

member.name: P:Rhino.ApplicationSettings.ViewSettingsState.RotateToView
member.summary:
Gets or sets the rotation reference.
If true, then the views rotates relative to the view axes; false, than relative to the world x, y, and z axes.

member.name: P:Rhino.ApplicationSettings.ViewSettingsState.DefinedViewSetCPlane
member.summary:
Gets or sets the 'named views set CPlane' value.
When true, restoring a named view causes the construction plane saved with that view to also restore.

member.name: P:Rhino.ApplicationSettings.ViewSettingsState.DefinedViewSetProjection
member.summary:
Gets or sets the 'named views set projection' value.
When true, restoring a named view causes the viewport projection saved with the view to also restore.

member.name: P:Rhino.ApplicationSettings.ViewSettingsState.SingleClickMaximize
member.summary:
Gets or sets the 'single-click maximize' value.
When true, maximizing a viewport needs a single click on the viewport title rather than a double-click.

member.name: P:Rhino.ApplicationSettings.ViewSettingsState.LinkedViewports
member.summary:
Gets or sets the 'linked views' activated setting.
true enables real-time view synchronization. When a standard view is manipulated, the camera lens length of all parallel projection viewports are set to match the current viewport.

member.name: T:Rhino.Display.ColorHSL
member.summary: Represents an HSL (Hue, Saturation, Luminance) color with double precision floating point channels. HSL colors are used primarily in Graphical User Interface environments as they provide a very natural approach to picking colors.

member.name: F:Rhino.Display.ColorHSL.m_a
member.summary: Alpha values are inverted internally! 0 = opaque; 1 = transparent.

member.summary: Constructs a new instance of ColorHSL that is equivalent to an RGB color.
member.param: RGB color to mimic.
member.remarks: Exact conversions between color spaces are often not possible.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.ColorHSL.#ctor(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Constructs a new instance of ColorHSL with custom channel values.
member.param: Hue channel value. Hue channels rotate between 0.0 and 1.0.
Saturation channel value. Channel will be limited to 0~1.
Luminance channel value. Channel will be limited to 0~1.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.ColorHSL.#ctor(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Constructs a new instance of ColorHSL with custom channel values.
member.param: Alpha channel value. Channel will be limited to 0~1.
Hue channel value. Hue channels rotate between 0.0 and 1.0.
Saturation channel value. Channel will be limited to 0~1.
Luminance channel value. Channel will be limited to 0~1.

member.name: T:Rhino.Display.ColorLCH
member.summary: Represents an LCH (Lightness, A, B) color with double precision floating point channels. LCH colors (also sometimes called CIELUV) are transformation of the 1931 CIE XYZ color space, in order to approach perceptual uniformity. They are primarily used in computer graphics which deal with colored lights.

member.name: T:Rhino.Display.ColorHSV
member.summary: Represents an HSV (Hue, Saturation, Value) color with double precision floating point channels. HSV colors (also sometimes called HSB, where B means Brightness) are similar to HSL colors in that they represent colors in a cylindrical color space, and are intended to provide intuitive means to edit the brightness of a particular color over RGB color space where each each color channel would need to be modified to affect the color brightness.

member.summary:
Sets blending function used to determine how this bitmap is blended with the current framebuffer color. The default setting is SourceAlpha for source and OneMinusSourceAlpha for destination. See OpenGL's glBlendFunc for details.
http://www.opengl.org/sdk/docs/man/xhtml/glBlendFunc.xml

The destination blend mode.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.DisplayBitmap.Finalize
member.summary: Passively reclaims unmanaged resources when the class user did not explicitly call Dispose().

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.DisplayBitmap.Dispose
member.summary: Actively reclaims unmanaged resources that this instance uses.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.DisplayBitmap.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
For derived class implementers.
This method is called with argument true when class user calls Dispose(), while with argument false when the Garbage Collector invokes the finalizer, or Finalize() method.
You must reclaim all used unmanaged resources in both cases, and can use this chance to call Dispose on disposable fields if the argument is true.
Also, you must call the base virtual method within your overriding method.
member.param: true if the call comes from the Dispose() method; false if it comes from the Garbage Collector finalizer.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayBitmapDrawList.MaximumCachedSortLists
member.summary: Maximum number of cached sort order index lists stored on this class. Default is 10, but depending on the number of points in this list you may get better performance by setting this value to a certain percentage of the point count.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayBitmapDrawList.SortAngleTolerance
member.summary: Angle in radians used to determine if an index list is "parallel enough" to a viewports camera angle. Default is 0.0873 radians (5 degrees)

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayConduit.SpaceFilter
member.summary: If you want this conduit to only work in a specific space (model or page), then set this filter to that specific space. The default is None meaning no filter is applied

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.DisplayConduit.CalculateBoundingBox(Rhino.Display.CalculateBoundingBoxEventArgs)
member.summary:
Library developers should override this function to increase the bounding box of scene so it includes the geometry that you plan to draw in the "Draw" virtual functions.
The default implementation does nothing.
member.param: The event argument contain the current bounding box state.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.DisplayConduit.CalculateBoundingBoxZoomExtents(Rhino.Display.CalculateBoundingBoxEventArgs)
member.summary:
If you want to participate in the Zoom Extents command with your display conduit, then you will need to override ZoomExtentsBoundingBox. Typically you could just call your CalculateBoundingBox override, but you may also want to spend a little more time here and compute a tighter bounding box for your conduit geometry if that is needed.
The default implementation does nothing.
member.param: The event argument contain the current bounding box state.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.DisplayConduit.PreDrawObjects(Rhino.Display.DrawEventArgs)
member.summary:
Called before objects are been drawn. Depth writing and testing are on.
The default implementation does nothing.
member.param: The event argument contain the current viewport and display state.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.DisplayConduit.PreDrawObject(Rhino.Display.DrawObjectEventArgs)
member.summary: Called before every object in the scene is drawn.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.DisplayConduit.PostDrawObjects(Rhino.Display.DrawEventArgs)
member.summary:
Called after all non-highlighted objects have been drawn. Depth writing and testing are still turned on. If you want to draw without depth writing/testing, see DrawForeground.
The default implementation does nothing.
member.param: The event argument contains the current viewport and display state.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.DisplayConduit.DrawForeground(Rhino.Display.DrawEventArgs)
member.summary:
Called after all non-highlighted objects have been drawn and PostDrawObjects has been called. Depth writing and testing are turned OFF. If you want to draw with depth writing/testing, see PostDrawObjects.
The default implementation does nothing.
member.param: The event argument contains the current viewport and display state.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.DisplayConduit.DrawOverlay(Rhino.Display.DrawEventArgs)
member.summary:
If Rhino is in a feedback mode, the draw overlay call allows for temporary geometry to be drawn on top of everything in the scene. This is similar to the dynamic draw routine that occurs with custom get point.
The default implementation does nothing.
member.param: The event argument contains the current viewport and display state.

member.name: T:Rhino.Display.ZBiasMode
member.summary: Baising applied to geometry to attempt to get coplanar items to draw on top of or below other geometry

member.name: T:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline
member.summary:
The display pipeline calls events during specific phases of drawing During the drawing of a single frame the events are called in the following order.
[Begin Drawing of a Frame]
CalculateBoundingBox
CalculateClippingPanes
SetupFrustum
SetupLighting
InitializeFrameBuffer
DrawBackground
If this is a layout and detail objects exist the channels are called in the same order for each detail object (drawn as a nested viewport)
PreDrawObjects
For Each Visible Non Highlighted Object
SetupObjectDisplayAttributes
PreDrawObject
DrawObject
PostDrawObject
PostDrawObjects - depth writing/testing on
DrawForeGround - depth writing/testing off
For Each Visible Highlighted Object
SetupObjectDisplayAttributes
PreDrawObject
DrawObject
PostDrawObject
PostProcessFrameBuffer (If a delegate exists that requires this)
DrawOverlay (if Rhino is in a feedback mode)
[End of Drawing of a Frame]
NOTE: There may be multiple DrawObject calls for a single object. An example of when this could happen would be with a shaded sphere. The shaded mesh is first drawn and these channels would be processed; then at a later time the isocurves for the sphere would be drawn.

member.name: E:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.CalculateBoundingBoxZoomExtents
member.summary: Calculate a bounding to include in the Zoom Extents command.

member.name: E:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.PreDrawObjects
member.summary: Called before objects are been drawn. Depth writing and testing are on.

member.name: E:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.PreDrawTransparentObjects
member.summary: Called before transparent objects have been drawn. Depth writing and testing are on.

member.name: E:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.PreDrawObject
member.summary: Called right before an individual object is being drawn. NOTE: Do not use this event unless you absolutely need to. It is called for every object in the document and can slow disply down if a large number of objects exist in the document

member.name: E:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.PostDrawObjects
member.summary: Called after all non-highlighted objects have been drawn. Depth writing and testing are still turned on. If you want to draw without depth writing/testing, see DrawForeground.

member.name: E:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.DrawForeground
member.summary: Called after all non-highlighted objects have been drawn and PostDrawObjects has been called. Depth writing and testing are turned OFF. If you want to draw with depth writing/testing, see PostDrawObjects.
member.remarks: This event is actually passed a DrawForegroundEventArgs, but we could not change the event declaration without breaking the SDK. Cast to a DrawForegroundEventArgs if you need it.

member.name: E:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.DrawOverlay
member.summary: If Rhino is in a feedback mode, the draw overlay call allows for temporary geometry to be drawn on top of everything in the scene. This is similar to the dynamic draw routine that occurs with custom get point.

member.summary: Gets the size of the framebuffer that this pipeline is drawing to.

member.summary: Gets the contents of the framebuffer that this pipeline is drawing to.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.DefaultCurveThickness
member.summary: Gets the curve thickness as defined by the current display mode. Note: this only applies to curve objects, Brep and Mesh wires may have different settings.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.IsOpenGL
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not this pipeline is drawing into an OpenGL context.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.IsStereoMode
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether this pipeline is currently using an engine that is performing stereo style drawing. Stereo drawing is for providing an "enhanced 3-D" effect through stereo viewing devices.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.IsPrinting
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether this pipeline is currently drawing for printing purposes.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.IsInViewCapture
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether this pipeline is currently drawing for ViewCaptureToFile or ViewCaptureToClipboard

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.IsDynamicDisplay
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the viewport is in Dynamic Display state. Dynamic display is the state a viewport is in when it is rapidly redrawing because of an operation like panning or rotating. The pipeline will drop some level of detail while inside a dynamic display state to keep the frame rate as high as possible.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.SupportsShading
member.summary: Gets whether or not this pipeline supports shaded meshes.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.StereoProjection
member.summary:
Gets the current stereo projection if stereo mode is on.
0 = left
1 = right If stereo mode is not enables, this property always returns 0.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.ModelTransform
member.summary: Gets or sets the current model transformation that is applied to vertices when drawing.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.ModelTransformIsIdentity
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the Model Transform is an Identity transformation.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.RenderPass
member.summary: Gets the current pass that the pipeline is in for drawing a frame. Typically drawing a frame requires a single pass through the DrawFrameBuffer function, but some special display effects can be achieved through drawing with multiple passes.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.NestLevel
member.summary:
Gets the current nested viewport drawing level. This is used to know if you are currently inside the drawing of a nested viewport (detail object in Rhino).
Nest level = 0 Drawing is occuring in a standard Rhino viewport or on the page viewport.
Nest level = 1 Drawing is occuring inside a detail view object.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.DrawingWires
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the pipeline is currently in a curve drawing operation. This is useful when inside of a draw event or display conduit to check and see if the geometry is about to be drawn is going to be drawing the wire representation of the geometry (mesh, extrusion, or brep). See DrawingSurfaces to check and see if the shaded mesh representation of the geometry is going to be drawn.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.DrawingGrips
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the pipeline is currently in a grip drawing operation.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.DrawingSurfaces
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the pipeline is currently in a surface drawing operation. Surface drawing means draw the shaded triangles of a mesh representing the surface (mesh, extrusion, or brep). This is useful when inside of a draw event or display conduit to check and see if the geometry is about to be drawn as a shaded set of triangles representing the geometry. See DrawingWires to check and see if the wireframe representation of the geometry is going to be drawn.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.ShadingRequired
member.summary: Gets or sets the "ShadingRequired" flag. This flag gets set inside the pipeline when a request is made to draw a shaded mesh but the current render engine doesn't support shaded mesh drawing...at this point the redraw mechanism will make sure everything will work the next time around.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.DpiScale
member.summary: Scale factor used for high resolution displays. When a monitor that this pipeline is drawing to is at a DPI of 96, this value is one. On high DPI monitors, this value will commonly be greater than one.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.IsVisible(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d)
member.summary: Test a given 3d world coordinate point for visibility inside the view frustum under the current viewport and model transformation settings.
member.param: Point to test for visibility.
member.returns: true if the point is visible, false if it is not.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.IsVisible(Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject)
member.summary:
Test a given object for visibility inside the view frustum under the current viewport and model transformation settings. This function calls a virtual IsVisibleFinal function that subclassed pipelines can add extra tests to. In the base class, this test only tests visibility based on the objects world coordinates location and does not pay attention to the object's attributes.
NOTE: Use CRhinoDisplayPipeline::IsVisible() to perform "visibility" tests based on location (is some part of the object in the view frustum). Use CRhinoDisplayPipeline::IsActive() to perform "visibility" tests based on object type.
member.param: Object to test.
member.returns: true if the object is visible, false if not.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.IsVisible(Rhino.Geometry.BoundingBox)
member.summary: Test a given box for visibility inside the view frustum under the current viewport and model transformation settings.
member.param: Box to test for visibility.
member.returns: true if at least some portion of the box is visible, false if not.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.IsActive(Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject)
member.summary: Determines if an object can be visible in this viewport based on it's object type and display attributes. This test does not check for visibility based on location of the object. NOTE: Use CRhinoDisplayPipeline::IsVisible() to perform "visibility" tests based on location (is some part of the object in the view frustum). Use CRhinoDisplayPipeline::IsActive() to perform "visibility" tests based on object type.
member.param: Object to test.
member.returns: true if this object can be drawn in the pipeline's viewport based on it's object type and display attributes.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.DisplayPipeline.InterruptDrawing
member.summary: Tests to see if the pipeline should stop drawing more geometry and just show what it has so far. If a drawing operation is taking a long time, this function will return true and tell Rhino it should just finish up and show the frame buffer. This is used in dynamic drawing operations.
member.returns: true if the pipeline should stop attempting to draw more geometry and just show the frame buffer.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.ZBufferCapture.Finalize
member.summary: Passively reclaims unmanaged resources when the class user did not explicitly call Dispose().

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.ZBufferCapture.Dispose
member.summary: Actively reclaims unmanaged resources that this instance uses.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.ZBufferCapture.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
For derived class implementers.
This method is called with argument true when class user calls Dispose(), while with argument false when the Garbage Collector invokes the finalizer, or Finalize() method.
You must reclaim all used unmanaged resources in both cases, and can use this chance to call Dispose on disposable fields if the argument is true.
Also, you must call the base virtual method within your overriding method.
member.param: true if the call comes from the Dispose() method; false if it comes from the Garbage Collector finalizer.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoView.Redraw
member.summary: Redraws this view.
member.remarks: If you change something in "this" view like the projection, construction plane, background bitmap, etc., then you need to call RhinoView.Redraw() to redraw "this" view./ The other views will not be changed. If you change something in the document (like adding new geometry to the model), then you need to call RhinoDoc.Views.Redraw() to redraw all the views.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.PageViewSpaceChangeEventArgs.OldActiveDetailId

member.name: T:Rhino.Display.DefinedViewportProjection
member.summary: Parallel and perspective projections that are "standard" in Rhino

member.name: T:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport
member.summary: Displays geometry with a given projection. In standard modeling views there is a one to one relationship between RhinoView and RhinoViewports. In a page layout, there may be multiple RhinoViewports for a single layout.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.FromId(System.Guid)
member.summary: Call this method to get the viewport with the specified Id.
member.param: Id to search for.
member.returns: Returns a RhinoViewport if the Id is found otherwise null.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.ParentView
member.summary:
Gets the parent view, if there is one
Every RhinoView has an associated RhinoViewport that does all the 3d display work. Those associated viewports return the RhinoView as their parent view. However, RhinoViewports are used in other image creating contexts that do not have a parent RhinoView. If you call ParentView, you MUST check for NULL return values.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.Id
member.summary: Unique id for this viewport.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.ChangeCounter
member.summary: The value of change counter is incremented every time the view projection or construction plane changes. The user can the mouse and nestable view manipulation commands to change a view at any time. The value of change counter can be used to detect these changes in code that is sensitive to the view projection.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.IsVisible(Rhino.Geometry.BoundingBox)

member.returns: true if the box is potentially visible; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.IsVisible(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d)
member.summary: Deterines if a world coordinate point is visible in the viewing frustum.
member.param: A point that is tested for visibility.
member.returns: true if the point is visible; otherwise false.

member.summary: Sets optimal clipping planes to view objects in a world coordinate 3d bounding box.
member.param: The bounding box

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.Name
member.summary: Name associated with this viewport.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.CameraTarget
member.summary: Viewport target point.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.SetCameraTarget(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set viewport target point. By default the camera location is translated so that the camera direction vector is parallel to the vector from the camera location to the target location.
member.param: new target location.
if true, the camera location is translated so that the camera direction vector is parallel to the vector from the camera location to the target location. If false, the camera location is not changed.
member.remarks: In general, Rhino users expect to have the camera direction vector and the vector from the camera location to the target location to be parallel. If you use the RhinoViewport functions to set the camera location, camera direction, and target point, then the relationship between these three points and vectors is automatically maintained. If you directly manipulate the camera properties, then you should carefully set the target by calling SetTarget() with updateCameraLocation=false.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.SetCameraLocations(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d)
member.summary: Set viewport camera location and target location. The camera direction vector is changed so that it is parallel to the vector from the camera location to the target location.
member.param: new target location.
new camera location.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.SetCameraLocation(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set viewport camera location. By default the target location is changed so that the vector from the camera location to the target is parallel to the camera direction vector.
member.param: new camera location.

if true, the target location is changed so that the vector from the camera location to the target is parallel to the camera direction vector. If false, the target location is not changed. See the remarks section of RhinoViewport.SetTarget for important details.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.SetCameraDirection(Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set viewport camera direction. By default the target location is changed so that the vector from the camera location to the target is parallel to the camera direction.
member.param: new camera direction.

if true, the target location is changed so that the vector from the camera location to the target is parallel to the camera direction. If false, the target location is not changed. See the remarks section of RhinoViewport.SetTarget for important details.

member.summary: Sets the viewport camera projection.

if true, the target location is changed so that the vector from the camera location to the target is parallel to the camera direction vector. If false, the target location is not changed.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.PreviousViewProjection
member.summary: Sets the view projection and target to the settings that were active before the last call to NextViewProjection.
member.returns: true if the view stack was popped.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.IsPlanView

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.Magnify(System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Zooms or dollies in order to scale the viewport projection of observed objects.
member.param: The scale factor.

false = perform a "dolly" magnification by moving the camera towards/away from the target so that the amount of the screen subtended by an object changes. true = perform a "zoom" magnification by adjusting the "lens" angle
member.returns: true if operation succeeded; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.Magnify(System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Drawing.Point)
member.summary: Zooms or dollies in order to scale the viewport projection of observed objects.
member.param: The scale factor.

false = perform a "dolly" magnification by moving the camera towards/away from the target so that the amount of the screen subtended by an object changes. true = perform a "zoom" magnification by adjusting the "lens" angle
A point in the sceen that should remain fixed.
member.returns: true if operation succeeded; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.Rotate(System.Double,Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d)
member.summary: Rotates about the specified axis. A positive rotation angle results in a counter-clockwise rotation about the axis (right hand rule).

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.ChangeToParallelProjection(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Use this function to change projections of valid viewports from persective to parallel. It will make common additional adjustments to the frustum so the resulting views are similar. The camera location and direction will not be changed.
member.param: true if you want the resulting frustum to be symmetric.
member.returns: If the current projection is parallel and bSymmetricFrustum, FrustumIsLeftRightSymmetric() and FrustumIsTopBottomSymmetric() are all equal, then no changes are made and true is returned.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.ChangeToPerspectiveProjection(System.Boolean,System.Double)
member.summary: Use this function to change projections of valid viewports from parallel to perspective. It will make common additional adjustments to the frustum and camera location so the resulting views are similar. The camera direction and target point are not be changed.
member.param: true if you want the resulting frustum to be symmetric.

(pass 50.0 when in doubt) 35 mm lens length to use when changing from parallel to perspective projections. If the current projection is perspective or lens_length is <= 0.0, then this parameter is ignored.
member.returns: If the current projection is perspective and bSymmetricFrustum, FrustumIsLeftRightSymmetric() and FrustumIsTopBottomSymmetric() are all equal, then no changes are made and true is returned.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.ChangeToPerspectiveProjection(System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Double)
member.summary: Use this function to change projections of valid viewports from parallel to perspective. It will make common additional adjustments to the frustum and camera location so the resulting views are similar. The camera direction and target point are not be changed.
member.param: If RhinoMath.UnsetValue this parameter is ignored. Otherwise it must be > 0 and indicates which plane in the current view frustum should be perserved.
true if you want the resulting frustum to be symmetric.

(pass 50.0 when in doubt) 35 mm lens length to use when changing from parallel to perspective projections. If the current projection is perspective or lens_length is <= 0.0, then this parameter is ignored.
member.returns: If the current projection is perspective and bSymmetricFrustum, FrustumIsLeftRightSymmetric() and FrustumIsTopBottomSymmetric() are all equal, then no changes are made and true is returned.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.ChangeToTwoPointPerspectiveProjection(System.Double)
member.summary: Use this function to change projections of valid viewports to a two point perspective. It will make common additional adjustments to the frustum and camera location and direction so the resulting views are similar.
member.param: (pass 50.0 when in doubt) 35 mm lens length to use when changing from parallel to perspective projections. If the current projection is perspective or lens_length is <= 0.0, then this parameter is ignored.
member.returns: If the current projection is perspective and bSymmetricFrustum, FrustumIsLeftRightSymmetric() and FrustumIsTopBottomSymmetric() are all equal, then no changes are made and true is returned.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.RhinoViewport.ChangeToTwoPointPerspectiveProjection(System.Double,Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d,System.Double)
member.summary: Use this function to change projections of valid viewports to a two point perspective. It will make common additional adjustments to the frustum and camera location and direction so the resulting views are similar.
member.param: If RhinoMath.UnsetValue this parameter is ignored. Otherwise it must be > 0 and indicates which plane in the current view frustum should be perserved.

This direction will be the locked up direction. Pass ON_3dVector::ZeroVector if you want to use the world axis direction that is closest to the current up direction. Pass CameraY() if you want to preserve the current up direction.

(pass 50.0 when in doubt) 35 mm lens length to use when changing from parallel to perspective projections. If the current projection is perspective or lens_length is <= 0.0, then this parameter is ignored.
member.returns: If the current projection is perspective and bSymmetricFrustum, FrustumIsLeftRightSymmetric() and FrustumIsTopBottomSymmetric() are all equal, then no changes are made and true is returned.

member.name: T:Rhino.Display.VisualAnalysisMode
member.summary:
Represents a base class for visual analysis modes.
This class is abstract.

member.name: T:Rhino.Display.VisualAnalysisMode.AnalysisStyle
member.summary: Contains enumerated values for analysis styles, such as wireframe, texture or false colors..

member.name: F:Rhino.Display.VisualAnalysisMode.AnalysisStyle.Wireframe
member.summary: The analysis is showing with wires.

member.name: F:Rhino.Display.VisualAnalysisMode.AnalysisStyle.Texture
member.summary: The analysis is showing with textures.

member.name: F:Rhino.Display.VisualAnalysisMode.AnalysisStyle.FalseColor
member.summary: The analysis is showing with false colors.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.VisualAnalysisMode.RhinoEdgeAnalysisModeId
member.summary: Id for Rhino's built-in edge analysis mode. Brep and mesh edges are shown in a selected color.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.VisualAnalysisMode.RhinoCurvatureGraphAnalysisModeId
member.summary: Id for Rhino's built-in curvature graphs analysis mode. Curvature hair is shown on curves and surfaces.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.VisualAnalysisMode.RhinoZebraStripeAnalysisModeId
member.summary: Id for Rhino's built-in zebra stripe analysis mode. Zebra stripes are shown on surfaces and meshes.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.VisualAnalysisMode.RhinoEmapAnalysisModeId
member.summary: Id for Rhino's built-in emap analysis mode. An environment map is shown on sufaces and meshes.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.VisualAnalysisMode.RhinoCurvatureColorAnalyisModeId
member.summary: Id for Rhino's built-in curvature color analysis mode. Surface curvature is shown using false color mapping.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.VisualAnalysisMode.RhinoDraftAngleAnalysisModeId
member.summary: Id for Rhino's built-in draft angle analysis mode. Draft angle is displayed using false colors.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.VisualAnalysisMode.RhinoThicknessAnalysisModeId
member.summary: Id for Rhino's built-in thickness analysis mode.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.VisualAnalysisMode.Register(System.Type)
member.summary: Registers a custom visual analysis mode for use in Rhino. It is OK to call register multiple times for a single custom analysis mode type, since subsequent register calls will notice that the type has already been registered.
member.param: Must be a type that is a subclass of VisualAnalysisMode.
member.returns: An instance of registered analysis mode on success.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.VisualAnalysisMode.Find(System.Guid)
member.summary: Finds a visual analysis mode by guid.
member.param: The globally unique identifier to search for.
member.returns: The found visual analysis mode, or null if it was not found, or on error.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.VisualAnalysisMode.Find(System.Type)
member.summary: Finds a visual analysis mode by type.
member.param: A visual analysis mode type.
member.returns: A visual analysis mode on success, or null on error.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.VisualAnalysisMode.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the analysis mode. It is used by the _What command and the object properties details window to describe the object.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.VisualAnalysisMode.Style
member.summary: Gets the visual analysis mode style.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.VisualAnalysisMode.Id
member.summary: Gets the visual analysis mode GUID. The Guid is specified with the GuidAttribute applied to the class.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.VisualAnalysisMode.EnableUserInterface(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Turns the analysis mode's user interface on and off. For Rhino's built in modes this opens or closes the modeless dialog that controls the analysis mode's display settings.
member.param: true if the inferface should be shown; false if it should be concealed.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.VisualAnalysisMode.ObjectSupportsAnalysisMode(Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if this visual analysis mode can be used on a given Rhino object.
member.param: The object to be tested.
member.returns: true if this mode can indeed be used on the object; otherwise false.

member.name: P:Rhino.Display.VisualAnalysisMode.ShowIsoCurves
member.summary:
Gets true if this visual analysis mode will show isocuves on shaded surface objects. Often a mode's user interface will provide a way to change this setting.
The default is false.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.VisualAnalysisMode.SetUpDisplayAttributes(Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject,Rhino.Display.DisplayPipelineAttributes)
member.summary: If an analysis mode needs to modify display attributes, this is the place to do it. In particular, Style==Texture, then this function must be overridden.
member.remarks: Shaded analysis modes that use texture mapping, like zebra and emap, override this function set the tex, diffuse_color, and EnableLighting parameter.
member.param: The object for which to set up attributes.
The linked attributes.

member.name: M:Rhino.Display.VisualAnalysisMode.UpdateVertexColors(Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject,Rhino.Geometry.Mesh[])
member.summary: If Style==falseColor, then this virtual function must be overridden. Rhino calls this function when it is time for to set the false colors on the analysis mesh vertices. For breps, there is one mesh per face. For mesh objects there is a single mesh.
member.param: The object for which to update vertex colors.
An array of meshes that should be updated.

The drawing pipeline.

member.summary: Transform applied to mapping coordinate (u,v,w) to convert it into a texture coordinate.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.TextureMapping.PrimativeTransform
member.summary: For primitive based mappings, these transformations are used to map the world coordinate (x,y,z) point P and surface normal N before it is projected to the normalized mapping primitive. The surface normal transformation, m_Nxyz, is always calculated from m_Pxyz. It is a runtime setting that is not saved in 3dm files. If m_type is srfp_mapping, then m_Pxyz and m_Nxyz are ignored.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.TextureMapping.NormalTransform
member.summary: For primitive based mappings, these transformations are used to map the world coordinate (x,y,z) point P and surface normal N before it is projected to the normalized mapping primitive. The surface normal transformation, m_Nxyz, is always calculated from m_Pxyz. It is a runtime setting that is not saved in 3dm files. If m_type is srfp_mapping, then m_Pxyz and m_Nxyz are ignored.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.TextureMapping.Evaluate(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d@)
member.summary: Evaluate the mapping to get a texture coordinate
member.param: Vertex location
If the mapping projection is ray_projection, then this is the vertex unit normal. Otherwise n is ignored.
Texture coordinate (u,v,w)
member.returns: Nonzero if evaluation is successful. When the mapping is a box or capped cylinder mapping, the value indicates which side was evaluated. Cylinder mapping: 1 = cylinder wall, 2 = bottom cap, 3 = top cap Box mapping: 1 = front, 2 = right, 3 = back, 4 = left, 5 = bottom, 6 = top

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.TextureMapping.Evaluate(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d@,Rhino.Geometry.Transform,Rhino.Geometry.Transform)
member.summary: Evaluate the mapping to get a texture coordinate
member.param: Vertex location
If the mapping projection is ray_projection, then this is the vertex unit normal. Otherwise n is ignored.
Texture coordinate (u,v,w)
Transformation to be applied to P before performing the mapping calculation.
Transformation to be applied to N before performing the mapping calculation. One way to calculate nXxform is to use the call pXform::GetVectorTransform(nXform).
member.returns: Nonzero if evaluation is successful. When the mapping is a box or capped cylinder mapping, the value indicates which side was evaluated. Cylinder mapping: 1 = cylinder wall, 2 = bottom cap, 3 = top cap Box mapping: 1 = front, 2 = right, 3 = back, 4 = left, 5 = bottom, 6 = top

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.TextureMapping.TryGetMappingBox(Rhino.Geometry.Plane@,Rhino.Geometry.Interval@,Rhino.Geometry.Interval@,Rhino.Geometry.Interval@)
member.summary: Get a box projection from the texture mapping.
member.param: The center of the box is at plane.origin and the sides of the box are parallel to the plane's coordinate planes.

The "front" and "back" sides of the box are in spanned by the vectors plane.yaxis and plane.zaxis. The back plane contains the point plane.PointAt(dx[0],0,0) and the front plane contains the point plane.PointAt(dx[1],0,0).

The "left" and "right" sides of the box are in spanned by the vectors plane.zaxis and plane.xaxis. The left plane contains the point plane.PointAt(0,dx[0],0) and the back plane contains the point plane.PointAt(0,dy[1],0).

The "top" and "bottom" sides of the box are in spanned by the vectors plane.xaxis and plane.yaxis. The bottom plane contains the point plane.PointAt(0,0,dz[0]) and the top plane contains the point plane.PointAt(0,0,dz[1]).
member.returns: Returns true if a valid box is returned.
member.remarks: Generally, GetMappingBox will not return the same parameters passed to SetBoxMapping. However, the location of the box will be the same.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.TextureMapping.TryGetMappingBox(Rhino.Geometry.Plane@,Rhino.Geometry.Interval@,Rhino.Geometry.Interval@,Rhino.Geometry.Interval@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Get a box projection from the texture mapping, including capped information
member.param: The center of the box is at plane.origin and the sides of the box are parallel to the plane's coordinate planes.

The "front" and "back" sides of the box are in spanned by the vectors plane.yaxis and plane.zaxis. The back plane contains the point plane.PointAt(dx[0],0,0) and the front plane contains the point plane.PointAt(dx[1],0,0).

The "left" and "right" sides of the box are in spanned by the vectors plane.zaxis and plane.xaxis. The left plane contains the point plane.PointAt(0,dx[0],0) and the back plane contains the point plane.PointAt(0,dy[1],0).

The "top" and "bottom" sides of the box are in spanned by the vectors plane.xaxis and plane.yaxis. The bottom plane contains the point plane.PointAt(0,0,dz[0]) and the top plane contains the point plane.PointAt(0,0,dz[1]).
true if box mapping is capped.
member.returns: Returns true if a valid box is returned.
member.remarks: Generally, GetMappingBox will not return the same parameters passed to SetBoxMapping. However, the location of the box will be the same.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.TextureMapping.TryGetMappingSphere(Rhino.Geometry.Sphere@)
member.summary: Get a spherical projection parameters from this texture mapping.
member.returns: Returns true if a valid sphere is returned.
member.remarks: Generally, GetMappingShere will not return the same parameters passed to SetSphereMapping. However, the location of the sphere will be the same. If this mapping is not cylindrical, the cylinder will approximate the actual mapping primitive.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.TextureMapping.TryGetMappingCylinder(Rhino.Geometry.Cylinder@)
member.summary: Get a cylindrical projection parameters from this texture mapping.
member.returns: Returns true if a valid cylinder is returned.
member.remarks: Generally, GetMappingCylinder will not return the same parameters passed to SetCylinderMapping. However, the location of the cylinder will be the same. If this mapping is not cylindrical, the cylinder will approximate the actual mapping primitive.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.TextureMapping.TryGetMappingCylinder(Rhino.Geometry.Cylinder@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Get a cylindrical projection parameters from this texture mapping.
member.param: will be true if capped
member.returns: Returns true if a valid cylinder is returned.
member.remarks: Generally, GetMappingCylinder will not return the same parameters passed to SetCylinderMapping. However, the location of the cylinder will be the same. If this mapping is not cylindrical, the cylinder will approximate the actual mapping primitive.

member.summary: Get plane mapping parameters from this texture mapping.
member.param: Portion of the plane's x axis that is mapped to [0,1]
Portion of the plane's y axis that is mapped to [0,1]
Portion of the plane's z axis that is mapped to [0,1]

member.summary: Get plane mapping parameters from this texture mapping, including capping information

member.remarks: NOTE WELL: Generally, GetMappingPlane will not return the same parameters passed to SetPlaneMapping. However, the location of the plane will be the same.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.TextureMapping.CreatePlaneMapping(Rhino.Geometry.Plane,Rhino.Geometry.Interval,Rhino.Geometry.Interval,Rhino.Geometry.Interval)
member.summary: Create a planar UV projection texture mapping
member.param: A plane to use for mapping.
portion of the plane's x axis that is mapped to [0,1] (can be a decreasing interval)
portion of the plane's y axis that is mapped to [0,1] (can be a decreasing interval)
portion of the plane's z axis that is mapped to [0,1] (can be a decreasing interval)
member.returns: TextureMapping instance if input is valid

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.TextureMapping.CreatePlaneMapping(Rhino.Geometry.Plane,Rhino.Geometry.Interval,Rhino.Geometry.Interval,Rhino.Geometry.Interval,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create a planar projection texture mapping
member.param: A plane to use for mapping.
portion of the plane's x axis that is mapped to [0,1] (can be a decreasing interval)
portion of the plane's y axis that is mapped to [0,1] (can be a decreasing interval)
portion of the plane's z axis that is mapped to [0,1] (can be a decreasing interval)
set to true if planar UVW is meant, false for planar UV
member.returns: TextureMapping instance if input is valid

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.TextureMapping.CreateCylinderMapping(Rhino.Geometry.Cylinder,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create a cylindrical projection texture mapping.
member.param: cylinder in world space used to define a cylindrical coordinate system. The angular parameter maps (0,2pi) to texture "u" (0,1), The height parameter maps (height[0],height[1]) to texture "v" (0,1), and the radial parameter maps (0,r) to texture "w" (0,1).
If true, the cylinder is treated as a finite capped cylinder
member.remarks: When the cylinder is capped and m_texture_space = divided, the cylinder is mapped to texture space as follows: The side is mapped to 0 <= "u" <= 2/3. The bottom is mapped to 2/3 <= "u" <= 5/6. The top is mapped to 5/6 <= "u" <= 5/6. This is the same convention box mapping uses.
member.returns: TextureMapping instance if input is valid

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.TextureMapping.CreateSphereMapping(Rhino.Geometry.Sphere)
member.summary: Create a spherical projection texture mapping.
member.param: sphere in world space used to define a spherical coordinate system. The longitude parameter maps (0,2pi) to texture "u" (0,1). The latitude paramter maps (-pi/2,+pi/2) to texture "v" (0,1). The radial parameter maps (0,r) to texture "w" (0,1).
member.returns: TextureMapping instance if input is valid

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.TextureMapping.CreateBoxMapping(Rhino.Geometry.Plane,Rhino.Geometry.Interval,Rhino.Geometry.Interval,Rhino.Geometry.Interval,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create a box projection texture mapping.
member.param: The sides of the box the box are parallel to the plane's coordinate planes. The dx, dy, dz intervals determine the location of the sides.
Determines the location of the front and back planes. The vector plane.xaxis is perpendicular to these planes and they pass through plane.PointAt(dx[0],0,0) and plane.PointAt(dx[1],0,0), respectivly.
Determines the location of the left and right planes. The vector plane.yaxis is perpendicular to these planes and they pass through plane.PointAt(0,dy[0],0) and plane.PointAt(0,dy[1],0), respectivly.
Determines the location of the top and bottom planes. The vector plane.zaxis is perpendicular to these planes and they pass through plane.PointAt(0,0,dz[0]) and plane.PointAt(0,0,dz[1]), respectivly.
If true, the box is treated as a finite capped box.
member.returns: TextureMapping instance if input is valid

member.summary: Construct a new ChangeQueue from the given document
member.param: Id of plugin instantiating ChangeQueue

Determines whether the display pipeline attributes for this viewport should be taken into account when supplying data. If you are using this queue to populate a scene for the "Render" command, set this to false. If you are using it to draw a realtime preview, you will probably want to set it to true.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.ChangeQueue.ChangeQueue.#ctor(System.Guid,System.UInt32,Rhino.DocObjects.ViewInfo,Rhino.Display.DisplayPipelineAttributes,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Construct a new ChangeQueue from the given document, using given display pipeline attributes.
member.param: Id of plugin instantiating ChangeQueue
Display pipeline attributes to use.

Determines whether the display pipeline attributes for this viewport should be taken into account when supplying data. If you are using this queue to populate a scene for the "Render" command, set this to false. If you are using it to draw a realtime preview, you will probably want to set it to true.
Determines whether you want to receive updates when the model changes. If you are rendering for a view capture, print or something similar, you will probably want to set this to false.

The preview scene for these args will be used to populate the world.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.ChangeQueue.ChangeQueue.Flush
member.summary:
Tell the ChangeQueue to flush all collected events.
This can trigger a host of Apply* calls.
The following is the order in which those calls get made if there are changes for that specific data type:
ApplyViewChange ApplyLinearWorkflowChanges ApplyDynamicObjectTransforms ApplyDynamicLightChanges ApplyRenderSettingsChanges ApplyEnvironmentChanges (background) ApplyEnvironmentChanges (refl) ApplyEnvironmentChanges (sky) ApplySkylightChanges ApplySunChanges ApplyLightChanges ApplyMaterialChanges ApplyMeshChanges ApplyMeshInstanceChanges ApplyGroundPlaneChanges ApplyClippingPlaneChanges

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.ChangeQueue.ChangeQueue.GetQueueSkylight
member.summary: Get skylight known to the queue at the time of the Flush

member.summary: Get groundplane known to the queue at the time of the Flush

member.summary: Get render settings known to the queue at the time of the Flush

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.ChangeQueue.ChangeQueue.GetQueueSun
member.summary: Get sun known to the queue at the time of the Flush

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.ChangeQueue.ChangeQueue.GetQueueView
member.summary: Get view known to the queue at the time of the Flush
member.returns: ViewInfo

If true then the file type can be exported and will be included in the file save box when exporting the specified render content type.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.UI.IUserInterfaceSection.Hidden
member.summary: Return true if the section should be hidden, else return false.
member.remarks: This is not to be confused with IsShown(). Hidden tells the holder whether or not to hide the section. IsShown reports the current physical state of the control.
This method is called continuously by the holder and should be implemented to be as fast as possible. It is recommended that the state be calculated and cached in and the cached value returned here.

member.summary: Constructs a new content of the specified type and add it to the persistent content list. This function cannot be used to create temporary content that you delete after use. Options for the tab.
The current Rhino document.
member.returns: A new persistent render content.

member.param: Is the type of the content to add.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.Create(System.Guid,Rhino.Render.RenderContent,System.String,Rhino.Render.RenderContent.ShowContentChooserFlags,Rhino.RhinoDoc)
member.summary: Constructs a new content of the specified type and add it to the persistent content list. This function cannot be used to create temporary content that you delete after use. Content created by this function is owned by RDK and appears in the content editor. To create a temporary content which is owned by you, call RenderContentType.NewContentFromType().
member.param: is the type of the content to add.

Parent is the parent content. If not NULL, this must be an RDK-owned content that is in the persistent content list (either top-level or child). The new content then becomes its child. If NULL, the new content is added to the top-level content list instead.
ChildSlotName is the unique child identifier to use for the new content when creating it as a child of pParent (i.e., when pParent is not NULL)
Options for the tab.
The current Rhino document.
member.returns: A new persistent render content.

Parent is the parent content. If not NULL, this must be an RDK-owned content that is in the persistent content list (either top-level or child). The new content then becomes its child. If NULL, the new content is added to the top-level content list instead.

Options for the tab.
The current Rhino document.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.CalculateRenderHash(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Override this method to calculate the render hash of the state that affects how the content is rendered. Does not include children or perform any caching. Render hash values are now automatically cached by the content framework and you do not have to worry about caching. You also do not have to worry about iterating into children. This method is now only called internally by the framework, use the RenderHash property to get the current hash value.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.RenderHash
member.summary:
Render hash for the content hierarchy. It iterates children and includes a caching mechanism which means the hash value can be retrieved quickly if it hasn't changed. The cache is invalidated when Changed() is called.
You can override the method to provide a custom hash value.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.BeginChange(Rhino.Render.RenderContent.ChangeContexts)
member.summary: Begins a change or batch of changes. This returns a reference to the content which you should use to make your changes. It may also make a copy of the content state allowing to send an event with the old and new contents. Calls to this method are counted; you must call EndChange() once for every call to BeginChange(). Note: If Changed() was called between the calls to BeginChange() and EndChange(), the last call to EndChange() may cause the ContentChanged event to be sent.
member.param: the change context. If this is kUI, kProgram, kDrop or kTree, the content will be copied. EndChange() will then send the copy as 'old' in the OnContentChanged event. Note: If you override this method, please be sure to call the base class.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.EndChange
member.summary: Ends a change or batch of changes. Calls to this method are counted; you must call this method once for every call to . Note: If was called with ChangeContexts.UI, ChangeContexts.Program, ChangeContexts.Drop or ChangeContexts.UI.Tree and Changed() was called between the calls to and EndChange(), the last call to EndChange() will raise the event.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.OnGetDefaultsInteractive
member.summary: Override this method to prompt user for information necessary to create a new content object. For example, if you are created a textured material you may prompt the user for a bitmap file name prior to creating the textured material.
member.returns: If true is returned the content is created otherwise the creation is aborted.

The UI to add the new UI to.
The expandable tab caption

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.AddUserInterfaceSection(System.Type,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)

This class type must be derived from IWin32Window or this method will throw an ArgumentException. Implement the IUserInterfaceSection interface in your classType to get UserInterfaceSection notification.
Expandable tab caption.
If this value is true then the new expandable tab section will initially be expanded, if it is false it will be collapsed.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.IsLocked
member.summary: Set this property to true prior to adding content to the document to lock the content browser editing UI methods. Setting this to true will keep the browser from allowing things like deleting, renaming or changing content. This is useful for custom child content that you want to be editable but persistent. Setting this after adding content to the document will cause an exception to be thrown.
member.exception: IsLocked must be called prior to adding content to the document

members.member: Change a content's child by allowing the user to choose the new content type from a content browser dialog. The child is created if it does not exist, otherwise the old child is deleted and replaced by the new child. \param parentContent is the content whose child is to be manipulated. This must be an RDK-owned content that is in the persistent content list (either top-level or child). \param wszChildSlotName is the child-slot name of the child to be manipulated. \param allowedKinds determines which content kinds are allowed to be chosen from the content browser dialog. \param uFlags is a set of flags for controlling the content browser dialog. \return \e true if successful, \e false if it fails or if the user cancels.

member.name: F:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.ChangeContexts.Tree
member.summary: Change occurred within the content tree (e.g., nodes reordered).

member.name: F:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.ChangeContexts.Undo
member.summary: Change occurred as a result of an undo.

member.name: F:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.ChangeContexts.FieldInit
member.summary: Change occurred as a result of a field initialization.

member.name: F:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.ChangeContexts.Serialize
member.summary: Change occurred during serialization (loading).

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.GetShader(System.Guid,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: See C++ RDK documentation - this is a pass through function that gives access to your own native shader. .NET clients will more likely simply check the type of their content and call their own shader access functions If you overide this function, you must ensure that you call "IsCompatible" and return IntPtr.Zero is that returns false.
member.param: The render engine requesting the shader.
A pointer to the render engine's own context object.
member.returns: A pointer to the unmanaged shader.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.ChildSlotNameFromParamName(System.String)
member.summary: A "child slot" is the specific "slot" that a child (usually a texture) occupies. This is generally the "use" of the child - in other words, the thing the child operates on. Some examples are "color", "transparency".
member.param: The name of a parameter field. Since child textures will usually correspond with some parameter (they generally either replace or modify a parameter over UV space) these functions are used to specify which parameter corresponded with child slot. If there is no correspondence, return the empty string.
member.returns: The default behavior for these functions is to return the input string. Sub-classes may (in the future) override these functions to provide different mappings.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.ParamNameFromChildSlotName(System.String)
member.summary: A "child slot" is the specific "slot" that a child (usually a texture) occupies. This is generally the "use" of the child - in other words, the thing the child operates on. Some examples are "color", "transparency".
member.param: The named of the child slot to receive the parameter name for.
member.returns: The default behavior for these functions is to return the input string. Sub-classes may (in the future) override these functions to provide different mappings.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.SetChild(Rhino.Render.RenderContent,System.String)
member.summary: Set another content as a child of this content. This content may or may not be attached to a document. If this content already has a child with the specified child slot name, that child will be deleted. If this content is not attached to a document, the child will be added without sending any events. If this content is attached to a document, the necessary events will be sent to update the UI. Note: Do not call this method to add children in your constructor. If you want to add default children, you should override Initialize() and add them there.
member.param: Child content to add to this content. If pChild is NULL, the function will fail. If pChild is already attached to a document, the function will fail. If pChild is already a child of this or another content, the function will fail.
The name that will be assigned to this child slot. The child slot name cannot be an empty string. If it is, the function will fail.
member.returns: Returns true if the content was added or the child slot with this name was modified otherwise; returns false.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.SetChild(Rhino.Render.RenderContent,System.String,Rhino.Render.RenderContent.ChangeContexts)
member.summary: Set another content as a child of this content. This content may or may not be attached to a document. If this content already has a child with the specified child slot name, that child will be deleted. If this content is not attached to a document, the child will be added without sending any events. If this content is attached to a document, the necessary events will be sent to update the UI. Note: Do not call this method to add children in your constructor. If you want to add default children, you should override Initialize() and add them there.
member.param: Child content to add to this content. If pChild is NULL, the function will fail. If pChild is already attached to a document, the function will fail. If pChild is already a child of this or another content, the function will fail.
The name that will be assigned to this child slot. The child slot name cannot be an empty string. If it is, the function will fail.
member.returns: Returns true if the content was added or the child slot with this name was modified otherwise; returns false.

member.name: T:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.NewRenderContentCallbackEvent
member.summary: Function pointer to pass to the C++ wrapper, there is one of these for each of RenderMaterail, RenderTexture and RenderEnvironment.
member.param: Class type GUID custom attribute
member.returns: Returns a new C++ pointer of the requested content type.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.NewRenderContent(System.Guid,System.Type)
member.summary: Create content from type Id, called by the NewRenderContentCallbackEvent methods to create a .NET object pointer of a specific type from a class type Guid.
member.param: The class GUID property to look up
The created content must be this type
member.returns: Valid content object if the typeId is found otherwise null.

member.name: T:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.IsFactoryProductAcceptableAsChildCallback
member.summary: Called after content has been allocated and before it has been added to the document. Override this method when you need to call virtual class methods that should not be called from the constructor.
member.returns: Return true to allow the content to be added to the document or false if it should be destroyed.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.IsFactoryProductAcceptableAsChild(System.Guid,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Override this method to restrict the type of acceptable child content. The default implementation of this method just returns true.
member.returns: Return true only if content with the specified kindId can be accepted as a child in the specified child slot.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.FilesToEmbed
member.summary: A string array of full paths to files used by the content that may be embedded in .3dm files and library files (.rmtl, .renv, .rtex). The default implementation returns an empty string list. Override this to return the file name or file names used by your content. This is typically used by textures that reference files containing the texture imagery.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.RenderContent.VirtualIcon(System.Drawing.Size,System.Drawing.Bitmap@)
member.summary: Icon to display in the content browser, this bitmap needs to be valid for the life of this content object, the content object that returns the bitmap is responsible for disposing of the bitmap.
member.param: Requested icon size
member.returns: Return Icon to display in the content browser.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.RenderContentEventArgs.Reason

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.RenderContentEventArgs.EnvironmentUsage
member.summary:
Meaningful for CurrentEnvironmentChanged event. Will be one of Background, ReflectionAndRefraction or Skylighting.
Since 6.11

member.name: T:Rhino.Render.RenderContentChangeReason

member.name: F:Rhino.Render.RenderContentChangeReason.None

member.name: F:Rhino.Render.RenderContentChangeReason.Attach
member.summary: Content is being attached by the RhinoDoc.AttachContent() or RenderContent.AttachChild() methods.

member.name: F:Rhino.Render.RenderContentChangeReason.Detach
member.summary: Content is being detached by the RenderContent.DeleteContent() method.

member.name: F:Rhino.Render.RenderContentChangeReason.ChangeAttach

member.name: F:Rhino.Render.RenderContentChangeReason.ChangeDetach
member.summary: Content is being detached while changing.

member.name: F:Rhino.Render.RenderContentChangeReason.DetachUndo

member.name: F:Rhino.Render.RenderContentChangeReason.Open
member.summary: Content is being attached during open document

member.name: F:Rhino.Render.RenderContentChangeReason.Delete

member.name: T:Rhino.Render.Fields.FieldDictionary
member.summary: Dictionary containing RenderContent data fields, add fields to this dictionary in your derived RenderContent classes constructor. Get field values using the TryGet[data type]() methods and set them using the Set() method.

member.name: F:Rhino.Render.Fields.FieldDictionary.m_content
member.summary: RenderContent that owns this dictionary.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.Fields.FieldDictionary.#ctor(Rhino.Render.RenderContent)
member.summary: Internal constructor, this object should only be created by the RenderContent constructor.
member.param: Owner of this dictionary

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.Fields.FieldDictionary.ContainsField(System.String)
member.summary: Call this method to determine if a this FieldsList contains a field with the specified field name.
member.param: Field to search for
member.returns: Returns true if a field with that matches fieldName is found or false if it is not found.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.Fields.FieldDictionary.GetField(System.String)
member.summary: Call this method to get the field with the matching name.
member.param: Field name to search for.
member.returns: If the field exists in the Fields dictionary then the field is returned otherwise; null is returned.

member.name: T:Rhino.Render.Fields.Field
member.summary: Generic data fields used to add publicly accessible properties to RenderContent.FieldDictionary. These should be created by calling a FieldDictaionary.Add() method on a Render content object. These are allocated after the RenderContent object's C++ object is created and added to the underlying C++ objects content dictionary, who ever allocates a field is responsible for deleting it so these objects clean up the C++ pointers when they are disposed of.

member.summary: This constructor gets called when attaching to an unmanaged pointer that the RDK passes to a virtual function, there is no clean up need in this case because the RDK takes care of freeing the pointer when it is done calling the virtual method.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.RenderPrimitiveList.ToMeshArray
member.summary: Call this method to get a array of meshes, all primitives will get meshed and the meshes will get included in the returned array.
member.returns: Return an array of meshes from this list, this will convert all primitives to meshes.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.RenderPrimitiveList.ToMaterialArray
member.summary: Call this method to see if there are any RenderMaterials associated with the meshes. Each primitive can optionally have a RenderMaterial associated with it, if the RenderMaterial is null then check for a RhinoObject.RenderMaterial.
member.returns: Return an array that of the same size as the ToMeshArray() containing the RenderMaterial associated with the mesh, may contain null entries if there is no RenderMaterial associated with the custom mesh.

member.summary: Default constructor

member.summary: The name of the provider for UI display.

member.summary: Determines if custom render meshes will be built for a particular object.
member.param: The viewport being rendered.
The Rhino object of interest. This can be null in the case where document meshes (not associated with any object) are being requested.
UUID of the RDK plug-in requesting the meshes.
Type of mesh to build.
member.returns: true if custom meshes will be built.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.CustomRenderMeshProvider.RegisterProviders(System.Reflection.Assembly,System.Guid)
member.summary: Call this method once from your plug-ins OnLoad override for each assembly containing a custom mesh provider. Only publicly exported classes derived from CustomRenderMeshProvider with a public constructor that has no parameters will get registered.
member.param: Assembly to search for valid CustomRenderMeshProvider derived classes.
The plug-in that owns the custom mesh providers.

member.summary: UV mapping.

member.name: T:Rhino.Render.Decal
member.summary: Represents a decal, or a picture that can be moved on an object.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.Decal.CRC
member.summary: The decal CRC identifies a decal by its state. Multiple decals which would be exactly the same would have the same CRC and are culled from the system. If you store this value with the intention of using it to find the decal again later, you must update your stored value whenever the decal state changes. You can detect when a decal changes by watching for the OnUserDataTransformed event.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.Decal.TextureInstanceId
member.summary: Gets the texture ID for this decal.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.Decal.DecalMapping
member.summary: Gets the mapping of the decal.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.Decal.DecalProjection
member.summary: Gets the decal's projection. Used only when mapping is planar.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.Decal.MapToInside
member.summary: Used only when mapping is cylindrical or spherical.
member.value: true if texture is mapped to inside of sphere or cylinder, else \e false.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.Decal.Transparency
member.summary: Gets the decal's transparency in the range 0 to 1.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.Decal.Origin
member.summary: Gets the origin of the decal in world space.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.Decal.VectorUp
member.summary: For cylindrical and spherical mapping, the vector is unitized.
member.returns: The 'up' vector of the decal. For planar mapping the length of the vector is relevant.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.Decal.VectorAcross
member.summary: Gets the vector across. For cylindrical and spherical mapping, the vector is unitized.
member.value: The 'across' vector of the decal. For planar mapping the length of the vector is relevant.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.Decal.Height
member.summary: Gets the height of the decal. Only used when mapping is cylindrical.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.Decal.Radius
member.summary: Gets the radius of the decal. Only used when mapping is cylindrical or spherical.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.Decal.StartLatitude
member.summary: Gets the start angle of the decal's arc of latitude or 'horizontal sweep'. This is actually a LONGITUDINAL angle. Only used when mapping is cylindrical or spherical.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.Decal.EndLatitude
member.summary: Gets the end angle of the decal's arc of latitude or 'horizontal sweep'. This is actually a LONGITUDINAL angle. Only used when mapping is cylindrical or spherical.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.Decal.StartLongitude
member.summary: Gets the start angle of the decal's arc of longitude or 'vertical sweep'. This is actually a LATITUDINAL angle. Only used when mapping is spherical.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.Decal.EndLongitude
member.summary: Gets the end angle of the decal's arc of longitude or 'vertical sweep'. This is actually a LATITUDINAL angle. Only used when mapping is spherical.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.Decal.UVBounds(System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: The UV bounds of the decal. Only used when mapping is UV.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.Decal.CustomData
member.summary: Gets custom data associated with this decal - see Rhino.Plugins.RenderPlugIn.ShowDecalProperties.
member.returns: The return value can be null if there is no data associated with this decal.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.Decal.TryGetColor(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,Rhino.Geometry.Vector3d,Rhino.Display.Color4f@,Rhino.Geometry.Point2d@)
member.summary: Blend color with the decal color at a given point.
member.param: The point in space or, if the decal is uv-mapped, the uv-coordinate of that point.
The face normal of the given point.
The color to blend the decal color to.
the UV on the texture that the color point was read from.
member.returns: true if the given point hits the decal, else false.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.CurrentEnvironmentImpl.ForBackground
member.summary:
Get or set the RenderEnvironment used as 360deg background.
Null will be returned if the background environment isn't on.
To unset current background environment pass in null. Setting to a valid environment will also turn the environment for this specific usage on.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.CurrentEnvironmentImpl.ForLighting
member.summary:
Get or set the RenderEnvironment used as custom skylight environment.
Null will be returned if the custom environment isn't on.
To unset current custom environment pass in null. Setting to a valid environment will also turn the environment for this specific usage on.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.CurrentEnvironmentImpl.ForReflectionAndRefraction
member.summary:
Get or set the RenderEnvironment used as custom reflection and refraction environment.
Null will be returned if the custom environment isn't on.
To unset current custom environment pass in null. Setting to a valid environment will also turn the environment for this specific usage on.

member.name: P:Rhino.Render.CurrentEnvironmentImpl.ForAnyUsage
member.summary: Set given RenderEnvironment for all usage forms (background/360deg, custom reflection and refraction, custom skylight). Give null to disable all environments

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.LightManagerSupport.SetLightSolo(Rhino.RhinoDoc,System.Guid,System.Boolean)
member.summary: First checks to see if we are in "solo mode" - which means that there are any lights that respond "true" to IsInSoloStorage. If in solo mode: If bSolo = true Sets this light on. If bSolo = false If this is the last light "on", forces all lights out of solo mode. If there are other lights on, turns this light off. If not in solo mode: If bSolo = true Forces all lights into solo storage and sets this light on. If bSolo = false This shouldn't happen. Will cause an ASSERT
member.returns: Returns true if action is successful

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.LightManagerSupport.GetLightSolo(Rhino.RhinoDoc,System.Guid)
member.summary: Returns the value of "ON_LIght::m_bOn" if the light is in solo storage, or false if not in solo storage (ie - this is the checkbox state on the light manager dialog)
member.returns: Returns true if the light is in solo storage, or false if not in solo storage

member.summary: Returns the number of lights in solo storage - any number other than 0 means "in solo mode"

member.name: T:Rhino.Render.RealtimeDisplayMode
member.summary:
Base class for implementing real-time display modes in .NET.
Pay special attention that in StartRenderer the RenderWindow.SetSize() function is called if the implementation relies on the RenderWindow to do the drawing to the viewport. If i.e. OpenGL is used to draw render results to the viewport then SetSize() doesn't have to be called, nor should the implementation then access channels on the RenderWindow, as those then don't exist. For OpenGL-based drawing the RenderWindow is used as a container for ViewInfo management, nothing else.

member.name: M:Rhino.Render.RealtimeDisplayMode.PostConstruct
member.summary:
Override PostConstruct if you need to initialize where the underlying RealtimeDisplayMode is available.
The connection is made right after RealtimeDisplayMode has been instantiated, but just before PostConstruct is called.
For instance finding out OpenGL information can be done in PostConstruct.

Pixel buffer to hold a pointer to (unmanaged) pixel data.
This class will be in the (near) future improved to help with management of buffers between unmanaged and managed code. For C++ this could be the use of std::shared_ptr<>. See http://phab.mcneel.com/D12 for discussion on this topic.

Array of Color4f values used to set the RenderWindow.StandardChannels.RGBA
