member.summary: Call this method to open the RenderWindow.StandardChannels.RGBA channel and set a block of color values
member.param: rectangle.X is the horizontal pixel position of the left edge. No validation is done on this value. The caller is responsible for ensuring that it is within the frame buffer. rectangle.Y is the vertical pixel position of the top edge. No validation is done on this value. The caller is responsible for ensuring that it is within the frame buffer. rectangle.Width is the width of the rectangle in pixels. No validation is done on this value. rectangle.Height is the height of the rectangle in pixels. No validation is done on this value.
Array of Color4f values used to set the RenderWindow.StandardChannels.RGBA

member.name: T:Rhino.Input.StringParser
member.summary: Parse strings to numbers, distances and angles

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.StringParser.ParseLengthExpession(System.String,Rhino.Input.StringParserSettings,Rhino.UnitSystem,System.Double@)
member.summary: Parse a string for a length value. Expression can include complex expressions Simplest version of Length parsing
member.param: [In] The string to parse
[In] Determines what input will be parsed
[In] Output value is in this unit system
[Out] The length value result
member.returns: Count of characters parsed or 0 for failure

members.member:
Parse a string for a length value. Expression can include complex expressions Most complex version of length parsing
[In] The string to parse
[In] Offset position in string to start parsing
[In] Maximum length of string to parse. -1 means parse to a terminating character or end of string
[In] Determines what input will be parsed If trig functions are included in the expression, the angle unit system must be set correctly
[In] Output value is returned in this unit system
[Out] The length value result
[Out] Describes the results of the parse operation
[Out] If a unit system name was found in the string, it is returned here. The output value is in the unit system specified in output_unit_system
Returns the count of characters that were parsed or 0 if the operation was unsuccesful

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.StringParser.ParseNumber(System.String,System.Int32,Rhino.Input.StringParserSettings,Rhino.Input.StringParserSettings@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Parse a string expression to get a number
member.param: String to parse
Maximum number of characters to parse
Determines what input will be parsed
Reports the results of the parse operation
The number result of the parse operation
member.returns: Count of characters in expression parsed if ParseNumber() returns 0, parse was unsuccesful

member.name: T:Rhino.Input.StringParserSettings
member.summary: Parameters for parsing strings

member.name: P:Rhino.Input.StringParserSettings.DefaultParseSettings
member.summary: - The default settings parse just about everything in a reasonable way. - Any angle values with unspecified units will be treated as radians. Angles without units can be encountered while parsing formulas, lengths and points and need to be thoughtfully considered in most parsing situations.

member.name: P:Rhino.Input.StringParserSettings.ParseSettingsRadians
member.summary: - The default settings parse just about everything in a reasonable way. - Any angle values with unspecified units will be treated as radians.Angles without units can be encountered while parsing formulas, lengths and points and need to be thoughtfully considered in most parsing situations.

member.name: P:Rhino.Input.StringParserSettings.ParseSettingsDegrees
member.summary: - The default settings parse just about everything in a reasonable way. - Any angle values with unspecified units will be treated as degrees.Angles without units can be encountered while parsing formulas, lengths and points and need to be thoughtfully considered in most parsing situations.

member.name: P:Rhino.Input.StringParserSettings.ParseSettingsIntegerNumber
member.summary: - The integer settings parse and optional unary + or unary - and then parses one or more digits.Parsing stops after the last digit.

member.name: P:Rhino.Input.StringParserSettings.ParseSettingsRationalNumber
member.summary: - The rational number settings parse and optional unary + or unary - and then parse one or more digits.If a rational number fraction bar follows the last digit in the numerator, then it is parsed and an integer denominator is parsed.The denominator cannot have a unary + or - preceding the digits.Parsing stops after the last digit in the denominator.

member.name: P:Rhino.Input.StringParserSettings.ParseSettingsDoubleNumber
member.summary: - The double number settings parse and optional unary + or unary - and then parse a number that can be integer, decimal, or scientific e notation.

member.name: P:Rhino.Input.StringParserSettings.ParseSettingsRealNumber
member.summary: - The real number settings parse and optional unary + or unary - and then parse a number that can be integer, decimal, scientific e notation or pi.

member.name: P:Rhino.Input.StringParserSettings.ParseSettingsEmpty
member.summary: - ON_ParseSetting::FalseSettings has all parsing options set to false. - A common use of ON_ParseSettings FalseSettings is to intialize ON_ParseSettings classes that are used to report what happened during parsing.Any parsing results value set to true after parsing indicates that type of parsing occured.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetArc.Finalize
member.summary: Passively reclaims unmanaged resources when the class user did not explicitly call Dispose().

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetArc.Dispose
member.summary: Actively reclaims unmanaged resources that this instance uses.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetArc.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
For derived class implementers.
This method is called with argument true when class user calls Dispose(), while with argument false when the Garbage Collector invokes the finalizer, or Finalize() method.
You must reclaim all used unmanaged resources in both cases, and can use this chance to call Dispose on disposable fields if the argument is true.
Also, you must call the base virtual method within your overriding method.
member.param: true if the call comes from the Dispose() method; false if it comes from the Garbage Collector finalizer.

member.summary: Fast test to check if a bounding box intersects a pick frustum.

member.summary: Utility for picking 3d point
member.param: depth returned here for point picks. LARGER values are NEARER to the camera. SMALLER values are FARTHER from the camera.
planar distance returned here for point picks. SMALLER values are CLOSER to the pick point
member.returns: true if there is a hit

mode used for pick test
location returned here for point picks
If the mesh has surface parameters, set to the surface parameters of the hit point

If the mesh has texture coordinates, set to the texture coordinate of the hit point. Note that the texture coodinates can be set in many different ways and this information is useless unless you know how the texture coordinates are set on this particular mesh.
depth returned here for point picks LARGER values are NEARER to the camera. SMALLER values are FARTHER from the camera.
planar distance returned here for point picks. SMALLER values are CLOSER to the pick point
For point picks, How to interpret the hitIndex (vertex hit, edge hit, or face hit)
index of vertex/edge/face that was hit. Use hitFlag to determine what this index corresponds to

member.name: T:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject
member.summary: The GetObject class is the tool commands use to interactively select objects.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.ActiveGetObject(Rhino.RhinoDoc)
member.summary: Get the currently running GetObject for a given document

member.name: P:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.GeometryFilter
member.summary: The geometry type filter controls which types of geometry (points, curves, surfaces, meshes, etc.) can be selected. The default geometry type filter permits selection of all types of geometry. NOTE: the filter can be a bitwise combination of multiple ObjectTypes.

member.name: P:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.GeometryAttributeFilter
member.summary: The geometry attribute filter provides a secondary filter that can be used to restrict which objects can be selected. Control of the type of geometry (points, curves, surfaces, meshes, etc.) is provided by GetObject.SetGeometryFilter. The geometry attribute filter is used to require the selected geometry to have certain attributes (open, closed, etc.). The default attribute filter permits selection of all types of geometry.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.CustomGeometryFilter(Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject,Rhino.Geometry.GeometryBase,Rhino.Geometry.ComponentIndex)
member.summary: Checks geometry to see if it can be selected. Override to provide fancy filtering.
member.param: parent object being considered.
geometry being considered.
if >= 0, geometry is a proper sub-part of object->Geometry() with componentIndex.
member.returns: The default returns true unless you've set a custom geometry filter. If a custom filter has been set, that delegate is called.
member.remarks: The delegate should not throw exceptions. If an exception is thrown, a message box will show and the filter will be disabled.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.SetCustomGeometryFilter(Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObjectGeometryFilter)
member.summary: Set filter callback function that will be called by the CustomGeometryFilter

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.PassesGeometryAttributeFilter(Rhino.DocObjects.RhinoObject,Rhino.Geometry.GeometryBase,Rhino.Geometry.ComponentIndex)
member.summary: Checks geometry to see if it passes the basic GeometryAttributeFilter.
member.param: parent object being considered.
geometry being considered.
if >= 0, geometry is a proper sub-part of object->Geometry() with componentIndex.
member.returns: true if the geometry passes the filter returned by GeometryAttributeFilter().

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.EnablePreSelect(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Control the pre selection behavior GetObjects.
member.param: if true, pre-selection is enabled.
If true and some acceptable objects are pre-selected, then any unacceptable pre-selected objects are ignored. If false and any unacceptable are pre-selected, then the user is forced to post-select.
member.remarks: By default, if valid input is pre-selected when GetObjects() is called, then that input is returned and the user is not given the opportunity to post-select. If you want to force the user to post-select, then call EnablePreSelect(false).

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.EnablePostSelect(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Control the availability of post selection in GetObjects.
member.remarks: By default, if no valid input is pre-selected when GetObjects is called, then the user is given the chance to post select. If you want to force the user to pre-select, then call EnablePostSelect(false).

member.name: P:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.DeselectAllBeforePostSelect
member.summary: true if pre-selected input will be deselected before post-selection begins when no pre-selected input is valid.

member.name: P:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.OneByOnePostSelect
member.summary: In one-by-one post selection, the user is forced to select objects by post picking them one at a time.

member.name: P:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.SubObjectSelect
member.summary: By default, GetObject.Input will permit a user to select sub-objects (like a curve in a b-rep or a curve in a group). If you only want the user to select "top" level objects, then call EnableSubObjectSelect = false.

member.name: P:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.ChooseOneQuestion
member.summary: By default, if a call to Input is permitted to select different parts of the same object, like a polysurface and an edge of that polysurface, then the top-most object is automatically selected. If you want the choose-one-object mechanism to include pop up in these cases, then call EnableChooseOneQuestion = true before calling GetObjects().

member.name: P:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.BottomObjectPreference
member.summary: By default, if a call to Input is permitted to select different parts of the same object, like a polysurface, a surface and an edge, then the top-most object is prefered. (polysurface beats face beats edge). If you want the bottom most object to be prefered, then call EnableBottomObjectPreference = true before calling GetObjects().

member.name: P:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.GroupSelect
member.summary: By default, groups are ignored in GetObject. If you want your call to GetObjects() to select every object in a group that has any objects selected, then enable group selection.

member.name: P:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.InactiveDetailPickEnabled
member.summary: By default, objects in inactive details are not permitted to be picked. In a few rare cases this is used (ex. picking circles during DimRadius)

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.EnableSelPrevious(System.Boolean)
member.summary: By default, any object selected during a command becomes part of the "previous selection set" and can be reselected by the SelPrev command. If you need to select objects but do not want them to be selected by a subsquent call to SelPrev, then call EnableSelPrev = false.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.EnableHighlight(System.Boolean)
member.summary: By default, any object post-pick selected by GetObjects() is highlighted. If you want to post-pick objects and not have them automatically highlight, then call EnableHighlight = false.

member.name: P:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.ReferenceObjectSelect
member.summary: By default, reference objects can be selected. If you do not want to be able to select reference objects, then call EnableReferenceObjectSelect=false.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.EnableIgnoreGrips(System.Boolean)
member.summary: By default, post selection will select objects with grips on. If you do not want to be able to post select objects with grips on, then call EnableIgnoreGrips = false. The ability to preselect an object with grips on is determined by the value returned by the virtual RhinoObject.IsSelectableWithGripsOn.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.EnablePressEnterWhenDonePrompt(System.Boolean)
member.summary: By default, when GetObject.GetObjects is called with minimumNumber > 0 and maximumNumber = 0, the command prompt automatically includes "Press Enter when done" after the user has selected at least minimumNumber of objects. If you want to prohibit the addition of the "Press Enter when done", then call EnablePressEnterWhenDonePrompt = false;

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.SetPressEnterWhenDonePrompt(System.String)
member.summary: The default prompt when EnablePressEnterWhenDonePrompt is enabled is "Press Enter when done". Use this function to specify a different string to be appended.
member.param: The text that will be displayed just after the prompt, after the selection has been made.

member.name: P:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.AlreadySelectedObjectSelect
member.summary: Allow selecting objects that are already selected. By default, GetObjects() disallows selection of objects that are already selected to avoid putting the same object in the selection set more than once. Calling EnableAlreadySelectedObjectSelect = true overrides that restriction and allows selected objects to be selected and returned by GetObjects. This is useful because, coupled with the return immediately mode of GetObjects(1, -1), it is possible to select a selected object to deselect when the selected objects are being managed outside GetObjects() as in the case of CRhinoPolyEdge::GetEdge().

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.Get
member.summary: Call to select a single object.
member.returns: Success - objects selected. Cancel - user pressed ESCAPE to cancel the get. See GetResults for other possible values that may be returned when options, numbers, etc., are acceptable responses.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.GetMultiple(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Call to select objects.
member.param: minimum number of objects to select.

maximum number of objects to select. If 0, then the user must press enter to finish object selection. If -1, then object selection stops as soon as there are at least minimumNumber of object selected. If >0, then the picking stops when there are maximumNumber objects. If a window pick, crossing pick, or Sel* command attempts to add more than maximumNumber, then the attempt is ignored.
member.returns: Success - objects selected. Cancel - user pressed ESCAPE to cancel the get. See GetResults for other possible values that may be returned when options, numbers, etc., are acceptable responses.

member.name: P:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.ObjectCount
member.summary: Gets the number of objects that were selected.

member.name: P:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.SerialNumber
member.summary: Each instance of GetObject has a unique runtime serial number that is used to identify object selection events associated with that instance.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.EnableClearObjectsOnEntry(System.Boolean)
member.summary: By default the picked object list is cleared when GetObject.GetObjects() is called. If you are reusing a GetObject class and do not want the existing object list cleared when you call Input, then call EnableClearObjectsOnEntry(false) before calling GetObjects().
member.param: The state to set.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.EnableUnselectObjectsOnExit(System.Boolean)
member.summary: By default any objects in the object list are unselected when GetObject.GetObjects() exits with any return code besides Object. If you want to leave the objects selected when non-object input is returned, then call EnableUnselectObjectsOnExit(false) before calling GetObjects().
member.param: The state to set.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject.ClearObjects
member.summary: Clear possible special object drawing

member.name: T:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter
member.summary: If an object passes the geometry TYPE filter, then the geometry ATTRIBUTE filter is applied.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.WireCurve
member.summary: 3d wire curve If you want to accept only wire or edge curves, then specify wire_curve or edge_curve, otherwise both wire and edge curves will pass the attribute filter.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.EdgeCurve
member.summary: 3d curve of a surface edge If you want to accept only wire or edge curves, then specify wire_curve or edge_curve, otherwise both wire and edge curves will pass the attribute filter.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.ClosedCurve
member.summary: Closed Curves and Edges are acceptable If you want to accept only closed or open curves, then specify either closed_curve or open_curve. Otherwise both closed and open curves will pass the attribute filter.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.OpenCurve
member.summary: Open Curves and Edges are acceptable If you want to accept only closed or open curves, then specify either closed_curve or open_curve. Otherwise both closed and open curves will pass the attribute filter.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.SeamEdge
member.summary:
seam edges are acceptable attributes of acceptable trimming edge objects (associated with an ON_BrepTrim).
If none of these attributes are explicitly specified, then any kind of trimming edge will pass the attribute filter.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.ManifoldEdge
member.summary:
edges with 2 different surfaces pass attributes of acceptable trimming edge objects (associated with an ON_BrepTrim).
If none of these attributes are explicitly specified, then any kind of trimming edge will pass the attribute filter.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.NonmanifoldEdge
member.summary:
edges with 3 or more surfaces pass attributes of acceptable trimming edge objects (associated with an ON_BrepTrim).
If none of these attributes are explicitly specified, then any kind of trimming edge will pass the attribute filter.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.MatedEdge
member.summary:
any mated edge passes attributes of acceptable trimming edge objects (associated with an ON_BrepTrim).
If none of these attributes are explicitly specified, then any kind of trimming edge will pass the attribute filter.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.SurfaceBoundaryEdge
member.summary:
boundary edges on surface sides pass attributes of acceptable trimming edge objects (associated with an ON_BrepTrim).
If none of these attributes are explicitly specified, then any kind of trimming edge will pass the attribute filter.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.TrimmingBoundaryEdge
member.summary:
boundary edges that trim a surface pass attributes of acceptable trimming edge objects (associated with an ON_BrepTrim).
If none of these attributes are explicitly specified, then any kind of trimming edge will pass the attribute filter.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.BoundaryEdge
member.summary:
ant boundary edge passes attributes of acceptable trimming edge objects (associated with an ON_BrepTrim).
If none of these attributes are explicitly specified, then any kind of trimming edge will pass the attribute filter.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.ClosedSurface
member.summary: If you want to accept only closed or open surfaces, then specify either closed_surface or open_surface. Otherwise both closed and open surfaces will pass the attribute filter.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.OpenSurface
member.summary: If you want to accept only closed or open surfaces, then specify either closed_surface or open_surface. Otherwise both closed and open surfaces will pass the attribute filter.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.TrimmedSurface
member.summary: If you want to accept only trimmed or untrimmed surfaces, then specify either trimmed_surface or untrimmed_surface. Otherwise both trimmed and untrimmed surfaces will pass the attribute filter.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.UntrimmedSurface
member.summary: If you want to accept only trimmed or untrimmed surfaces, then specify either trimmed_surface or untrimmed_surface. Otherwise both trimmed and untrimmed surfaces will pass the attribute filter.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.SubSurface
member.summary: If you want to accept only sub-surfaces of (multi-surface) polysrf, then specify sub_surface. If you do not want to accept sub-surfaces, then specify top_surface. Otherwise sub-surfaces and top surfaces will pass the attribute filter.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.TopSurface
member.summary: If you want to accept only sub-surfaces of (multi-surface) polysrf, then specify sub_surface. If you do not want to accept sub-surfaces, then specify top_surface. Otherwise sub-surfaces and top surfaces will pass the attribute filter.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.ManifoldPolysrf
member.summary: If you want to accept only manifold or nonmanifold polysrfs, then specify manifold_polysrf or nonmanifold_polysrf. Otherwise both manifold and nonmanifold polysrfs will pass the attribute filter.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.NonmanifoldPolysrf
member.summary: If you want to accept only manifold or nonmanifold polysrfs, then specify manifold_polysrf or nonmanifold_polysrf. Otherwise both manifold and nonmanifold polysrfs will pass the attribute filter.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.ClosedPolysrf
member.summary: If you want to accept only closed or open polysrfs, then specify either closed_polysrf or open_polysrf. Otherwise both closed and open polysrfs will pass the attribute filter.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.OpenPolysrf
member.summary: If you want to accept only closed or open polysrfs, then specify either closed_polysrf or open_polysrf. Otherwise both closed and open polysrfs will pass the attribute filter.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.ClosedMesh
member.summary: If you want to accept only closed or open meshs, then specify either closed_mesh or open_mesh. Otherwise both closed and open meshs will pass the attribute filter.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.OpenMesh
member.summary: If you want to accept only closed or open meshs, then specify either closed_mesh or open_mesh. Otherwise both closed and open meshs will pass the attribute filter.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.BoundaryInnerLoop
member.summary: all trimming edges are boundary edges.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.MatedInnerLoop
member.summary: all trimming edges are mated.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.InnerLoop
member.summary: any inner loop is acceptable.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.BoundaryOuterLoop
member.summary: all trimming edges are boundary edges.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.MatedOuterLoop
member.summary: all trimming edges are mated.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.OuterLoop
member.summary: any outer loop is acceptable.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.Custom.GeometryAttributeFilter.SpecialLoop
member.summary: slit, crvonsrf, ptonsrf, etc.

member.name: T:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint
member.summary: Used to interactively get a point.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.#ctor
member.summary: Create a new GetPoint.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.SetBasePoint(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets a base point used by ortho snap, from snap, planar snap, etc.
member.param: The new base point.
If true, then the distance from base_point to the current point will be in the status bar distance pane.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.ConstrainDistanceFromBasePoint(System.Double)
member.summary: Sets distance constraint from base point.
member.param: pass UnsetValue to clear this constraint. Pass 0.0 to disable the ability to set this constraint by typing a number during GetPoint.
member.remarks: If the base point is set and the distance from base point constraint is > 0, then the picked point is constrained to be this distance from the base point.

member.name: P:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.DynamicDrawColor
member.summary: Color used by CRhinoGetPoint::DynamicDraw to draw the current point and the line from the base point to the current point.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.SetCursor(Rhino.UI.CursorStyle)
member.summary: Sets cursor that will be used when Get() is called and snap is not happening.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.EnableObjectSnapCursors(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables or disables object snap cursors. By default, object snap cursors are enabled.
member.param: If true then object snap cursors (plus sign with "near", "end", etc.) are used when the point snaps to a object.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.DrawLineFromPoint(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Use DrawLineFromPoint() if you want a dynamic line drawn from a point to the point being picked.
member.param: The line is drawn from startPoint to the point being picked. If the base point has not been set, then it is set to startPoint.
if true, the distance from the basePoint to the point begin picked is shown in the status bar.
member.remarks: Calling DrawLineFromPoint automatically enables drawing the line. Use EnableDrawLineFromPoint() to toggle the line drawing state.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.EnableDrawLineFromPoint(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Controls drawing of dynamic a line from the start point.
member.param: if true, a dynamic line is drawn from the DrawLineFromPoint startPoint to the point being picked.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.EnableNoRedrawOnExit(System.Boolean)
member.summary: The default functionality of the getpoint operation is to perform a redraw on exit. Calling this function with true turns off automatic redraw at the end of GetPoint. May be needed in some commands for flicker free feedback. When set to true, the caller is responsible for cleaning up the screen after GetPoint.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.PermitOrthoSnap(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Controls availability of ortho snap. Default is true.
member.param: if true, then GetPoint pays attention to the Rhino "ortho snap" and "planar snap" settings reported by ModelAidSettings.Ortho and ModelAidSettings.Planar.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.PermitFromOption(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Control the availability of the built-in "From" option. By default, the "From" option is enabled.
member.param: if true, then the "From" option is automatically avaiable in GetPoint.
member.remarks: The GetPoint "From" option is never visible on the command line and the user must type the complete option name to activate the "From" option. When the GetPoint "From" snap is enabled, the user set/change the base point during GetPoint by typing "From" and picking a point. A related option is the builit-in distance from base point constraint that is can be set before GetPoint is called by passing a value to GetPoint::ConstrainDistanceFromBasePoint or during GetPoint by entering a number.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.PermitConstraintOptions(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Control the availability of the built-in linear, planar, curve, and surface constraint options like "Along", "AlongPerp", "AlongTan", "AlongParallel", "Between", "OnCrv", "OnSrf", ".x", ".y", ".z", ".xy", etc.
member.param: if true, then the built-in contraint options are automatically avaiable in GetPoint.
member.remarks: By default, these built-in constraint options are availble unless an explicit constraint is added by calling one of the GetPoint::Constrain functions. Calling GetPoint::ClearConstraints automatically enables the built-in constraint options. The built-in constraint options are never visible on the command line and the user must type the complete option name to activate these options.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.PermitTabMode(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Permits the use of the tab key to define a line constraint.
member.param: If true, then the built-in tab key mode is available.
member.remarks: By default, use of the tab key is supported.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.PermitElevatorMode(System.Int32)
member.summary: Permits the use of the control key to define a line constraint.
member.param: 0: no elevator modes are permitted 1: fixed plane elevator mode (like the Line command) 2: cplane elevator mode (like object dragging)

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.PermitObjectSnap(System.Boolean)
member.summary: By default, object snaps like "end", "near", etc. are controled by the user. If you want to disable this ability, then call PermitObjectSnap(false).
member.param: true to permit snapping to objects.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.AddSnapPoint(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d)
member.summary: Adds a point to the list of osnap points.
member.param: A point.
member.returns: Total number of snap points.
member.remarks: When point osnap is enabled, GetPoint will snap to points in the Rhino model. If you want the user to be able to snap to additional points, then use GetPoint::AddSnapPoints to specify the locations of these additional points.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.AddSnapPoints(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d[])
member.summary: Adds points to the list of osnap points.
member.param: An array of points to snap onto.
member.returns: Total number of snap points.
member.remarks: When point osnap is enabled, GetPoint will snap to points in the Rhino model. If you want the user to be able to snap to additional points, then use GetPoint::AddSnapPoints to specify the locations of these additional points.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.AddConstructionPoint(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d)
member.summary: Adds a point to the list of construction points.
member.param: A point to be added.
member.returns: Total number of construction points.
member.remarks: Construction points are like snap points except that they get snapped to even when point osnap is off. Typically, there are only a few construction points while there can be many snap points. For example, when polylines are drawn the start point is a construction point and the other points are snap points.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.AddConstructionPoints(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d[])
member.summary: Adds points to the list of construction points.
member.param: An array of points to be added.
member.returns: Total number of construction points.
member.remarks: Construction points are like snap points except that they get snapped to even when point osnap is off. Typically, there are only a few construction points while there can be many snap points. For example, when polylines are drawn the start point is a construction point and the other points are snap points.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.ClearSnapPoints
member.summary: Remove all snap points.
member.remarks: When point osnap is enabled, GetPoint will snap to points in the Rhino model. If you want the user to be able to snap to additional points, then use GetPoint::AddSnapPoints tp specify the locations of these additional points.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.ClearConstructionPoints
member.summary: Remove all construction points.
member.remarks: Construction points are like snap points except that they get snapped to even when point osnap is off. Typically, there are only a few construction points while there can be many snap points. For example, when polylines are drawn the start point is a construction point and the other points are snap points.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.GetSnapPoints
member.summary: Gets current snap points.
member.returns: An array of points.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.GetConstructionPoints
member.summary: Gets current construction points.
member.returns: An array of points.
member.remarks: Construction points are like snap points except that they get snapped to even when point osnap is off. Typically, there are only a few construction points while there can be many snap points. For example, when polylines are drawn the start point is a construction point and the other points are snap points.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.EnableCurveSnapTangentBar(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Controls display of the curve snap tangent bar icon.
member.param: true to draw a tangent bar icon whenever GetPoint snaps to a curve.
true to draw points at the end of the tangent bar.
member.remarks: The tangent bar is drawn by GetPoint::DynamicDraw. If you override GetPoint::DynamicDraw, then you must call the base class function.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.EnableCurveSnapPerpBar(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Controls display of the curve snap perpendicular bar icon.
member.param: true to draw a tangent bar icon whenever GetPoint snaps to a curve.
true to draw points at the end of the tangent bar.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.EnableCurveSnapArrow(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Controls display of the curve snap arrow icon.
member.param: true to draw arrow icon whenever GetPoint snaps to a curve.
true if arrow icon direction should be the reverse of the first derivative direction.
member.remarks: The tangent bar is drawn by GetPoint::DynamicDraw. If you override GetPoint::DynamicDraw, then you must call the base class function.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.EnableSnapToCurves(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If you want GetPoint() to try to snap to curves when the mouse is near a curve (like the center point in the Circle command when the AroundCurve option is on), then enable the snap to curves option.
member.param: Whether points should be enabled.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.Constrain(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,Rhino.Geometry.Point3d)
member.summary: Constrains the picked point to lie on a line.
member.param: The start point of constraint.
The end point of constraint.
member.returns: true if constraint could be applied.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.Constrain(Rhino.Geometry.Line)
member.summary: Constrains the picked point to lie on a line.
member.param: A line to use as constraint.
member.returns: true if constraint could be applied.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.Constrain(Rhino.Geometry.Arc)
member.summary: Constrains the picked point to lie on an arc.
member.param: An arc to use as constraint.
member.returns: true if constraint could be applied.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.Constrain(Rhino.Geometry.Circle)
member.summary: Constrains the picked point to lie on a circle.
member.param: A circle to use as constraint.
member.returns: true if constraint could be applied.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.Constrain(Rhino.Geometry.Plane,System.Boolean)
member.summary: constrain the picked point to lie on a plane.
member.param: A plane to use as constraint.
true if elevator mode should be allowed at user request.
member.returns: true if constraint could be applied.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.Constrain(Rhino.Geometry.Sphere)
member.summary: Constrains the picked point to lie on a sphere.
member.param: A sphere to use as constraint.
member.returns: true if constraint could be applied.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.Constrain(Rhino.Geometry.Cylinder)
member.summary: Constrains the picked point to lie on a cylinder.
member.param: A cylinder to use as constraint.
member.returns: true if constraint could be applied.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.Constrain(Rhino.Geometry.Curve,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constrains the picked point to lie on a curve.
member.param: A curve to use as constraint.

defines whether the point pick is allowed to happen off object. When false, a "no no" cursor is shown when the cursor is not on the object. When true, a normal point picking cursor is used and the marker is visible also when the cursor is not on the object.
member.returns: true if constraint could be applied.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.Constrain(Rhino.Geometry.Surface,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constrains the picked point to lie on a surface.
member.param: A surface to use as constraint.

defines whether the point pick is allowed to happen off object. When false, a "no no" cursor is shown when the cursor is not on the object. When true, a normal point picking cursor is used and the marker is visible also when the cursor is not on the object.
member.returns: true if constraint could be applied.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.Constrain(Rhino.Geometry.Brep,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constrains the picked point to lie on a brep.
member.param: A brep to use as constraint.
When wire_density<0, isocurve intersection snapping is turned off, when wire_density>=0, the value defines the isocurve density used for isocurve intersection snapping.
When face_index <0, constrain to whole brep. When face_index >=0, constrain to individual face.

defines whether the point pick is allowed to happen off object. When false, a "no no" cursor is shown when the cursor is not on the object. When true, a normal point picking cursor is used and the marker is visible also when the cursor is not on the object.
member.returns: true if constraint could be applied.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.Constrain(Rhino.Geometry.Mesh,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constrains the picked point to lie on a mesh.
member.param: A mesh to use as constraint.

defines whether the point pick is allowed to happen off object. When false, a "no no" cursor is shown when the cursor is not on the object. When true, a normal point picking cursor is used and the marker is visible also when the cursor is not on the object.
member.returns: true if constraint could be applied.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.ConstrainToConstructionPlane(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If enabled, the picked point is constrained to be on the active construction plane. If the base point is set, then the point is constrained to be on the plane that contains the base point and is parallel to the active construction plane. By default this constraint is enabled.
member.param: true if the base point should be used as compulsory level reference.
member.returns: If true and the base point is set, then the point is constrained to be on the plane parallel to the construction plane that passes through the base point, even when planar mode is off. If throughBasePoint is false, then the base point shift only happens if planar mode is on.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.ConstrainToTargetPlane
member.summary: Constrains point to lie on a plane that is parallel to the viewing plane and passes through the view's target point.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.ConstrainToVirtualCPlaneIntersection(Rhino.Geometry.Plane)
member.summary: If enabled, the picked point is constrained to be on the intersection of the plane and the virtual CPlane going through the plane origin. If the planes are parallel, the constraint works just like planar constraint.
member.param: The plane used for the plane - virtual CPlane intersection.
member.returns: true if the operation succeeded; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.ClearConstraints
member.summary: Removes any explicit constraints added by calls to GetPoint::Constraint() and enable the built-in constraint options.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.InterruptMouseMove
member.summary: If you have lengthy computations in OnMouseMove() and/or DymanicDraw() overrides, then periodically call InterruptMouseMove() to see if you should interrupt your work because the mouse has moved again.
member.returns: true if you should interrupt your work; false otherwise.

member.name: E:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.MouseMove
member.summary: Called every time the mouse moves. MouseMove is called once per mouse move and is called BEFORE any calls to OnDynamicDraw. If you are doing anything that takes a long time, periodically call InterruptMouseMove() to see if you should stop. If the view is such that the 2d screen point can't be mapped to a 3d point, the 'point' argument will be Unset.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.OnMouseMove(Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPointMouseEventArgs)
member.summary: Calls the event and can/should be called by overriding implementation.
member.param: Current argument for the event.

member.name: P:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.Tag
member.summary: Gets or sets an arbitrary object that can be attached to this instance. Useful for passing some/ information that you may need in a DynamicDraw event since you can get at this Tag from the GetPointDrawEventArgs.

member.name: E:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.MouseDown
member.summary: Called during Get2dRectangle, Get2dLine, and GetPoint(..,true) when the mouse down event for the initial point occurs. This function is not called during ordinary point getting because the mouse down event terminates an ordinary point get and returns a GetResult.Point result.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.OnMouseDown(Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPointMouseEventArgs)
member.summary: Default calls the MouseDown event.
member.param: Current argument for the event.

member.name: E:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.DynamicDraw
member.summary:
Event to use if you want to dynamically draw things as the mouse/digitizer moves. Every time the mouse moves, DynamicDraw will be called once per viewport. The calls to DynamicDraw happen AFTER the call to MouseMove.
If you are drawing anything that takes a long time, periodically call InterruptMouseMove() to see if you should stop.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.OnDynamicDraw(Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPointDrawEventArgs)
member.summary: Default calls the DynamicDraw event.
member.param: Current argument for the event.

member.name: P:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.FullFrameRedrawDuringGet
member.summary: In the "RARE" case that you need to draw some depth buffered geometry during a Get() operation, setting this value to true will force entire frames to be redrawn while the user moves the mouse. This allows DisplayPipeline events to be triggered as well as OnPostDrawObjects NOTE!! Setting this value to true comes with a significant performance penalty because the scene needs to be fully regenerated every frame where the standard DynamicDraw event draws temporary decorations (geometry) on top of a static scene.

member.name: E:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.PostDrawObjects
member.summary: Same as the DisplayPipeline.PostDrawObjects, but only works during the operation of the Get() function. NOTE: You must set FullFrameRedrawDuringGet to true in order for this event to be called.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.OnPostDrawObjects(Rhino.Display.DrawEventArgs)
member.summary: In the "rare" case that you need to draw some depth buffered geometry during a GetPoint operation, override the OnPostDrawObjects function. NOTE!! Overriding this function comes with a significant performance penalty because the scene needs to be fully regenerated every frame where the standard DynamicDraw event draws temporary decorations (geometry) on top of a static scene.
member.param: Current argument for the event.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.Get(System.Boolean)
member.summary: After setting up options and so on, call this method to get a 3d point.
member.param: If false, the point is returned when the left mouse button goes down. If true, the point is returned when the left mouse button goes up.
member.returns: if the user chose a point; other enumeration value otherwise.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.Get(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: After setting up options and so on, call this method to get a 2d or 3d point.
member.param: If false, the point is returned when the left mouse button goes down. If true, the point is returned when the left mouse button goes up.
If true then get a 2d point otherwise get a 2d point
member.returns: if the user chose a 3d point; if the user chose a 2d point; other enumeration value otherwise.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.Get
member.summary: After setting up options and so on, call GetPoint::Get to get a 3d point. The point is retrieved when the mouse goes down.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.PointOnObject
member.summary: Call this function to see if the point was on an object. If the point was on an object an ObjRef is returned; otherwise null is returned.
member.returns: A point object reference.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.PointOnCurve(System.Double@)
member.summary: Use to determine is point was on a curve.
member.param: If the point was on a curve, then the t is the curve parameter for the point. The point returned by Point() is the same as curve.PointAt(t).
member.returns: A curve at a specified parameter value.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.PointOnSurface(System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Use to determine if point was on a surface. If the point was on a surface, then the (u,v) are the surface parameters for the point. The point returned by Point() is the same as surface.PointAt(u,v).
member.param: If the point was on a surface, then the u parameter.
If the point was on a surface, then the v parameter.
member.returns: The surface or null if the point was not on a surface.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPoint.PointOnBrep(System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Use to determine if point was on a Brep face. If the point was on a Brep face, then the (u,v) are the face parameters for the point.
member.param: If the point was on a Brep face, then the u parameter.
If the point was on a Brep face, then the v parameter.
member.returns: The Brep face or null if the point was not on a Brep face.

member.name: T:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPointDrawEventArgs
member.summary: Arguments for drawing during point getting.

member.name: P:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPointDrawEventArgs.Source
member.summary: GetPoint class that this draw event originated from.

member.name: T:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetPointMouseEventArgs
member.summary: Arguments for mouse information during point getting.

member.name: T:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass
member.summary:
Base class for GetObject, GetPoint, GetSphere, etc.
You will never directly create a GetBaseClass but you will use its member functions after calling GetObject.Gets(), GetPoint.Get(), and so on.
Provides tools to set command prompt, set command options, and specify if the "get" can optionally accept numbers, nothing (pressing enter), and undo.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.SetCommandPrompt(System.String)
member.summary: Sets prompt message that appears in the command prompt window.
member.param: command prompt message.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.SetCommandPromptDefault(System.String)
member.summary: Sets message that describes what default value will be used if the user presses enter. This description appears in angle brackets <> in the command prompt window. You do not need to provide a default value description unless you explicity enable AcceptNothing.
member.param: description of default value.
member.remarks: If you have a simple default point, number, or string, it is easier to use SetDefaultPoint, SetDefaultNumber, or SetDefaultString. SetCommandPromptDefault and AcceptNothing can be used for providing more advanced UI behavior.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.SetDefaultPoint(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d)
member.summary: Sets a point as default value that will be returned if the user presses the ENTER key during the get.
member.param: value for default point.
member.remarks: Calling SetDefaultPoint will automatically handle setting the command prompt default and reacting to the user pressing ENTER. If the user presses enter to accept the default point, GetResult.Point is returned and RhinoGet.GotDefault() will return true. Calling SetDefaultPoint will clear any previous calls to SetDefaultString or SetDefaultNumber.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.ClearCommandOptions
member.summary: Clear all command options.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.EnableTransparentCommands(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Control the availability of transparent commands during the get.
member.param: If true, then transparent commands can be run during the get. If false, then transparent commands cannot be run during the get.
member.remarks: Some Rhino commands are "transparent" and can be run inside of other commands. Examples of transparent commands include the view manipulation commands like ZoomExtents, Top, etc., and the selection commands like SelAll, SelPoint, etc. By default transparent commands can be run during any get. If you want to disable this feature, then call EnableTransparentCommands(false) before calling GetString, GetPoint, GetObject, etc.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.AcceptNothing(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If you want to allow the user to be able to press enter in order to skip selecting a something in GetPoint.Get(), GetObject::GetObjects(), etc., then call AcceptNothing( true ) beforehand.
member.param: true if user is able to press enter in order to skip selecting.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.AcceptUndo(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If you want to allow the user to have an 'undo' option in GetPoint.Get(), GetObject.GetObjects(), etc., then call AcceptUndo(true) beforehand.
member.param: true if user is able to choose the 'Undo' option.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.AcceptEnterWhenDone(System.Boolean)
member.summary: There are instances of RhinoGet that prompt with "Press Enter when Done." yet do not call AcceptNothing(). On the Mac, these instances need an additional call to AcceptEnterWhenDone() so the GetPointOptions dialog can correctly enable the Done button.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.AcceptNumber(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: If you want to allow the user to be able to type in a number during GetPoint.Get(), GetObject::GetObjects(), etc., then call AcceptNumber() beforehand. If the user chooses to type in a number, then the result code GetResult.Number is returned and you can use RhinoGet.Number() to get the value of the number. If you are using GetPoint and you want "0" to return (0,0,0) instead of the number zero, then set acceptZero = false.
member.param: true if user is able to type a number.
If you are using GetPoint and you want "0" to return (0,0,0) instead of the number zero, then set acceptZero = false.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.AcceptPoint(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If you want to allow the user to be able to type in a point then call AcceptPoint(true) before calling GetPoint()/GetObject(). If the user chooses to type in a number, then the result code GetResult.Point is returned and you can use RhinoGet.Point() to get the value of the point.
member.param: true if user is able to type in a point.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.AcceptColor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If you want to allow the user to be able to type in a color r,g,b or name during GetPoint.Get(), GetObject::GetObjects(), etc., then call AcceptColor(true) before calling GetPoint()/GetObject(). If the user chooses to type in a color, then the result code GetResult.Color is returned and you can use RhinoGet.Color() to get the value of the color. If the get accepts points, then the user will not be able to type in r,g,b colors but will be able to type color names.
member.param: true if user is able to type a color.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.AcceptString(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If you want to allow the user to be able to type in a string during GetPoint.Get(), GetObject::GetObjects(), etc., then call AcceptString(true) before calling GetPoint()/GetObject(). If the user chooses to type in a string, then the result code GetResult.String is returned and you can use RhinoGet.String() to get the value of the string.
member.param: true if user is able to type a string.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.PickRectangle
member.summary: If the get was a GetObjects() and the mouse was used to select the objects, then the returned rect has left < right and top < bottom. This rect is the Windows GDI screen coordinates of the picking rectangle. RhinoViewport.GetPickXform( pick_rect, pick_xform ) will calculate the picking transformation that was used. In all other cases, left=right=top=bottom=0;
member.returns: The picking rectangle; or 0 in the specified cases.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.Point2d
member.summary: Returns location in view of point in selected in GetPoint::Get() or GetPoint::Get2dPoint(). (0,0) = upper left corner of window.
member.returns: The location.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.Rectangle2d
member.summary: Returns the location in the view of the 2d rectangle selected in GetPoint::Get2dRectangle(). rect.left < rect.right and rect.top < rect.bottom (0,0) = upper left corner of window.
member.returns: The rectangle.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.Custom.GetBaseClass.Line2d
member.summary:
Returns two points defining the location in the view window of the 2d line selected in GetPoint::Get2dLine().
(0,0) = upper left corner of window.
member.returns: An array with two 2D points.

member.name: T:Rhino.Input.RhinoGet
member.summary:
Base class for GetObject, GetPoint, GetSphere, etc.
You will never directly create a RhinoGet but you will use its member functions after calling GetObject::GetObjects(), GetPoint::GetPoint(), and so on.
Provides tools to set command prompt, set command options, and specify if the "get" can optionally accept numbers, nothing (pressing enter), and undo.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.RhinoGet.StringToCommandOptionName(System.String)
member.summary: Convert some arbitrary string value to a valid command option name removing any invalid characters.
member.param: String to convert.
member.returns: Returns null if the string is null or empty or if it contains nothing but invalid characters. If the converted string is one or more characters in length then the converted value is returned.

member.name: M:Rhino.Input.RhinoGet.StringToCommandOptionName(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Convert some arbitrary string value to a valid command option name removing any invalid characters.
member.param: English string to convert.
Optional localized string to convert.
member.returns: Returns null if the strings are null or empty or if they contain nothing but invalid characters. If the converted string is one or more charcters in length then a is returned characters the converted string values. If the localized string is null or empty then the English string is used as the localized value.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.GetResult.Miss

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.GetResult.Point2d

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.GetResult.Line2d
member.summary: User picked a 2d line in CRhinoGetPoint::Get2dLine() call Line2d() to get the line and View() to get the view.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.GetResult.Rectangle2d
member.summary: User picked a 2d rectangle in CRhinoGetPoint::Get2dRectangle() call Rectangle2d() to get the rectangle and View() to get the view.

member.summary: User selected an object - call Object() to get object.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.GetResult.String
member.summary: User typed a string - call String() to get the string.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.GetResult.CustomMessage

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.GetResult.Timeout
member.summary: The getter waited for the amount of time specifed in RhinoGet::SetWaitDuration() and then gave up.

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.GetResult.Cylinder

member.name: F:Rhino.Input.GetResult.Sphere

member.name: T:Rhino.Commands.Style
member.summary: Defines bitwise mask flags for different styles of commands, such as Hidden or DoNotRepeat.

member.name: F:Rhino.Commands.Style.None
member.summary: No flag is defined.

member.name: F:Rhino.Commands.Style.Hidden
member.summary: Also known as a "test" command. The command name does not auto-complete when typed on the command line an is therefore not discoverable. Useful for writing commands that users don't normally have access to.

member.name: F:Rhino.Commands.Style.ScriptRunner
member.summary: For commands that want to run scripts as if they were typed at the command line (like RhinoScript's RunScript command)

member.name: F:Rhino.Commands.Style.Transparent
member.summary: Transparent commands can be run inside of other commands. The command does not modify the contents of the model's geometry in any way. Examples of transparent commands include commands that change views and toggle snap states. Any command that adds or deletes, a view cannot be transparent.

member.name: F:Rhino.Commands.Style.DoNotRepeat
member.summary: The command should not be repeated by pressing "ENTER" immediately after the command finishes.

member.name: F:Rhino.Commands.Style.NotUndoable
member.summary: By default, all commands are undoable.

member.name: T:Rhino.Commands.RunMode
member.summary: Provides enumerated constants for a command running mode. This is currently interactive or scripted.

member.name: F:Rhino.Commands.RunMode.Interactive
member.summary: Can use dialogs for input. Must use message boxes to report serious error conditions.

member.name: F:Rhino.Commands.RunMode.Scripted
member.summary: All input must come from command line, GetPoint, GetObject, GetString, etc. Must use message boxes to report serious error conditions. Script mode gets used when a command is run with a hyphen (-) prefix.

member.name: M:Rhino.Commands.Command.ReplayHistory(Rhino.DocObjects.ReplayHistoryData)
member.summary:
Repeats an operation of a command.
In order to make this function work, you will likely need to grab the Result property that gives the list of input objects. Then, you will be able to replace these inputs by using one of the UpdateToX() methods of the ReplayHistoryResult.
You should NOT use any document AddX() or ReplaceX() functions, as they will break history.
member.param: The replay history information.
member.returns:
true if the operation succeeded.
The default implementation always returns false.

Attributes for the view mode you are supplying meshes for. Will be null if this is a modal rendering.

member.name: E:Rhino.RhinoDoc.ActiveDocumentChanged
member.summary: This event is raised when the active document used by modeless user interface changes. On Mac Rhino this will get raised before the , and events. Mac Rhino will also raise this event with 0 for the document Id and a null document pointer when the last document is closed. Windows Rhino will raise this event after the , and events when a new or existing model is opened.

member.name: E:Rhino.RhinoDoc.ReplaceRhinoObject
member.summary:
Called if an object is about to be replaced. If both RhinoDoc.UndoActive() and RhinoDoc.RedoActive() return false, then immediately after the ReplaceObject event, there will be a DeleteObject event followed by an AddObject event.
If either RhinoDoc.UndoActive() or RhinoDoc::RedoActive() return true, then immediately after the ReplaceObject event, there will be a DeleteObject event followed by an UndeleteObject event.

member.name: M:Rhino.PlugIns.PlugIn.WriteDocument(Rhino.RhinoDoc,Rhino.FileIO.BinaryArchiveWriter,Rhino.FileIO.FileWriteOptions)
member.summary: Called when Rhino is saving a .3dm file to allow the plug-in to save document user data.
member.param: The Rhino document instance that is being saved.

OpenNURBS file archive object Rhino is using to write the file. Use BinaryArchiveWriter.Write*() functions to write plug-in data. OR use the ArchivableDictionary
If any BinaryArchiveWriter.Write*() functions throw an exception, then archive.WriteErrorOccured will be true and you should immediately return. Setting archive.WriteErrorOccured to true will cause Rhino to stop saving the file.
The file write options, such as "include preview image" and "include render meshes".

member.param: A Rhino document that is being loaded.

OpenNURBS file archive object Rhino is using to read this file. Use BinaryArchiveReader.Read*() functions to read plug-in data.
If any BinaryArchive.Read*() functions throws an exception then archive.ReadErrorOccurve will be true and you should immediately return.
Describes what is being written.

member.name: M:Rhino.PlugIns.PlugIn.GetLicense(Rhino.PlugIns.LicenseBuildType,Rhino.PlugIns.ValidateProductKeyDelegate,Rhino.PlugIns.OnLeaseChangedDelegate)
member.summary: Verifies that there is a valid product license for your plug-in, using the Rhino licensing system. If the plug-in is installed as a standalone node, the locally installed license will be validated. If the plug-in is installed as a network node, a loaner license will be requested by the system's assigned Zoo server. If the Zoo server finds and returns a license, then this license will be validated. If no license is found, then the user will be prompted to provide a license key, which will be validated.
member.param: The product build contentType required by your plug-in.

Since the Rhino licensing system knows nothing about your product license, you will need to validate the product license provided by the Rhino licensing system. This is done by supplying a callback function, or delegate, that can be called to perform the validation.
Called by the ZooClient when the cloud zoo lease is changed.
member.returns: true if a valid license was found. false otherwise.

member.name: M:Rhino.PlugIns.PlugIn.GetLicense(Rhino.PlugIns.LicenseCapabilities,System.String,Rhino.PlugIns.ValidateProductKeyDelegate,Rhino.PlugIns.OnLeaseChangedDelegate)
member.summary: Verifies that there is a valid product license for your plug-in, using the Rhino licensing system. If the plug-in is installed as a standalone node, the locally installed license will be validated. If the plug-in is installed as a network node, a loaner license will be requested by the system's assigned Zoo server. If the Zoo server finds and returns a license, then this license will be validated. If no license is found, then the user will be prompted to provide a license key, which will be validated.
member.param: In the event that a license was not found, or if the user wants to change the way your plug-in is licenses, then provide what capabilities your license has by using this enumeration flag.

In the event that the user needs to be asked for a license, then you can provide a text mask, which helps the user to distinguish between proper and improper user input of your license code. Note, if you do not want to use a text mask, then pass in a null value for this parameter. For more information on text masks, search MSDN for the System.Windows.Forms.MaskedTextBox class.

Since the Rhino licensing system knows nothing about your product license, you will need to validate the product license provided by the Rhino licensing system. This is done by supplying a callback function, or delegate, that can be called to perform the validation.
Called by the ZooClient when the cloud zoo lease is changed.
member.returns: true if a valid license was found. false otherwise.

member.name: M:Rhino.PlugIns.PlugIn.ReturnLicense
member.summary: Returns, or releases, a product license that was obtained from the Rhino licensing system. Note, most plug-ins do not need to call this as the Rhino licensing system will return all licenses when Rhino shuts down.

member.name: M:Rhino.PlugIns.RenderPlugIn.UiContentTypes
member.summary: Override this method to provide the UUIDs of all content types that should be presented to the user in the types combo box or the[+] button types menu.The default implementation adds only RDK's built-in types. Rhino automatically adds types in the most efficient way to minimize the list length. If you override this method, you may call the base class first to add the built-in types, a separator will be inserted at the end of the standard list followed by your own types. You may omit the base class call and only chosen types yourself, followed by a separator and your own types. A 'More Types...' item is automatically added when needed by Rhino. Specify a separator by adding uuidUiContentType_Separator.
member.remarks: You should add \e all types you would want to appear in any context, regardless of their content kind. Rhino ensures that only types that make sense will actually be presented to the user in a given context.
member.returns: Return a Id list of content types to display in content browsers

member.name: M:Rhino.PlugIns.RenderPlugIn.RenderSettingsSections
member.summary: Override this method to provide the UUIDs of all sections that should be displayed in the Render Settings tab when this is the current renderer.The default implementation adds all the RDK's built-in Render Settings sections. These UUIDs start with the prefix uuidRenderSettingsSection'. They can be found in RhRdkUuids.h
member.remarks: You should add \e all sections you would want to appear in any context.
member.returns: Return a Id list of content types to display in content browsers

member.name: M:Rhino.PlugIns.RenderPlugIn.GetRenderSettingsSections
member.summary: This function returns a list of uuid for the render settings pages that should be displayed.
member.returns: Return a Id list of of the Render settings sections that will be displayed

member.returns: One of PreviewRenderTypes

member.name: M:Rhino.PlugIns.RenderPlugIn.CreatePreview(Rhino.Render.CreatePreviewEventArgs)
member.summary:
Creates the preview bitmap that will appear in the content editor's thumbnail display when previewing materials and environments. If this function is not overridden or the PreviewImage is not set on the args, then the internal OpenGL renderer will generate a simulation of the content.
This function is called with four different preview quality settings. The first quality level of RealtimeQuick is called on the main thread and needs to be drawn as fast as possible. This function is called with the other three quality settings on a separate thread and are meant for generating progressively refined preview.
member.param: Event argument with several preview option state properties.

member.name: M:Rhino.PlugIns.RenderPlugIn.CreateTexture2dPreview(Rhino.Render.CreateTexture2dPreviewEventArgs)
member.summary:
Creates the preview bitmap that will appear in the content editor's thumbnail display when previewing textures in 2d (UV) mode.
If this function is not overridden or the PreviewImage is not set on the args, then the internal OpenGL renderer will generate a simulation.
member.param: Event argument with several preview option state properties.

member.summary: Default implementation returns true which means the content can be picked from the content browser by the user. Override this method and return false if you don't want to allow a certain content contentType to be picked from the content browser while your render engine is current.
member.param: A render context.
member.returns: true if the operation was successful.

member.name: M:Rhino.PlugIns.DigitizerPlugIn.EnableDigitizer(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Called by Rhino to enable/disable input from the digitizer. If enable is true and EnableDigitizer() returns false, then Rhino will not calibrate the digitizer.
member.param: If true, enable the digitizer. If false, disable the digitizer.
member.returns: true if the operation succeeded; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Rhino.PlugIns.DigitizerPlugIn.DigitizerUnitSystem
member.summary: Unit system of the points the digitizer passes to SendPoint(). Rhino uses this value when it calibrates a digitizer. This unit system must be not change.

member.name: P:Rhino.PlugIns.DigitizerPlugIn.PointTolerance
member.summary: The point tolerance is the distance the digitizer must move (in digitizer coordinates) for a new point to be considered real rather than noise. Small desktop digitizer arms have values like 0.001 inches and 0.01 millimeters. This value should never be smaller than the accuracy of the digitizing device.

member.name: M:Rhino.PlugIns.DigitizerPlugIn.SendPoint(Rhino.Geometry.Point3d,Rhino.UI.MouseButton,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: If the digitizer is enabled, call this function to send a point to Rhino. Call this function as much as you like. The digitizers that Rhino currently supports send a point every 15 milliseconds or so. This function should be called when users press or release any digitizer button.
member.param: 3d point in digitizer coordinates.
corresponding digitizer button is down.
true if the Shift keyboard key was pressed. Otherwise, false.
true if the Control keyboard key was pressed. Otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Rhino.PlugIns.DigitizerPlugIn.SendRay(Rhino.Geometry.Ray3d,Rhino.UI.MouseButton,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: If the digitizer is enabled, call this function to send a point and direction to Rhino. Call this function as much as you like. The digitizers that Rhino currently supports send a point every 15 milliseconds or so. This function should be called when users press or release any digitizer button.
member.param: 3d ray in digitizer coordinates.
corresponding digitizer button is down.
true if the Shift keyboard key was pressed. Otherwise, false.
true if the Control keyboard key was pressed. Otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Rhino.RhinoApp
member.summary: .NET RhinoApp is parallel to C++ CRhinoApp.

member.name: P:Rhino.RhinoApp.SdkVersion
member.summary:
Rhino SDK 9 digit SDK version number in the form YYYYMMDDn
Rhino will only load plug-ins that were build with exactly the same version of the SDK.

member.name: P:Rhino.RhinoApp.SdkServiceRelease
member.summary:
Rhino SDK 9 digit SDK service release number in the form YYYYMMDDn
Service service release of the Rhino SDK supported by this executable. Rhino will only load plug-ins that require a service release of <= this release number. For example, SR1 will load all plug-ins made with any SDK released up through and including the SR1 SDK. But, SR1 will not load a plug-in built using the SR2 SDK. If an "old" Rhino tries to load a "new" plug-in, the user is told that they have to get a free Rhino.exe update in order for the plug-in to load. Rhino.exe updates are available from http://www.rhino3d.com.

member.name: P:Rhino.RhinoApp.ExeServiceRelease
member.summary: Service release version of Rhino executable (0, 1, 2, ...) The integer is the service release number of Rhino. For example, this function returns "0" if Rhino V4SR0 is running and returns "1" if Rhino V4SR1 is running.

member.name: M:Rhino.RhinoApp.SetCommandPromptMessage(System.String)
member.summary: Set the text that appears in the Rhino command prompt. In general, you should use the SetCommandPrompt functions. In rare cases, like worker thread messages, the message that appears in the prompt has non-standard formatting. In these rare cases, SetCommandPromptMessage can be used to literally specify the text that appears in the command prompt window.
member.param: A literal text for the command prompt window.

member.name: M:Rhino.RhinoApp.RunScript(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Runs a Rhino command script.
member.param: [in] script to run.
Controls how the script is echoed in the command output window. false = silent - nothing is echoed. true = verbatim - the script is echoed literally.
member.remarks: Rhino acts as if each character in the script string had been typed in the command prompt. When RunScript is called from a "script runner" command, it completely runs the script before returning. When RunScript is called outside of a command, it returns and the script is run. This way menus and buttons can use RunScript to execute complicated functions.
member.exception: If RunScript is being called while inside an event watcher.

member.name: M:Rhino.RhinoApp.ExecuteCommand(Rhino.RhinoDoc,System.String)
member.summary: Execute a Rhino command.
member.param: Document to execute the command for
Name of command to run. Use command's localized name or preface with an underscore.
member.returns: Returns the reult of the command.

member.param: [in] script to run.
[in] String to display in the most recent command list.
Controls how the script is echoed in the command output window. false = silent - nothing is echoed. true = verbatim - the script is echoed literally.
member.remarks: Rhino acts as if each character in the script string had been typed in the command prompt. When RunScript is called from a "script runner" command, it completely runs the script before returning. When RunScript is called outside of a command, it returns and the script is run. This way menus and buttons can use RunScript to execute complicated functions.
member.exception: If RunScript is being called while inside an event watcher.

member.name: M:Rhino.RhinoApp.GetPlugInObject(System.Guid)
member.summary: Gets the object that is returned by PlugIn.GetPlugInObject for a given plug-in. This function attempts to find and load a plug-in with a given Id. When a plug-in is found, it's GetPlugInObject function is called and the result is returned here. Note the plug-in must have already been installed in Rhino or the plug-in manager will not know where to look for a plug-in with a matching id.
member.param: Guid for a given plug-in.
member.returns: Result of PlugIn.GetPlugInObject for a given plug-in on success.

member.name: M:Rhino.RhinoApp.GetPlugInObject(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the object that is returned by PlugIn.GetPlugInObject for a given plug-in. This function attempts to find and load a plug-in with a given name. When a plug-in is found, it's GetPlugInObject function is called and the result is returned here. Note the plug-in must have already been installed in Rhino or the plug-in manager will not know where to look for a plug-in with a matching name.
member.param: Name of a plug-in.
member.returns: Result of PlugIn.GetPlugInObject for a given plug-in on success.

member.name: M:Rhino.RhinoMath.IsValidDouble(System.Double)
member.summary:
Determines whether a value is valid within the RhinoCommon context.
Rhino does not use Double.NaN by convention, so this test evaluates to true if:
x is not equal to RhinoMath.UnsetValue
System.Double.IsNaN(x) evaluates to false
System.Double.IsInfinity(x) evaluates to false
member.param: number to test for validity.
member.returns: true if the number if valid, false if the number is NaN, Infinity or Unset.

member.name: M:Rhino.RhinoMath.IsValidSingle(System.Single)
member.summary:
Determines whether a value is valid within the RhinoCommon context.
Rhino does not use Single.NaN by convention, so this test evaluates to true if:
x is not equal to RhinoMath.UnsetValue,
System.Single.IsNaN(x) evaluates to false
System.Single.IsInfinity(x) evaluates to false
member.param: number to test for validity.
member.returns: true if the number if valid, false if the number is NaN, Infinity or Unset.

member.name: M:Rhino.PersistentSettingsConverter.TryParseDouble(System.String,System.Double@)
member.summary: Converts the string representation of a number to its double-precision floating-point number equivalent. A return value indicates whether the conversion succeeded or failed. system culture.
member.param: A string containing a number to convert.

When this method returns, contains the double-precision floating-point number equivalent of the s parameter, if the conversion succeeded, or zero if the conversion failed. The conversion fails if the s parameter is null or Empty, is not a number in a valid format, or represents a number less than MinValue or greater than MaxValue. This parameter is passed uninitialized; any value originally supplied in result will be overwritten.
member.returns: Returns true if s was converted successfully; otherwise, false..

member.name: M:Rhino.PlugInSettings.WriteToStream(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructs a temporary file and write plug-in and plug-in command settings to the temp file. Only writes PersistentSettings that contain one or more item with a value that differs from the default value.

member.name: M:Rhino.PlugInSettings.ToStream(Rhino.PersistentSettings,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,Rhino.PersistentSettings})
member.summary: Write the specified settings to a MemoryStream
member.param: The settings to write, if null the XML document's settins section will be empty otherwise; it will contain any settings that are not equal to thier default value.
Should be null when writing window positions XML file. If writing plug-in settings then pass the commands dictionary.
member.returns: Returns a stream containg the settings XML document on success otherwise; null.

member.name: F:Rhino.PersistentSettingsManager.m_plugin_id
member.summary: If this settings PersistentSettingsManager is created by plug-in provided DLL then save the plug-in ID so that when the plug-in requests its setting it will get the same PersistentSettingsManager

member.name: M:Rhino.PersistentSettingsManager.#ctor(System.Reflection.Assembly,System.Guid)
member.summary: PersistentSettingsManager constructor.
member.param: Requires a valid Assembly object to attach to.
Optional plug-in Id which identifies the plug-in associated with this settings class.

member.name: M:Rhino.PersistentSettingsManager.#ctor(System.Guid)
member.summary: PersistentSettingsManager constructor.
member.param: Requires a valid pluginId to attach to

member.name: M:Rhino.PersistentSettingsManager.#ctor(Rhino.Runtime.Skin)
member.summary: PersistentSettingsManager constructor.

member.name: P:Rhino.PersistentSettingsManager.PluginSettings
member.summary: Gets the Plug-in settings associated with this plug-in, if this is the first time called then the plug-in settings member variable will get initialized and if a settings file exists it will get loaded.

member.name: P:Rhino.PersistentSettingsManager.WindowPositionSettings
member.summary: Gets the window position settings associated with this plug-in, if this is the first time called then the window position settings member variable will get initialized and if a settings file exists it will get loaded.

member.name: M:Rhino.PersistentSettingsManager.CommandSettings(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the PersistentSettings associated with the specified command. If the settings file has not been previously loaded and exists then it will get read. If the command name is not in the command settings dictionary then a new entry will get created and its settings will be returned.
member.param: Command name key to search for and/or add.
member.returns: Returns PersistentSettings object associated with command name on success or null on error.

member.name: M:Rhino.PersistentSettingsManager.ContainsChangedValues
member.summary: Check the plug-in and command settings dictionaries for values that have changed.
member.returns: Returns true if either the plug-ins or commands dictionaries contains a changed item otherwise false.

member.name: M:Rhino.PersistentSettingsManager.ClearChangedFlag
member.summary: Clear changed flag for all values

member.name: M:Rhino.PersistentSettingsManager.ContainsModifiedValues
member.summary: Check the plug-in and command settings dictionaries for values other than default value.
member.returns: Returns true if either the plug-ins or commands dictionaries contains a modified item otherwise false.

member.name: M:Rhino.PersistentSettingsManager.WriteSettings(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If they exist and contain modified values write global settings first then local settings.
member.param: Will be true if this is getting called when Rhino is closing otherwise it will be false.
member.returns: Returns true if local settings were successfully written.
